loans.name: Ahoéfa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ahoéfa A. was born in 1953 and is a widow and mother of five children. She sells basic food items and especially fried fish. She purchases fish to fry and sell by the piece to customers. Since she does not have much in the way of financial means, she is asking for a loan of US$ 800 which will allow her to procure more fish on a regular basis to better satisfy her customers' needs and increase her income from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1953, Madame A. Ahoéfa est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Revendeuse de denrées alimentaires et surtout de poissons frits pour la cuisine. Elle se procure de poissons, les fait frire et les revend en détail aux consommateurs. Manque de moyens financiers, elle sollicite un financement de $800 qui va lui servir d’augmenter l’approvisionnement en poissons pour mieux satisfaire son environnement et aussi accroître le rendement de ses activités afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
purchase and re-sale of basic food items

achat et vente de denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en: I am Parween A. from Borewala, a small town in Pakistan. I have lived all my life in this town. My husband operates an electronics store. Now, he requires a loan to buy some items for his electronics store.  I would like to borrow in a group of few women: Nasreen A. needs loan to buy goats for their livestock trading. Rubina B. wants to open up a grocery store. Nargis B. will use the loan for the repair of their rickshaw. Saleema B. also wants a loan for her son’s grocery store. Rahima B. is a widow and sells cloth.

loans.use: Expand electronics store

loans.name: Akhteri's Group

texts.en: I am Akhteri B. from a lush green town Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. I was married 20 years ago and have nine kids: four boys and five girls. All of my kids attend school and I want to find them decent jobs for themselves. My husband works at a brick furnace and I sell milk from my house to support his income. I own two cows at present. My group members are: Asghari B. and Hussaini B. both need to buy separate dairy cows. Lastly, Sakina B. runs a grocery store. Please help all of us and support us to grow our businesses.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a member of Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, and is located at Jr Madre de Dios 547, in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 65 years old, has 8 children and her husband has retired. Juana invested her first $100 loan from Manuela Ramos in a shop selling soft drinks and snacks.

She starts her day at 6am to prepare breakfast for her family, after which she works in her shop until 8pm.

With this next loan of $625, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 10 crates of soft drinks and snacks, such as biscuits, cheese puffs, sweets, lollipops, bubble gum and chocolate.

Juana is very happy as her business is gradually growing, and her family is very proud of her.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Jr Madre de Dios No 547, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 65 años y es madre de 8 hijos, su esposo es jubilado. Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de ventas de gaseosas y golosinas.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de gaseosas y golosinas, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de sus gaseosas y golosinas hasta las 8pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará : 10 cajas de gaseosas, golosinas en general como: galletas, chisitos, caramelos, chupetines, chicles. Chocolates, etc.

Juana esta muy feliz, porque su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco, pero tiene la satisfacción de que su familia esta muy orgullosa de ella .

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and snacks for her shop

loans.name: Deyling

texts.es:
Mr. M. is a master builder who resides in the city of Juigalpa, specifically in the section called Barrio Pedre Miguel. His nuclear family includes two children, six years old and three year old respectively, and his wife. Through his daily work, he supports his family; through loans, he has been able to improve his home. However, he now needs to repair the kitchen, which is in bad shape, and he urges you to help him make this repair before wintertime arrives. In addition to his daily work, Mr. M. has a small factory that manufactures cement products like washtubs, blocks, concrete posts, and fireboxes, as well as decorations made of this material. He counts on this to give him the ability to repay the loan and so provide his family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. M. es constructor empirico (maestro de obra) reside en esta ciudad de Juigalpa, propiamente en el Barrio Pedre Miguel, reparto Mitch casa # 2 en el 3er anden, su nucleo familiar son 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años respectivamente y su esposa; el con su trabajo diario mantiene a la familia; a traves de creditos ha logrado mejorar su casa, sin embargo aun le falta repara la cocina que esta en mal estado y le urge esa reparacion antes que llegue la epoca del invierno. El Sr. M. ademas de su trabajo diario tiene una pequeña fabrica de productos de cemento como lavanderos, bloques, postes de concreto y fogones, como tambien adornos de ese material, por lo que cuenta con la capacidad de pago para el credito y asi brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

loans.use: To make improvements to his home

loans.name: Mena Group

texts.en: David M. S. is the group leader and cattle rearer.  Umu J. and Unisa A. K. are subsistence farmers and traders.  They grow rice, peanuts and beans. At the same time, they purchase the crops from other farmers.  With their previous loans, they increased their stocks and made good income which they invested in expanding the family farms and meeting their children's educational expenses.  The members would like to continue expanding their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of 3,500,000 SLL.  David, the group leader, is 48 years old and married with 5 children.

loans.use: Expand the livestock and farming activities

loans.name: Mayra Luz

texts.es:
Señora Mayra Luz M. M. belongs to the Credit Group known as "The Dynamics". She lives in the Region and Province of San Martin, district of Tarapoto. Her residence is located on Jr. Saens Peña, and she runs her business in the Nº 2 Market Jr. Holy Rose Nº 379 (Santa Rose store). She is dedicated to the wholesale and retail sale of dry salted fish.

The opportunity of a loan from Manuela Ramos opened doors for her to buy her product in greater quantity, since she has much demand. Her goal is to buy her product directly from the supplier without intermediaries. To achieve this she needs more capital, which will permit her to supply more clients and to meet her personal goals.

With the loan received of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy dry salted fish in bags of 50 kilograms, in greater quantity and of every size and variety.

Señora Mayra Light, lives with her 2 children and her husband. She works tirelessly to be able to see the results and to feel useful in life, therefore she has with many prospects in the future.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mayra Luz M. M. pertenece al Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las Dinámicas”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Saens Peña, y desarrolla su negocio en el Mercado Nº 2 Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 379 (Almacén Santa Rosa) se dedica a la venta al por mayor y menor de pescado seco salado.

La oportunidad de un préstamo en Manuela Ramos le abrió puertas para comprar en mayor cantidad su producto ya que tiene buena demanda. Su meta es comprar su producto directo del proveedor sin intermediarios, para lograr esto necesita un buen capital, lo que le permitirá abastecer a más clientes y cumplir con sus metas personales.

Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1000.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará pescado seca salado en sacos de 50 kilos, en mayor cantidad y de todo tamaño y variedad.

La señora Mayra Luz, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo trabaja incansablemente para poder ver los resultados y sentirse útil en la vida, pues ella tiene con muchas perspectivas en el futuro

loans.use: To buy dried, salted fish for resale.

loans.name: Zulma Diana

texts.es:
Zulma Diana V. D. Zavaleta is married, 30 years of age. She completed secondary school but did not continue her studies after she married. She has 2 young children, both of school age. She used to sell food in the market, but after a short while they left. She was left with nothing and wanted desperately to restart her business. This is why she accepted her friend's invitation to join the Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS“, and with the first loan of S/. 300.00, she started her business selling groceries from home, in the Salaverry district in Trujillo, in the La Libertad department. With this money she bought vegetables, chicken, potatoes, peppers, etc. With the loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will pay back in 6 installments, she wants to invest in buying rice, sugar, oil and condiments. This member wants to continue working in order to educate her children and have a stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Zulma Diana V. D. Zavaleta, está casada, tiene 30 años, estudió secundaria completa, no continuó estudiando porque se casó, tiene 02 hijos pequeños estudiantes del nivel primaria. Anteriormente vendía comida en el mercado como ambulante, pero al poco tiempo la desalojaron del lugar, se quedó sin nada y quería retomar su negocio por eso es que aceptó la invitación D. una amiga para participar en el Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS“, y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió inició su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes en su casa ubicada en el Distrito D. Salaverry en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Con este dinero compró verdura, pollo, papa, ají, etc. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, condimentos. La socia piensa seguir trabajando para educar a sus hijos y sueña con tener una bodega surtida.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her business

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose Manuel D. L. M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

"My name is Jose Manuel D. L. M.. I am married and I have two children. My mom also lives with us and we need to construct in our home a wall since there is a lot of insecurity. We also need to finish the repairs on a bathroom because the one we have is very small and has a lot of humidity. For lack of money, we have not been able to finish these projects. For this reason we are requesting this support. I work in a warehouse of Coca Cola and my wife is an operator in an assembly plant. We both have some years working here."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Mi nombre es Jose Manuel D. L. M., soy casado y tengo 2 hijos, mi mama vive también con nosotros y necesitamos construir en nuestra casa una barda ya que hay mucha inseguridad, también necesito terminar la reparacion D. un baño porque el que tenemos esta muy pequeño y tiene mucha humedad, por falta D. dinero no hemos podido realizar estos proyectos es por eso que solicitamos este apoyo, yo trabajo en un Almacén D. la Coca Cola y mi esposa es operadora en una Maquila los dos tenemos algunos años trabajando ahí”

loans.use: Construct a wall and repair a bathroom.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry B. is married and has 3 children. He has received first degree education. Henry sells computers and their accessories at Bakano in Cape Coast, which he has done since 2004. His wife is a businesswoman.

Henry uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and utility bills. Henry will use the loan to purchase more computers and accessories. With the new profits from his expanded business, Henry plans to increase the sale of computers and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more computers and accessories for re-sale

loans.name: Rehema M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Rehema M. M. from Tukuyu. Married with two children between the ages of 5 and 11, she is also responsible for supporting two nephews because their parents abandoned them. Rehema has been running a cereal shop since 1999, selling commodities such as maize, beans, groundnuts, and rice. Assisted by her husband, she works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and earns about $45 monthly.

She is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase cereal crops in bulk for reselling. In the future, she plans to have a milling factory in order to mill maize flour. Rehema thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cereal crops in bulk for reselling.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Miriam es soltera y a sus 21 años de edad está estudiando en una universidad particular. Menciona que su mayor reto ha sido estudiar en una universidad. En la actualidad tiene un negocio de venta de detergente y champú, los cuales lo vende de manera ambulatoria, también menciona que empezó con muy poca inversión, con media caja de jabones específicamente, y ahora vende por cajas los jabones y está creciendo. Su mayor dificultad en su negocio es no tener un puesto de venta estable y el préstamo que ella obtiene por parte del movimiento Manuela ramos la beneficia mucho porque le servirá  para invertir tanto en el negocio como en los estudios.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará una caja de jabones, una bolsa de detergente, un paquete de papel higiénico, una caja de crema dental y otros productos.

Miriam desea recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su vida personal. para que pueda vivir mejor, así mismo para mejorar su negocio y para que ella sepa invertir.
texts.en:
Miriam belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres al Progreso” (“Women Progressing”) in the Yungay province of Ancash. Miriam is single and, at 21 years of age, is studying in the university. She mentions that her greatest challenge has been studying at the university. Currently, she has a business selling detergent and shampoo which she sells on foot. She also mentions that she started with a very small investment, specifically, with a half box of soaps and now she sells them by the carton. Her biggest difficulty with the business is not having a stable place to sell from, and the loan that she obtains through Manuela Ramos benefits her greatly because it will allow her to invest both in her business and her education. With this loan of 1,200.00 soles, to be canceled in six installments, she will purchase one box of soap, one bag of detergent, one packet of toilet paper, a box of toothpaste and other products. Miriam hopes to receive training on how to improve her standard of living so she can live better, as well as for her business and on how to invest.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a box of soaps, a bag of detergent, a packet of toilet paper, a box of toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A. O. is a 46-year-old widow and responsible for providing for 5 children. Three of the children are orphans that Pamela cares for, and all 5 children are currently enrolled in school.

Pamela has owned a butcher shop in the market in Rongo, Kenya since 2003. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings ($150.00) to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.use: Buy additional meat for sale

loans.name: Abdul Zihar

texts.en:
Abdul Zihar lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with five children, and he has a small workshop in the city of Kabul. He needs a small loan for his business to become strong and to help his family live better.
 
He requested an individual loan of 50,000 afghani for a term of 12 months, and he wants to grow his business and expand. He also wants to buy necessary materials and complete his stock for his shop so he can start working hard.

He is very happy about having the opportunity for a small loan in Afghanistan and is thankful for this opportunity, especially to the Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To grow his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur who runs a Kindergarten school with fifty school kids and also sells clothes at Kisiwani Ward in Dar es Salaam. She has been running the business for the last four years. She purchases the clothes from Kariakoo and Karume city market centers and sells them to retails customers. Her husband has passed away leaving her with a single kid who is in standard four. She plans to expand her school by building more classes. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000. to boost up the business.

loans.use: To buy more school items

loans.name: Maria Luz,

texts.es:
Durante siete años Luz atiende en su librería propia que por ahora no esta funcionando ya que esta remodelando el local de esta para tener un espacio mas grande donde pueda caber una mercadería mas grande. Todos sus productos se encuentran en la casa de su hermana hasta el término dela construcción. 
A la par, ella también se dedica a  ofrecer servicio de limpieza en un hospital desde hace tres años. Antes de su librería Luz trabajaba vendiendo frutas en el mercado, sin embargo el cuidado de sus hijos, quienes en ese entonces estaban pequeños aun, decidió formar un negocio que no la aleje de su casa.
Sus ganancias en gran parte la reinvierte en la librería, solo una pequeña fracción las destina para los gastos de su casa. Poco a poco quiere llegar a tener una librería que esté surtida en todo.
Enrejado de su nuevo local para que este asegurado
texts.en:
During 7 years, Luz has attended her own book store which for now is not working, since she is remodeling the space to have a biggger space where she can fit a larger merchandise. All of her products are found in her sisters houe until she finishes construction. She is also dedicated to offering cleaning service in a hospital for three years. Before her bookstore, Luz worked selling fruits in the market, of course raising her children, who were still little though, so she decided to form a business which didn't take her away from her home. Her earnings are largely reinvested in the bookstore, only a small fraction is destined for her household expenses. Little by little she wants to get to having a bookstore which is fully stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling her bookstore to be secure

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth  inició el negocio  porqué es una persona muy activa y siempre le han gustado las ventas y como la pensionaron le quedaba mucho tiempo libre además de que puede contribuir con los ingresos familiares.
 Comenzó el negocio En Marzo de 2005 con una mesita en la cochera de su casa y al poco tiempo ya tenía muchos clientes ya que no hay ningún negocio de este tipo cerca de su casa que venda comida por las mañanas, entonces un cliente le sugirió que buscara un lugar  en la avenida principal de la colonia para que estuviera mejor ubicada, por lo cual puso su negocio a media cuadra de su casa y desde entonces le ha ido mejor. 
 
Poco a poco ha ido afianzando su negocio y ha podido comprar algunas cosas que le hacían falta, como ollas de mejor calidad, mesas y sillas para que sus clientes puedan disfrutar la comida también compro una estufa un poquito más grande y una sombrilla  para cubrirse del sol y la lluvia.


Ella  necesita un prestamo por MXN $4000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas  para   comprar materia prima para elaboración de mis comidas tal como carne, tortilla, verduras, pan francés aceite, frijol, vasos y platos desechables, etc.
texts.en:
Elizabeth started her business because she is an active person and has always enjoyed sales. At the time she had been laid-off so she had time on her hands, plus she wanted to contribute to the family income. She began the business in March of 2005 with a little table in her garage and in no time she had many customers since there was no other business near her home that sold food in the mornings. One customer suggested she find a locale on the neighborhood’s main avenue to be better situated, which put her about half a block from her house. Since then she has done even better. Slowly she has financed her business and has been able to buy needed items such as better cooking pots, tables and chairs for the customers' enjoyment of her food, as well as a bigger stove and an umbrella for protection from the sun and rain. She needs a loan of $4000 MXN, to be repaid in 10 installments, in order to buy raw cooking materials such as meat, tortillas, vegetables, French bread, oil, beans, disposable glasses and plates, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 58 años, vive en su casa propia con sus 2 hijos y 2 nietos. Se dedica al tejido a mano D. prendas, utiliza los palitos a crochet y también los comunes, actividad que realiza en su misma casa con la ayuda D. uno D. sus hijos. Su afición a los tejidos comenzó hace 25 años, cuando empezó a laborar en una fábrica D. chompas, que fue como una escuela D. aprendizaje. DesD. entonces, empezó a tejer D. manera independiente, aplicando bellos puntos en sus tejidos, tiene un catalogo D. modelos que siempre muestra a sus clientes que le garantizan un retorno seguro. También produce en cantidades necesarias para vender a comerciantes D. su confianza y por la velocidad que ha adquirido, pueD. llegar a producir hasta 10 chompas por mes. Es la segunda vez que Alejandrina viene solicitando un préstamo a MFP, está muy animada D. continuar un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal, ya que es D. su agrado y renueva una vez más su compromiso D. seguir demostrando puntualidad. El dinero requerido es para la reparación D. su máquina D. tejer y la compra D. lana al por mayor, en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 58 years old, lives in her own home with her two children and two grand-children. She, with the help of one of her children, knits clothing using traditional knitting needles an activity she undertakes at home. Her love of knitting began 25 years ago when she began work in a sweater factory which was like an apprenticeship for her. Since then, she began to knit independently, applying beautiful touches to her work. She has a catalogue of her designs which she always shows to prospective customers thereby guaranteeing a sure return. She also sells to retailers she has gotten to know and, because she has become a fast knitter, can complete up to 10 sweaters per month. This is the second time that Alejandrina has asked for a loan from MFP. She is very eager to continue working with her communal bank since it pleases her and renews her commitment to punctual repayments. Her loan will be used to repair her knitting machine and to buy wool at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her knitting machine.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina P., 24, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience with a general store. She sells to the public 7 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Tina’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Hương Tran Thi (329020886) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Hương owns and operates a business running a general store in the local community, primarily selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Hương has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, Hương joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hương has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Hương is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. Hương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is fifty years old and is married with five children who are all in school. She is married to Mr. A. who is a farmer in the community where they live together with the children.

Adwoa works very hard to provide food for her family. She sells used women’s shoes and slippers and sells through hawking: that is, house to house to house selling. She obtains her stock of goods from Kumasi and retails to her customers through hawking.

Adwoa treks to Kumasi every week for her stock and her reason is that she doesn’t have enough money to buy in bulk. Adwoa is therefore requesting your loan support to avoid frequent traveling to Kumasi. With the loan she wants to buy more slippers and shoes to increase her stock. She belongs to the village called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: To buy more used women's shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth J. is from the town of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Maribeth is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Maribeth owns & operates a business selling cosmetic products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beauty products like hand and body lotion, perfumes and other beauty accessories to tourists and local community members. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Luisa Simeona

texts.es: La Señorita Luisa Simeona R. T.   cuenta con 45  años de edad, es soltera se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeño Micro Empres  a la que se dedica, lleva 15 años de cómo comerciante en la venta de ropa típicas, para mujeres  y se encuentra en el Caserío Tzan Nimasac municipio y  departamento de Totonicapán Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de poder comprar más mercadería como también, obtener mejores diseños y  también poder satisfacer a sus clientes, sobre la  demanda de sus ventas y así poder mejorar, sus ingresos. Pada poder satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Ms. Luisa Simeona R. T. is a 45-year-old single woman who has owned a small business for 15 years, selling traditional women’s clothing. She lives in the Tzan Nimasac hamlet, in the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has risen, but her financial situation does not allow her to increase her capital, which is why she now turns to Asociación ASDIR for a loan with the intention of purchasing more merchandise. She also wants to obtain better designs and be able to satisfy her customer’s demands, so that she can improve her profits and meet her personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita 
Marina es casada tiene 47 años, tres hijos de 28, 21 y  7 años que esta en la escuela estatal.
Marina  tenia su bodega en su casa, la tuvo que cerrar por que  se enfermo y ya no podía atender;   se dedico a tejer chompas a mano para una empresa que exportadora por cuatro  años, hasta que le empezó a doler la espalda  y dejo de tener. Su esposo le regalo una maquina tejedora, se capachito con charlas de cómo hacer chompas, ella vende a los puestos de mercado y a sus vecinas     
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a  llevar sus cuentas entradas salidas y a guardar su capital.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la  compra de una maquina ovilladota, y para la compra de lanas.
El sueño de Marina es crecer en su negocio hasta llegar a exportar a otro país.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Melcochita cooperative bank. Marina is married, 47 years old, and has three children ages 28, 21, and 7 in the public school. Marina had a general store in her home; she had to close it because she became ill and could no longer tend to it. She made hand-knit sweaters for an export company for four years, until her back started to hurt and she had to stop. Her husband gave her a knitting machine, which allowed her to take on projects such as sweaters, which she sells to posts in the market and to neighbors. Since she has been in Finca, she has learned how to track her earnings and expenditures, and how to safeguard her capital. Marina needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy a yarn spinning/winding machine and wools. Marina’s dream is to grow her business until she exports her products to another country.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a yarn spinning/winding machine and wools.

loans.name: Dandy

texts.es:
Dandy trabaja como transportista tiene una movilidad de servicio público en la ciudad de La Paz, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo cual cubre la manutención de su esposa, la cual se encarga de las labores de casa, tiene su pequeño hijo, viven en casa de su tía ubicado en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para el cambio de motor de su movilidad ya que por el permanente uso empezó a tener fallas mecánicas.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Dandy works as a taxi driver. He operates a public service vehicle in the city of La Paz. This is his main source of income with which he pays for the maintenance of his wife, who takes charge of the housework and their small son, They live at the home of his aunt located in the zone of Villa Nuevo Potosí of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to replace the engine in his taxi, since it has begun to fail mechanically from constant use. This is the third loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies Impro to offer him the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a  motor and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Ma. Luningning

texts.en: Ma. Luningning is engaged in a small eatery  business.  She is 49 years old and married to Rolando.  the couple was blessed with a daughter named Mary-Ann, she is now 17 years old and in the high school level.  According to Luningning she needed additional capital for her eatery business to further grow and expand into a bigger one. In this regard, she is asking to borrow loan amounting PHP5, 000 as additional capital. She has been in this business for four years.  She will use the loan to buy spices, meat, rice and other ingredients she needed.  She is hoping that her loan will be granted for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en: Bummi is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells ladies' handbags and sarongs to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time. Bummi is requesting the loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Doña  Juana Francisca Torres, tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el barrio, Pablo Calero, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos el mayor ya casado e independiente, los menores actualmente estudia y en sus tiempos libres le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas, doña Juana desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura ya que ella fue unas de las beneficiadas  con el programa de la reforma agraria, la mayor afectación que se le presenta en el cultivo de piña son los gases del volcán . La señora Juana esta contenta con los interese que son bajos y la aprobación de once créditos ya que durante este tiempo logro tener buenas producciones y cancelas en el tiempo establecido; a la vez con lo que le queda a establecido una manzana mas de cultivo, sus planes es lograr construir su casa ya que la que tiene actualmente es de madera y desea tener una casa seguro para proteger a su familia. con este crédito invertirá en la compra de abonos para mejorar el cultivo y poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado

loans.use: Comprar abono y mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter de l'huile, du haricot, du riz, tomates en boîtes

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are now in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Ramatu is a trader and runs a cold-store in her community. She procures fresh fish and meat from big cold-stores in nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure cartons of fresh fish in bulk.

Ramatu is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Nelida Adriana

texts.es:
La señora  NELIDA ADRIANA, tiene  42 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SANTA ELENA II. Ella tiene estudios de panadería y repostería. Tiene 3 hijos pero solo 2 dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando en el colegio. La socia se dedica  a la preparación de tortas, pasteles y bocaditos, con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró 2 sacos de harina, huevos, mantequilla, pecanas, pasas, etc para la preparación de sus pedidos.
Con este crédito de 500 nuevos soles comprará 2 sacos de harinas y un horno pequeño. Ella sueña con asociarse con una panadería para así poder aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelida Adriana is 42 years old and lives in the district of Esperanca, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the Santa Elena II Community Bank and has studied baking and pastry-making. She has three children, two of whom are still in school and are dependents. Adriana makes a living making tortas, cakes and sandwiches. With her first loan of 300 soles she purchased two sacks of flour, eggs, butter, pecans, raisins and other items to fulfill her orders. With the current loan of 500 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase two sacks of flour and a small oven. Her dream is to become associated with a bakery so she can increase her sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two sacks of flour and a small over

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 58 years old and married with 4 children. He repairs printing machines and sells printing materials. He hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more printing materials to sell. He hopes to expand this business. His greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.en:
For six years Jose has had a pulpería, a small general store operated out of the front of his house. He sells things like rice, beans, sugar and other products that are regularly consumed in a household. He began this business with financing, purchasing merchandise for his inventory which allowed him to start the store.  With his earnings he was able to build up his inventory and now he has a good inventory and both his business and his income continue to grow. 

Jose’s aspirations are to be more economically stable and to finish his higher education. He says that the economic crisis has resulted in high prices and it has generally had a bad effect on people.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Doña Rosibel  vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea, es madre soltera y con grandes sacrificios crió a sus cuatros hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y trabajan, y a pesar que no viven con ella  siempre esta al pendiente de ellos, actualmente ella trabaja como docente de primaria desde hace 15 años, está solicitando su 2do crédito para invertirlo en la construccion de una habitacion. Rosibel es una mujer  con alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral, muy responsable con sus compromisos, su sueño  es estudiar el proximo año para superarse profesionalmente, tener estabilidad, salud  y una vivienda  con mejores condiciones para su familia,  expresa sentirse agradecida con AFODENIC, ya que con los créditos anteriores logro construir poco a poco su vivienda y espera contar con el apoyo de KIVA para continuar mejorando su casa..
texts.en:
Rosibel lives in the town of Nueva Guinea. She is a single mother, and with great sacrifices she raised her four children who have now reached the age of majority and work. Although they no longer live with her she is always worried about them. Currently, she works as an elementary teacher, which she has done for 15 years. She is requesting her second loan to invest it in the construction of a house. Rosibel is a woman with a great spirit of excellence, both personally and in her work; she is very responsible with her commitments. Her dream is to study next year in order to excel professionally, to have stability, good health, and a home with better living conditions for her family. She says that she feels grateful to AFODENIC, as with her previous loans she managed to work bit by bit on the construction of her home, and she hopes to depend on the support of KIVA to continue improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat is a 42-year-old single man who lives with his parents in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his parents live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Along with caring for his parents, Munhbat operates a wooden plank retail business. He purchases planks from Tsenher small administration center in Arhangai province and transports them to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, where he sells them for a profit.

Since he began his business, he has been quite successful with his working capital growing to 6 million tugrugs (~4095 USD). His success has allowed Munhbat to renovate his home and hence to better care for his aging parents. He is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 tugrugs (~ 975 USD) in order to purchase a large amount of wooden planks for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of wooden planks

loans.name: Orzu

texts.en:
Orzu is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He is a humble farmer full of vitality and youth. From his young age, Orzu has been devoted to agricultural tasks. Now, he is the father, which represents a deeper commitment to independently sustain his family through farming. Orzu mainly cultivates onions, potatoes, carrots etc. This father works hard because he wishes to see his children become great professionals and wants his family to prosper economically. Orzu asks for this loan with which he will purchase mineral fertilizer, seeds and other items that are necessary for the preparation of his farmland.       
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: Josefa Esperanza tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedican a este negocio, este no es el primer financiamiento que tiene con Fundación León 2000, por lo que ha sido una experiencia maravillosa pues ha sido de gran ayuda. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, Josefa es una mujer muy humilde, por lo que su actividad está ubicada en su vivienda ella tiene que ir al mercado en busca de los productos, por lo que permanece todo el día en su casa para atender a sus clientes. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, refrescos y gaseosas. Ella sueña con incrementar su negocio y lograr acondicionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Josefa Esperanza is 49 years old. She has a mini-market. She has had this business for over five years. This is not her first loan with Fundación León 2000. It has been a marvelous experience; it has been a great help. Her business is a mini-market. Josefa is a very modest woman, and her business is located in her house. She has to go to the market to look for the products, and she stays in her house all day to wait on her customers. She is requesting this loan in order to buy sweets, natural cold drinks, juices, refreshments, and soft drinks. She dreams of increasing her business and being able to fix up her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fadekemi

texts.en:
To earn a living in Ibadan, Fadekemi sells foodstuffs at retail prices. She is happy in her business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to grow her business. She hopes to a major foodstuffs distributor in the future. 

Fadekemi is 39 years old and married to a teacher. Her husband also supports their home. Her three children are schooling and this gives her joy. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She is a friendly and happy woman. Her husband also works to support their home.
Rose is a trader who makes a living selling groceries and foodstuffs at retail prices in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She says her only challenge is a lack of funds. Rose hopes to overcome this challenge, and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Cerelo

texts.en: Cerelo A. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 43 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Cerelo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month. In 2010, Cerelo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Cerelo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Aslin

texts.en:
Aslin is a 60-year-old woman who is widowed with three children aged from 30 to 36. She lives in Hikkaduwa, a town along the southern coast of Sri Lanka.

Aslin has a tailoring business and, at the moment, she is running the business from her house and receives help from her eldest daughter. Her other children are married. She is a very active and a hard worker, which helps her with her customers. She has lots of experience in this type of business.

Aslin is seeking a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy thread, clothes, and a new sewing machine. In the future, she hopes to eventually open up her own shop, so she does not have to perform her tailoring services from her house. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy thread, clothes and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Mrs. Non S. is 35 years old and lives in Ta Preah village in the Takeo province. She is a dessert and food seller in her local village and her husband Mr. Rat San is a chicken breeder and a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land for cultivating rice to sell to support his family. 

Since her husband’s chicken breeding is going well, she wants to start breeding other animals. To fulfill this purpose, Mrs. Non S. is asking for a loan to buy two oxen to breed and to plow the rice field.

She is a mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in a local public school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to breed and plow the rice field

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong P., 44, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She is employed at a provincial bank for an income of about $1.20 per day. Her husband is taxi driver, earning an income of $9.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to change to a new car for her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: A new car for the taxi business

loans.name: Mrs. Nop Seng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people located in Svay Sar village in TaK. province have selected Mrs. Nop S. as the village bank president. All those members make up a village bank loan and they will each use a small piece of the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Nop S. is 29 years old. She is a pig breeder and she is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Now she has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Nop S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Em Thorn, is a construction worker. She is a mother of two children. One of the children is a student in the local public school and the other one is just three years old. Mrs. Phoeurn Nak is a group guarantor so she is presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr:
B. Joseph est un homme  de 36 ans, marié, née à Rubavu  un des districts de la province de l’Ouest du Rwanda, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il a cinq enfants, le plus âgée a 14 ans et son cadet a 1 an. Un de ses enfants est en troisième année secondaire.
Il est motard c'est-à-dire chauffeur de taxi moto. Client d’ACB depuis janvier 2009, il sollicite un prêt qu’il a très bien remboursé. C’était pour acheter la moto pour taxi.il a contracte un autre nouveau crédit pour les pièces de réparation de ladite moto.son ambition et son souhait et que dans l’avenir et d’avoir deux moto, une à louer et l’autre qu’il utilise comme taxi. Les deux motos vont verser, une partie du revenu sera épargné et l’autre parti améliorera les conditions de vie de la famille en payant les frais de scolarités pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
B. Joseph is a 36-year-old married man, born in Rubavu, Western Province, Rwanda. He has an elementary-level education. He has five children, ranging in age from 1 to 14 years. One of the children is in the third year of secondary school. Mr. B. is a motorcycle taxi driver. A client of ACB since January 2009, he took out a loan to buy his motorcycle taxi, a loan which he fully repaid. He has taken out a second loan for motorcycle parts. His ambition and his desire is to have two motorcycles, one to rent and the other to use as a taxi. The two motorcycles will generate income; part of it will be saved, and the other part will improve his family's living conditions by financing his children's education.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplement the purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Mukunyu Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Doreen, 37 years old and a mother of four children, is married and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been dealing in bridal rental services for four years. She started small but the business has grown over time and she expects it to grow even more. Bridal businesses have grown of recent in the country as people want to make their marriage days colorful and memorable. Doreen wants a loan to purchase bridal gowns.

Doreen is a member of Mukunyu Twekambe group in Kyenjojo, Uganda in which each member guarantees the other for access to credit since most of them do not have collateral security to pledge. It works out in a way that each member knows the credibility and character of the others.

loans.use: To purchase bridal gowns for hire

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two children. She runs a small business selling women’s clothing in one kiosk and sunflower oil and related products in an adjacent kiosk.

Olga has been in the retail business for eleven years. When she started her business the competition was low. Later she decided to diversify her retail business into two parts – clothing and food. This helped Olga to maintain a steady income despite high competition.

This business is the only source of income for Olga’s family. She would like to obtain a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase one more kiosk. She hopes to increase her turnover and make additional income.

loans.use: To purchase one more kiosk

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi T. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 44 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Noemi owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Noemi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. Noemi is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 10th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “OÑONDIVEPA ” está integrada por 11  mujeres del distrito de Acahay, compañía Pintos, departamento de Paraguarí,  entre ellas se encuentran mujeres quienes tienen actividades  como , ventas de comidas , cría de chancho y pollos  otras  se dedican al almacén ; entre ellas también existen  mujeres  quienes desean emprender otras actividades ya que todas son  de escasos recursos. 
Agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por haberles dado la oportunidad de poder realizar una actividad en su propia casa sin descuidar la educación de sus hijos.
         El comité demostró la intención de trabajar  para salir adelante,  se han comprometido en ser solidarias  y responsables ante las situaciones que se puedan presentar.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Amelia quien se dedica a la cría de animales como de cerdos, aves (patos y gallinas), además tiene vacas lecheras.
Todo el trabajo que ella realiza se dirige a al mantenimiento de su familia y de sus animales que es una de las fuentes e ingreso y de alimentación de su familia ya que vende sus animales en el mercado de Ybycui o en ferias productivas que el comité realiza.
Comenta que seguirá trabajando para salir adelante y solicita el préstamo para la compra de tejidos de alambre para la construcción de corrales para sus animales.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa committee is made up of 11 women from the Pintos neighborhood in the Acahay district in the Department of Paraguari. These women make a living through, food sales, raising pigs and chicken as well as running stores. In the group there are also women who wish to start up in other activities though they are all of modest means. They are thankful to the Fundacion Paraguaya for giving them the opportunity to have a business in their homes without having to neglect their children. The committee has the intention of working to be successful and are committed to being supportive and responsible in the face of any situation which may come up. One of the members is Amelia who works raising pigs, poultry (chickens and ducks) as well as keeping dairy cattle. All her efforts go towards maintaining her her family and her animals which are her sources of income and food for her family. She sells her animals in the Ybycui market or at street markets organized by the committee. She says that she will keep working to get ahead and is requesting the loan to buy wire mesh to build animal corrals.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wire mesh

loans.name: Quyet

texts.en: Quyet T. P. is 54 years old. She has a mechanical workshop that makes steel windows and doors, as ordered by clients. Her business started in 2006  when she received her first loan, which was in the amount of 2,204,000 VND. Every month she gets approximately $210 profit from her business. She is developing  her workshop more so she needs a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy steel and iron materials.

loans.use: to buy steels and  iron as material .

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou M. est une jeune femme mariée de 25 ans qui habite à Yoff. Avant le mariage elle exerçait  l’activité de coiffeuse. Aussitôt après le mariage elle s’est départie de la coiffure pour s’occuper de son mari. Mais  Sous l’influence de ce dernier  elle s’est orientée vers  le commerce pour ne pas rester inactive. Elle achète des thioubs  qu’elle place en crédit auprès  de ses clients jusqu'à  la fin du mois. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis février 2010 et n’y a jamais sollicité de prêt. Elle emprunte un montant de 150 000 frs destiné à l’achat de Thioubs. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de diminuer la dépendance envers son mari. Son rêve est de mieux développer son activité et parvenir a voyager pour s’approvisionner en marchandises.
texts.en: Mrs. Fatou M. is a young married woman, 25 years old, who lives in Yoff. Before her marriage she used to work as a hairdresser. After her marriage she stopped working in that field in order to dedicate herself to taking care of her husband. However, with her husband’s encouragement, she developed an interest in commerce so as not to remain inactive. She purchases thioubs (traditional damask-type cloth) which she sells on credit, collecting payment from customers at the end of the month. She has joined the Yoff credit union in February 2010 and never requested a loan before. She is borrowing 150,000 West African Francs in order to purchase thioubs. This financing will allow her to increase her revenues and be less dependent on her husband. Her dream is to grow her business and to be able to travel in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 30 years old. She is married to a businessman. They have five children between the ages of six and 25. One of her children goes to school. The others don’t go to school, because they completed their primary level and she cannot afford to pay the school fees for them at the secondary level. Rachel sells beer and soft drinks. With the loan she will buy more beer and soft drinks to sell. Her business is known, and she would like to own a large stock of beer as a distributor. With the profit she will pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz O. is 25 years old and married to Slavian Akinyi, and they have a four-year-old son who is in nursery school. 

Boaz has a retail shop that he has been running for the past year.  He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD as he needs to buy four bails of flour, cooking oil and sugar to add to his stock. He intends to use the profits from the loan to pay school fees for their son and also for the family's upkeep. 

His desire is to own a big supermarket in the future and be able to supply other shops around his area.

loans.use: to buy four bails of flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Kambuga Bakyara Kwekamba Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
S. Mary is a hardworking and determined woman who has been running a retail shop in Kambuga Trading Centre for 10 years. In her shop, she sells general merchandise to her clients, most of whom are repeat customers. Mary is married with 5 children, all of whom are still in school. She is also involved in agriculture, selling most of her products from which she is able to earn 280,000 UGX all together.

Mary needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for her retail shop. She has a story to tell about her business. To start her business, she got a loan from a local Sacco and ever since, she never looked back until she joined Pearl, where things have continuously moved smoothly. Her dream is to have all her children attain higher education so that they become self-sustaining.

loans.use: to restock her shop with more merchandise.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans, age 31 and the father of three children, is a dairy farmer in his home town of Kisii in western Kenya. He sells his produce of maize, bananas, potatoes, and kale at the local market.

He has applied for a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes this will improve his income and ensure that his children get a good education. He aspires to expand his farm to two cows over the next five years. He works as a mason for additional income.

Lack of finances remain Evan's greatest challenge in business. He is very happy to be able to benefit from Juhudi's loan provision initiative.

loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Milder

texts.es: Milder, es una madre de familia muy cumplidora, es separada, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijos. Milder se dedica en la venta de productos comestibles, acondicionado en un ambiente de su casa con vista a la calle. Su gran carisma y su buen trato, han hecho que su negocio sea muy concurrido por sus vecinos de su barrio, quienes a pesar de la falta de comodidad, le compran. Han transcurrido 14 años trabajando en ésta actividad, por lo que lo considera como su mayor pasión y su fuente de ingreso importante. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es la conversación que tiene con sus clientes y considera que le resulta muy  difícil surtir  con diversidad de productos a su bodega. En adelante, piensa mejorar la infraestructura de su establecimiento, asimismo ampliar su negocio con la diversidad de productos. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar de manera muy puntual  sus cuotas, para seguir contando con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito solicitado, piensa comprar paneton, cajas de leche y chocolote, productos que tiene mucha demanda en la época navideña.
texts.en: Milder is a dutiful housewife. She is separated and lives in her own home with her three children. Milder sells groceries from a section of her home that faces the street. Her charisma and good customer service have made it so that her business is busy with the neighbors from her neighborhood who, despite the lack of comfort, buy from her. She has been working in this business for 14 years and she considers this her biggest passion and an important source of income. What she enjoys most of her work is the conversations she has with her customers. It is difficult for her to stock a variety of products in her store. In the future she wants to improve the infrastructure of her establishment and to expand her business with a variety of products. This is her second loan with field partner MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time so that she can continue receiving subsequent aid. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase Christmas pastries and boxes of milk and chocolate, products that are in high demand during the Christmas season.

loans.use: Buy Christmas pastries, chocolates and milk in large quantities for the Christmas season since there is a high demand from customers.

loans.name: Del Rosario

texts.es:
El Sr. Del Rosario  de 47 años de edad es comerciante y está acompañado con la Sra. Delia de 52 años de edad. Juntos tienen un hijo de 12 años llamado Briam José, quien está culminando  su  séptimo grado de la Educación  Escolar Básica.
Del Rosario  empezó trabajando en la confección en San Paulo Brasil, hace más de 20 años, y que con mucho sacrificio consiguió  el capital para la compra de máquinas. Actualmente posee 5 máquinas con que trabaja día a día  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.  
Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya  solicitando el préstamo para la compra de telas, ya que actualmente con la llegada de fin de año cuenta con un gran número de pedidos.
texts.en:
Mr. Del Rosario is a 47 year-old merchant.  He is in a relationship with Ms. Delia, who is 52 years old.  They have a 12 year old son together named Briam José, who is finishing the seventh grade of primary school.

Del Rosario started making clothing more than 20 years ago in San Paulo, Brazil.  With a great deal of sacrifice, he was able to obtain the capital to buy sewing machines.  Now he owns five sewing machines, which he works with day in and day out in order to help his family get ahead.

He decided to trust in Fundación Paraguaya and request a loan in order to buy fabric, since with the arrival of the end of the year, he has many orders to fill.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Undrahbayar

texts.en: Undrahbayar D. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Tuv province of Mongolia. Both his two children attend a local school while his wife studies in the evening class in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been operating a public transport service between Tuv province and Ulaanbaatar since 1998. After many years of owing this business, he has built a stable operation and has gained not only much experience but also a positive reputation among his customers. With his business profits, he was able to buy an apartment in 2006, where the family now lives. For the future, Undrahbayar plans to buy a larger bigger bus with 40 seats. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan for his business.

loans.use: To buy a larger bus

loans.name: Ana Jacoba

texts.es:
LA SRA. ANA JACOBA G. ES CASADA Y MADRE DE CUATRO HIJOS PERO NINGUNO DEPENDEN DE ELLA, TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE GASOSAS Y ENCHILADAS EN EL MERCADO ISRAEL LEWITE DE MANAGUA, ELLA TRABAJA CON UNA DE SUS HIJAS DE LUNES A SABADO DE 7 DE LA MAÑANA HASTA LAS 5 DE LA TARDE.
ELLA HA TRABAJADO TRECE PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL Y TODOS ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO. ELLA A CUDE NUEVAMENTE A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA COMPRA DE GASEOSA, JUGOS Y PRODUCTOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE LAS ENCHILADAS DE CARNES, DE MADURO Y DE PAPA YA QUE ESTOS SON LOS PRODUCTOS QUE ELLA VENDE MAS.
ELLA A GRADECE A CEPRODEL YA QUE CON ESTOS FIANANCIAMIENTOS LE HAN AYUDADDO DE GRAN MANERA YA QUE SU NEGOCIO ACTULMENTE SE HA MANTENIDO Y AHORA CUENTA CON MAS VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS PARA COMERCIALIZAR.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Jacoba G. is married and the mother of four children, but none of them are dependent on her. She has a business selling sodas and enchiladas at the Israel Lewite Market in Managua. Ana works with one of her daughters Monday through Saturday from 7am until 5pm.

She has received thirteen loans from CEPRODEL and all of them were used to buy supplies for her small business. Ana has returned to CEPRODEL to request a new loan to buy sodas, juices, and ingredients for making meat, plantain, and potato enchiladas since these are the items that she sells the most.

Ana is grateful to CEPRODEL since the loans have been a great help. They have allowed her to maintain her business and now she is able to sell a wider variety of products.

loans.use: Purchase sodas, juices, and ingredients for making enchiladas

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en:
Burul S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Toktogul. She is 45 and married to an electrician. Together they have raised two daughters and a son. The first daughter and the son live separately from the family and the second daughter studies at school. 

In order to earn money, Burul breeds cattle. She started this activity three years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS. Now she earns 2,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the number of cattle. 

In the future she plans to enlarge a shed to keep more cattle there.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito – Juli, departamento D. Puno, tiene 51 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Solo pudo estudiar la primaria pero no la terminó.
Está empezando trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Tiene como actividad económica, la venta D. pescados como jurel, cabinza y otros pescados del mar.  
Ella requiere un préstamo D.   S/ 500.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que le permitirá incrementar la mercadería D. su negocio, comprará pescados al por mayor.
Lo que le impacto por primera vez  del Banco Comunal es la promoción al ahorro.. “Manuela Ramos te enseña a mejorar tu economía en base al ahorro y la buena inversión”.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito-Juli province, in Puno department.  She is 51 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She only had the opportunity to study at elementary school level and she didn't complete elementary school.

Delia is just starting to work with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Her business activity is selling fish such as horse mackerel, cabinza and other sea fish.

Delia requires a loan for 500 Peruvian soles which will allow her to increase her stock.  She will buy fish wholesale.  What first struck Delia about her community bank was the way they promoted savings...  "Manuela Ramos teaches you to improve your finances by saving and investing wisely".

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Mrs. Sam On Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam On has been selected as village bank president by 18 people who are seeking a loan.  Each individual's portion of the loan will be used fO. different purposes, so that it can improve the family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Sam On  is a housewife who cooks delicious food fO. her family, so she has a lot of free time. FO. this reason, she wants to start a new business, but her savings is not enough to support her. Mrs. Sam On is applying fO. a loan to add to her savings so that she can buy a cow fO. breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sokorn, is a palm juice collectO. and a motorcycle taxi driver. Through this activity, they support four children.  One is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is a recycling seller, and the others attend local public school.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Chynygul Erkaeva's Group

texts.en:
Chynygul E., 27, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of the small southern town of Kadamjai. Chynygul is married and has three sons aged five, three and two months.
Chynygul had good teachers in her teenage years. Her parents were well-skilled farmers and they imparted practical skills to her from the age of 16 onwards.
Chynygul and her husband run a family business. They cultivate agricultural products such as vegetables, grain and fruits. Almost 90 per cent of Chynygul’s harvest is potatoes. It’s probably the main vegetable, along with onions and carrots, in use in main meat dishes. The couple use their business profits to help cover the costs associated with their children and household.
According to Kyrgyz tradition, a religious ritual has to be organized in honor of a toddler. Chynygul would like to invite many guests and organize a grand ceremony, but she’s worried that she has a lack of funds. Chynygul’s monthly income is 4,000 KGS. She and her group members applied for this loan because they are in urgent need of funds, and they know how to spend them wisely. Chynygul would like to purchase seed potatoes, which are a significant part of her crop cultivation. In the future, she wants to expand her land and sow more products.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita A. is from the village of San Francisco, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 63 years old, widowed and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Bernandita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling several type of dried fish in the local community. Bernandita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Bernandita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Bernandita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of dried fish. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is currently in a business of selling fish. She is 20 years old, married, with two children and one of them goes to school. Victoria borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loans.use: stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosario Noemi

texts.es:
Rosario Noemí tiene 28 años de edad, ella es casad y tiene dos hijos. Vive en saltar en cuidad de Zaña en casa propia  a 45 minutos de cuidad de Chiclayo 

Rosario Noemí  cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida.  Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Rosario Noemí a solicitado un préstamo Edpyme alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, debido a la  creciente demanda que la bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla, con este préstamo ella podrá comprar mas productos y de esta manera habrá un incremento  sus ingresos familiares. 
Rosario Noemí  es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Rosario Noemí is 28 years old, she is married and has two children. She lives in the city of Zaña in her own home which is about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
