Rosario Noemí has a small grocery store located in her home which she attends to herself. She offers everyday consumer products including staples, groceries and drinks to her neighbors and clients in the area. The business has been well received. With this business she helps her husband with the economic support of her family. 

Rosario Noemí has requested a loan from field partner Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles (PEN) because of the growing demand she has been experiencing in her store. This has led her to think about expanding her store. With this loan she will be able to buy more products and this will result in a increase in her family's income. 

Rosario Noemí is a hardworking woman of good character. The people that know her have much esteem and affection for her.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her store.

loans.name: Esi Atta

texts.en:
Esi is a widow taking care of three children. Esi sells cooked food and food-wear at Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast, which she has done for four years. Esi uses her income to feed, clothe and educate her children. 

She will use the loan to purchase food items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Hule (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Hule se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y  del Ecuador.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal, que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos mejoran sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Magaly, tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis  hijos, cinco de ellos ya son mayores de edad y la menor que tiene 12 años y estudia en escuela, los dos hijos menores aun viven en su casa. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en otros lugares los intereses son más altos.

Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00, ya que solo prepara desayunos y almuerzos, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo. También vende ropa de todo tipo, vende en su restaurant y a veces sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa. Tiene 15 años que se dedica a estas actividades y le ha ido bastante  bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear una parte para comprar víveres para preparar sus deliciosos platos como arroz, papas, carne, pescado, etc. Y tambien va a comprar pantalones, blusas,camisetas y ropa de niños para la venta. 
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en el banco y obtener los beneficios que este brinda.
texts.en:
The Hule Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Junín canton, a place known for its friendly, hard-working people, and because this is where the best aguardiente (strong alcoholic beverage specific to the region) in the province and in Ecuador is distilled.  This is a group of people who decided to come together to form this communal bank, which is very useful to them, since they improve their small businesses with the loans.  They work in various activities, such as commerce, services, sale of food, among others.

This is where we met Magaly, who is 49 years old.  She lives in a common law marriage from which she has six children.  Five of them are grown, and the youngest is 12 years old and studying in school.  The two youngest children still live at home.  This is her first cycle with the communal bank, and she likes it because in other places, interests are higher.

She has a small restaurant in her home, where she prepares tasty dishes.  She works daily from 6 a.m. until 2 p.m., preparing only breakfasts and lunches.  Her children help her with the work.  She also sells all types of clothing, selling in her restaurant and sometimes she offers her products door to door.  She has been doing this for 15 years, and things have gone quite well for her.

She plans to use this loan to buy foodstuffs to prepare her tasty dishes, such as rice, potatoes, meat, fish, etc. She will also buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.

Her goals are to continue with the bank, and take advantages of the benefits offered by it.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, meat, fish, vegetables, and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon, aged 40, is married to Cecilia and blessed with two children. He has been selling automobile spare parts for eight years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES.30,000.

This is his first loan term from KADET LTD and he will use it to buy more automobile spare parts for resale.


Gideon intends to use the anticipated profits to open a business for his wife and hopes to have a big automobile spare parts shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Justo Antonio

texts.es: Justo Antonio tiene 29 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería, inicio con muy pocos productos a pesar de no tener mucho que ofrecer a sus clientes no ha desistido con seguir adelante con este negocio, el tuvo mucha paciencia pues logro aumentar sus productos y obtener la pulpería en su vivienda, lo más difícil para él es proporcionarle a sus clientes todos los productos que le solicitan. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de grano básicos, gaseosas, jugos, pan, y un poco de ropa para niños pues sus clientes compran sus productos por los ofrece manera favorable. El sueño de este hombre es que su negocio se mantenga.
texts.en:
Justo Antonio is 29 years old and his business is a grocery store.  He started out selling just a few products.  Although he didn't have much to offer his customers, he didn't give up on getting ahead in his business.  He had a lot of patience and managed to increase the number of products that he sold.  His store is located in his home and his most difficult task is providing his customers with all the products that they request.

Justo Antonio is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, soda, juice, bread and a few items of children's clothing.  Justo Antonio's dream is to keep his business going.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, juice, bread and a few items of children's clothing

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.en:
Wilbert is 30 and married to Amilyn. The couple is blessed with two children. Wilbert is thankful because his wife helps him provide for the needs of their children. His wife is engaged in vending shoes and Wilbert is managing their rice farming business. Wilbert is able to earn about PHP 30,000 per cropping.

Wilbert grows rice. He has been doing this for 10 years. He would like to improve his farm by inputting all the farm supplies needed, but due to a shortage of funds he needs the assistance of the lenders. He is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 as his additional capital to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, insecticides and seeds to grow.

In the future, Wilbert hopes that he can produce more crops and harvest more cavans of rice, so that he can sustain all the needs of his family, especially his children who are studying.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and seeds

loans.name: Alimata

texts.fr:
Mme Alimata est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 7ans..2 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes.

Elle vend une boutique depuis 12ans. Mme s’approvisionne au grand marché de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les gens du quartier.

Elle veut s’acheter 10sacs de riz(5sacs de riz brisure et 5sac riz simple),05 litres de bidon d’huile ;05 cartons de patte alimentaire ;02 carton de savon et 05 carton de bonbon. 

Avec ses économies, elle veut s’acheter une parcelle. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un hangar au marché pour vendre des céréales. Et aussi aider son mari à construire une grande maison dans leur cours.
texts.en:
Ms. Alimata is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 11 years old, and the youngest is 7. Two of them go to school. She has five persons to support. Alimata has been selling out of a shop for twelve years. She gets her supplies at the big market of Ouagadougou. Her customers are people from the area. 

She wants to buy 10 sacks of rice (5 of broken rice and 5 of plain rice), a 5-liter container of oil, 5 boxes of pasta, 2 boxes of soap, and 5 boxes of candies. 

With her savings, Alimata wants to buy a plot of land. Her ambition is to buy a covered stall at the market to sell grains and also to help her husband build a large house.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of rice (5 of broken rice and 5 of plain rice), a 5-liter container of oil, 5 boxes of pasta, 2 boxes of soap, and 5 boxes of candies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old, married with five children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Her dream is to educate her children and also to set up an income-generating activity that is sustainable for the family. She sells new clothes and has been in this business for four years. The major challenge faced is high cost of the clothes that leads to low profits, and her dream is to set up another outlet in town. Grace needs the loan to buy new trousers and skirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy new trousers and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Kristine works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring, food vending, and networking of Avon products. Kristine is borrowing 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Kristine has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil,  45, lives with his wife and two children in Agsu where he has been operating a jewelry business for more than 15 years. Currently attempting  to expand his business, Kamil is requesting his first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva for 1000 AZN in order to buy a new assortment of jewelry.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of jewelery.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Baray District of Kompong Tom Province. She is married and has three children. All of her children are single. Since 2000, Un has worked as a fish-seller and she earns 2 USD daily. Her husband is a fisherman, earning around 2.10 USD daily. 

Un is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner HKL to buy fishing equipment such as a small motor-driven fishing boat, nets, and fish traps. She hopes that her increased income will allow her to expand her farm. She hopes to use the remainder of her funds to renovate her old house and at least educate her children through high school.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat, nets, and fish traps

loans.name: Tukhta

texts.ru: Тухта жительница города Худжанд. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем. Имеет одного ребенка. Она имеет среднее образование. Тухта рядом с домом открыла лавку, где продает газеты и журналы. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки канцелярских товаров.
texts.en: Tukhta lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 48 years old, married and has one child.  She has a secondary education.  Tukhta opened a store near her house, where she sells newspapers and magazines.  She has been involved in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of office supplies.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en: Sarem, 58 years old, is a food seller who earns $5 per day. Her husband runs a battery recharging business and earns $6 per day. They have two children, both of them working and earning $7 per day for both. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to pay the administration fee for her son to work in Thailand. Her husband plans to extend his business to be more modern than before. She plans to support her two children to study in Korea so that they can go to work there because they can make a better salary than in Cambodia and Thailand.

loans.use: To pay the administration fee for her son to work in Thailand

loans.name: Walter Delio Del Carmen

texts.es:
Walter tiene 48 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, la cual pertenece a la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace varios años que Walter quiere hacer unos cambios en su casa.

Actualmente Walter está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢300.000 (trescientos mil colones) para  poder comprar materiales de construcción, para asi arreglar la infraestructura de su hogar y ampliar el cuarto de pila. Con esto el espera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ya que su deseo estar más tranquilo, que sus hijos vivan más cómodos y tengan un techo digno.

Walter es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Francisco, una de las 150 organizaciones socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
48-year old Walter lives with his wife and children in the community of San Carlos in Costa Rica’s second province, Alajuela. The area has the country’s highest production of coffee and sugar cane as well as growing staples such as rice, beans, and maize, fruit, vegetables, and root crops. The province is also home to the Juan Santamaría International Airport, the most important in the country.

For several years now Walter has wanted to make some changes to his house. So he is now seeking a loan of 300,000 colones to buy construction materials so he can repair the infrastructure and extend the laundry room, and in this way provide his family with a better quality of life. He wants to have a more serene life, with his children living more comfortably and in nice surroundings.

Walter is a member of the Empresa Community Bank of San Francisco, one of the fifty member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. He wishes to continue developing both on a personal and economic level, and to participate actively in the organization of loans in his community.

loans.use: to extend the laundry room

loans.name: Idilfonso Aquilino

texts.es: A sus 55 años Ildifonso es un hombre y padre responsable que decidió montar su propio negocio como una ayuda económica para sacar a sus hijos adelante. El tiene una pulpería sueña con tener más espacio y mercancía donde acomodar el negocio. El quiere comprar un surtido mayor para su negocio, logrando generar más utilidades, ampliando la variedad en el producto y aumentando las ventas, de manera que más clientes lleguen a su negocio. Solicita un crédito para invertir en gaseosas, dulces, granos básicos, pan y sopas.
texts.en:
Ildifonso is a 55-year-old gentleman and a responsible father. He decided to establish his own business so that he could help his children move forward financially. Ildifonso has a store and dreams of having more space and merchandise to accommodate his business.

He wants to restock his business with more inventory so that he can generate better profits, expand the variety of products that he offers, and increase his sales. Ildifonso hopes that more customers will come to his store. He is requesting a loan to invest in sodas, candy, basic grains, bread, and soups.

loans.use: to buy sodas, candy, basic grains, bread, and soups.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is a 57-year-old woman who sells confectionaries. She has 10 years of experience in this field. Sevda is married and has two sons. 

Her monthly income from this business is 230 AZN.  These types of products are very popular and in high demand among people. She would like to expand her business and purchase more items and diversify the products she sells. For this purpose she applied for 1500 AZN loan. She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more confectionaries.

loans.name: Jikaze Group

texts.en:
Shaphani is the facilitator of the Jikaze group. Shaphani and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Shaphani takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Shaphani had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Shaphani was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Shaphani and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Shaphani will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jikaze group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase text books, charts, exercise books and desks.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 47 years old, is married, and has 1 child in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more goods such as soap, soft drinks, and slippers to sell in her store.

Melodia has previously requested and repaid 7 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from a butcher shop. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as soap, soft drinks, and slippers to sell in her store.

loans.name: Strickers Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Strikers” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mariatu is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old woman is married to a motor mechanic and the couple has five children. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for 12 years now. Currently, she is selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With her share of this loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret, 31 years old, is married and has a seven-year-old daughter. She describes herself to be customer friendly. She sells firewood. She has been in this business for the last two years. Previously, she was employed at a retail shop. Her business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the firewood retail store. She will be using the loan of KES 10,000 to buy more firewood. Margaret's hope and dream is to run several retail stores selling firewood in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is applying for another loan to start a new printing business. She will use this 40000 KES loan to purchase a printing and photocopy machine for her new business. In the future, Moreen aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Moreen has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase a printing and photocopy machine for her new business.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a 50 years old marrie dwoman from al zarqa, amman;jordan and a mothyer of 6 children.
Yusra is selling blankets and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to puchase more quantities for trading purposes.
Yusra is looking to save an amount of mony enough for he children education.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for trading purposes

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven de 27 años de edad, madre de un pequeño de 1 año de edad, a quien quiere muchísimo y junto a su esposo trabajan muy duro y dan la vida con tal de darle una vida digna y sobre todo mucho amor. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo posee muchos lugares turísticos los cuales son muy visitados, especialmente las “Líneas de Nazca”, las cuales se encuentra en medio de un extenso campo y forman figuras de animales, entre otros. Cuando Jessica tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y pasear junto a sus pequeño, asimismo en algunas oportunidades le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Jessica solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Jessica trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos, con el cual apoya a su esposo para los gastos del hogar y de su pequeño, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece buenos productos.

Jessica esta agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, como tarrajeo, instalación de piso, pintado, entre otros, de esta amanera ella podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y poder seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener un local propio para su negocio”.

loans.use: Para mejoramiento de su vivienda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on the Capital

loans.name: Qand Agha

texts.en:
Qand Agha is 32 years old and lives with his 4 children in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Qand Agha has a clothes shop in the market where he sells jeans, scarfs, jumpers, coats, t-shirts and trousers.

Qand Agha took a 4th cycle loan to buy those materials that he doesn’t already have in his shop. At the start of his business he didn't have too many customers because of less materials, so he faced lots of financial and family-related problems.

Right now with buying lots of materials for his shop, he is able to cover the expenses of both the shop and his family.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Laumoe

texts.en: Laumoe lives in the seaside village of Lalomanu.  This village boasts one of Samoa’s most beautiful white sandy beaches.  Laumoe owns several beach fales right at the shoreline.  A fale is a small open hut with a thatched roof built in the style of a traditional Samoan house.  Laumoe rents these fales to overnight guests.  She is aiming to attract more tourists by upgrading the services she provides.  Thus, she is seeking funds to buy bed linens, mosquito nets and insect repellents so that she can keep her guests comfortable.

loans.use: to buy bed linens, mosquito nets and insect repellents for overnight guests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to purchase a power saw.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Señora Rosa is 46 years old. She is married with 2 children. She is a travelling saleswoman. She sells used clothes and silver jewelry. She buys used clothes from a store in Asuncion (capital city which is about 2 hours away). She travels once to twice a week to the city to make her purchases. She buys her silver jewelry from a jewelry store located in downtown Caacupe.

Rosa tells us that her job is very unforgiving since she is exposed to the elements. Wheather is rain, hot or cold, she must get out there to sell her products around the city, one barrio (neighborhood) at a time. She is hoping to add a room to her house to give her the space she needs for her merchandise. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD to purchase more used clothes and jewelry. This way she can work from home but still be able to take care of her small children.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene 46 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas y también a la venta de joyas de plata de forma ambulante. Las ropas usadas compra de una tienda en Asunción (capital del país que queda a dos horas de viaje), por lo que viaja una a dos veces por semana para comprarla, las joyas de plata las compra de una joyería del centro de la ciudad de Caacupé. Rosa, comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que a pesar de las lluvias, el frío y el calor ella debe salir a vender sus productos recorriendo los barrios de la ciudad. Por este motivo ella desea habilitar un salón de ventas en su casa, para ello necesita un crédito de $ 200 para comprar ropas y joyas en mayor cantidad para la venta. De esta forma ella podrá quedarse en su casa y cuidar de sus hijos que aún son pequeños.

loans.use: To purchase clothes & jewelry to sell

loans.name: Vidal

texts.en:
Mr. Vidal L. lives in his own home with his wife and six children in the western part of La Paz, in the zone Pasankeri Ladera. Mr. Vidal is a lower official in the national military and his wife is an employee in a personal residence. Recently they began building five new rooms on their house, which were built through a loan from this institution and personal savings. Of these rooms, four are completed and are occupied by the family. The loan applied for will be used for the completion of the construction of the last room. This is the sixth time that the family has applied for a loan. An analysis of the family shows good socioeconomic classifications and approves the loan. The family has been clients of IMPRO since 1997.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Vidal L. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus seis hijos; el señor Vidal es oficial de baja graduación en el ejército nacional y su esposa es empleada en un domicilio particular. Actualmente construyeron cinco habitaciones que fueron construidas con créditos en nuestra institución y ahorros propios, de los cuales están concluidas cuatro, las que están siendo ocupadas por la familia. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión de la construcción en obra fina de una habitación. Esta es la sexta vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Son clientes de IMPRO desde el año 1997.

loans.use: Completion of addition on home.

loans.name: Martha Enriqueta

texts.es:
Martha is one of many mothers that are alone in raising their children due to the fact that her husband went to the United States to work. She has to struggle to raise her children well. Since there are long periods of time where her husband can not find a stable job in the U.S. She does not recieve enough money to pay for the needs of her children. That is how she began to sell cosmetic supplies to her friends and neighbors by catalog. Later she began to sell shoes and crafts. Presently she has more clients.

However, she has taken a special liking to the selling of clothing products and for that reason, she has decided to buy winter clothing, that way she can offer them to her clients. This is why she is asking for a loan of $650 that she will repay in 6 months. With this loan she will be able to buy clothing to sell, like jackets, jeans, and sweaters. With your help Martha will support her children even though her husband is so far away.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Martha es una de tantas mujeres mexicanas que se quedan a cargo de sus hijos puesto que su esposo de fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar, y ella tiene que luchar por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ya que hay largas temporadas en que su esposo no consigue trabajo en Estados Unidos no recibe tan rápido dinero que le manda y los gastos de sus dos hijos no esperan, fue así como comenzó por ofrecerles a sus amigas y vecinas cosméticos por catálogo, y después empezó a vender zapatos y manualidades. Actualmente tiene más clientas.

Sin embargo ya le tomó un cariño muy especial a la venta de productos, y es por esto que está decidida a comprar ropa de temporada de invierno para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar ropa, como chamarras, pantalones, y suéteres. Con tu ayuda Martha podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos a pesar de que su esposo se encuentra tan lejos.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to boost her supply of products.

loans.name: Zuleyma Arely

texts.es:
The applicant actually lives in La Libertad, her family group consists of three children who directly depend of her earnings. They are the inspiration for her to move ahead in life. She's been improving her business throughout the years with the addition of a mill after noticing people coming to her and asking for some of these items. Financing through "Apoyo Integral" have helped her improve her services and helped her not say "no" to any of her clients who come to her looking for a specific item. With her last loan she purchased basic grains and as of today, its been a great investment which has given her more earnings.

The loan she requests is to buy a vehicle since she needs to deliver her grains to the people in the area. At this moment she rents a car, which is more of an inconvenience. The applicant has had a good record with the institution and all the loans have been paid back.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La solicitante vive actualmente en La Libertad su grupo familiar lo componen tres hijos que dependen directamente de sus ingresos y que son la inspiración de ella para salir adelante ella a ido incrementando su negocio con el paso de los años inicio con un molino al ver que las personas que llegaban solicitaban algunos productos decidido poner una tienda los financiamientos de Apoyo Integral le ayudan para poder mejorar su servicio y no decir a los clientes que no tiene el producto que buscan además en su ultimo financiamiento compro granos básicos y hasta la fecha a sido una buena inversión ya que le deja mas ganancia y otros ingresos extras. El financiamiento lo necesita para poder comprar un vehículo ya que con la venta de granos básicos tiene rutas para poder repartir ya que por el momento tiene que alquilar lo cual le genera mas inconvenientes, la señora a tenido un buen récord crediticio con la institución y todos los financiamientos han sido bien invertidos.

loans.use: Mrs. Hernandez needs to purchase a vehicle since it's difficult for her to transport  basic grains and items from her store to clients in the area.

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
My name is Jameela L. S. and I am the mother of seven children. My husband makes a living selling fruit from a cart, and we have applied for a loan to buy fruit in bulk for him to sell. I am the leader of a group made up of four other women and am responsible for their loans. All of us live in the small town of Borewala, Pakistan. 
My group members are: Nasreen B., who wants a loan to repair her family's rickshaw. Khursheed B.’s husband is a builder who needs to buy construction equipment. S. B. will invest the loan in her food stall and buy dried fruits in bulk. Zubaida B. needs this loan to buy some items she needs for her family's business selling sweets and candies.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for five small businesses

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly P. is a single mother of four children.  She works as a trader, selling food and sandals to students at Cape Coast University.  She is requesting a loan of $225 to buy a wider variety of shoes and food items to sell.  Nelly is a member the Anointing Group, which is made up of ten borrowers who live in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of shoes and food items to sell.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia is married to 49-year old Luis Valdez, and they have two sons that attend school. Felcia used to earn a living selling lottery tickets in the streets while her husband sold newspapers. After several years of saving, they succeeded in setting up a small kiosk where in addition to their lottery tickets and newspapers, they sold the candies and fast foods.

Their desire for progress has always brought them success in their undertakings. From the kiosk they were able to expand their business and open a store thanks to previous loans granted by the Fundación Paraguaya, a business which now operates with a very good quantity and variety of inventory.

Now they are asking for a loan to supply their business with goods such as rice, pasta, oil, milk, eggs, baked goods, sodas, and sugar. In this way they wish to keep on with their progress and continue to expand their business.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Felicia esta casada con el señor Luis Valdez de 49 años, tienen 2 hijos que actualmente van al colegio. Felicia anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de loterías en las calles mientras que su marido vendía diarios. Luego de varios años de ahorro, ellos lograron montar un pequeño kiosco donde además de sus loterías y diarios vendían golosinas y comidas rápidas.

El deseo de ambos de progresar, los ha llevado siempre a superarse en sus proyectos, luego de su kiosco pudieron ampliar el negocio y abrir una despensa gracias a créditos anteriores que se le fueron otorgados en la Fundación Paraguaya, y que actualmente funciona con muy buena cantidad y variedad de mercaderías.

Hoy día ellos solicitan un crédito para surtir su negocio con mercaderías como: arroz, fideo, aceite, leche, huevo, panificados, gaseosa, azúcar. De este modo desean seguir progresando y ampliar cada vez mas el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, rice, pasta, oil, milk, eggs, baked goods, sodas, sugar

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: Rugiatu is 37 years old, married and has two children.  She owns a food stall in the market of Dogolia in Sierra Leone.  She is not able to contribute to her childrens' education and well-being from the meager salary she earns from her small business.  She is requesting a loan of Le 800,000 to expand her business and buy a larger variety and quantity of grocery items to sell in her market stall.  Rugiatu is on the left in the photograph.

loans.use: to expand her stock of food items and expand her business

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina began a business to help her husband take care of the family´s expenses, as at the time he did not have a job. Facing a shortage of money to be able to give her 2 children - 5 and 9 years old - a better standard of living, she decided to start a business selling candy from home, and in this way generated extra income which allowed her to help her husband.

She needs a loan of US$ 250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy goods and in this way be able to make more sales. With your contribution, Marina will continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Marina inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo y solventar los gastos de la familia, ya que en aquel entonces no tenia trabajo y ante la falta de dinero para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos de 5 y 9 años, decidio emprender su negocio de venta de dulces en su casa, generando asi ingresos extras que le permiten apoyar a su marido.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y asi poder terne mas ventas. Con tu contribucion Marina seguira con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Almahmad

texts.ru:
Almahmad T. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He uses his own car to work as a taxi driver, and has been doing so for five years. He likes this work, but a car is a machine, and it needs repairs. In order to make the repairs he decided to take out a loan of 450 US dollars. This will allow him to provide higher quality services to clients by making the car more comfortable for passengers. He will pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Тошмуродов Алмахмад житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Работает на своем автомобиле таксистом. Занимается этим видом услуги уже пять лет . Работа ему нравится , но машина это техника , которая требует ремонта. Для того , чтобы сделать ремонт он планирует получить кредит в размере 450 долларов США. Сделав ремонт он сможет улучшить качество обслуживания клиентов , создав комфортные условия для пассажиров. Поасит кредит он планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Automobile repair

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria Esperanza is 46 years old and married. She studied through high school and supports 5 children, 2 of which are working while the other 3 are still students. She lives in the district of Salaverry in the Province of Trujillo, La Libertad. When she was studying high school she learned how to make purses. When she finished her studies she dedicated herself to this small business which she started thanks to a small amount of money she had saved. Later her friends encouraged her to participate in the Communal Bank “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”. With her first loan of 200 Soles she purchased buckles, closures and other supplies to invest in her business. With a new loan for 1,700 Soles, to be repaid within 6 months, she will purchase decorative ribbons to make shirts and other hand sewn products for some children’s playcenters. She currently acts as Secretary of her Communal Bank and she is very happy to work with the other members. One of her goals is for her younger children to become professionals since her older children never had the opportunity to complete their studies.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora María Esperanza está casada, tiene 46 años, estudió secundaria completa, tiene 05 hijos, 02 trabajan y 03 son estudiantes. Vive en el distrito D. Salaverry D. la Provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad. Cuando estudiaba secundaria aprendió en su colegio a confeccionar carteras así que cuando terminó D. estudiar se dedicó a este negocio gracias a un pequeño ahorro que tenía. Posteriormente sus amigas la animaron a participar en el Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”, y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 200.00, compró broches, cierres, para hacer manualidades e implementar el negocio. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,700.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará bordados en cinta, confeccionara polos y elaborará algunas manualidades para algunos jardines D. la infancia. Actualmente tiene el cargo D. secretaria en el Banco Comunal al que pertenece y se siente muy contenta D. trabajar junto con el resto D. socias. Tiene como meta hacer profesionales a sus hijos menores ya que sus hijos mayores no tuvieron oportunidad D. estudiar.

loans.use: Compra de cintas.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Héctor Calderón V.. I am 26 years old, and I am a mechanic. I am requesting this loan because I must purchase and install windows and doors for my house since they were stolen a few months earlier. I want to install them because the insecurity is greater every day.

Héctor C. V. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hola mi nombre es Héctor Calderón V. tengo 26 años y soy mecánico de una empresa y estoy solicitando este préstamo porque requiero de la compra e instalación de ventanas y puertas de m i casa ya que fueron robadas algunos meses atrás ; quiero instalarlas porque la inseguridad es mayor cada ves.”

loans.use: To place windows and doors in my house

loans.name: Yoni Group

texts.en:
This loan group is called Yoni, which is also the name of their village. Yoni is about 40 miles from Makeni, capital of the Northern Province. Many people choose to live in or near Makeni because it is the most prosperous town in the north and a good place to do business. The members of the Yoni group are: Mohamed K., Wara K., Kadiatu F. and Namina B.. Each runs a different kind of business. Their leader, Mohamed K., sells biscuits, mints, medicines and other items. He is 55 years old. Mohamed's wife is also a business woman. They have four children, two in secondary schools and two are in primary schools.

Mohamed has been in business for 18 years. But when he started getting loans from SMT two years ago, he experienced a vast improvement in his personal and business life. Today, his primary goal is to complete construction of a house he had started building when rebels from the Revolutionary United Front (RUF) destroyed it. Despite this setback, Mohamed's greatest challenge is lack of capital. He will use his portion of the loan to buy items he currently needs for his shop, such as rice and sugar.

loans.use: Expand on their businesses

loans.name: Chon

texts.en: Chon L., 37, is married and has four children. The family lives in Kampong Chhnang, Cambodia. Although Chon L. is the village chief, he makes less than one dollar per day. On the other hand, his wife, who works as a land dealer, makes around US$10 per day. The couple also raises animals and grows rice to earn extra income. All of their children are students. Chon L. currently needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to purchase more land to grow rice. He thereby hopes to increase his income and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of land to grow rice

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia C. is 47 years old and married with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs like crayfish, palm oil, groundnut oil, tomato paste, etc. She lives in Benin, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for changing her lives.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. sells beer at the bar in wholesale and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Grace is 28 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a secretary in the ministry. Her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor-bike for hire.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary O. was born in Prey Mech village in Kampong Speu province. She has a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Eam Vy, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn little income which cannot support the family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sary O. decided to ask for a loan to buy a calf to start a cow-breeding business. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow. Mrs. Sary O. is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whO. are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a calf to start a cow-breeding business.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
My name is Parveen Akhtar and I’m 30 years old. I am married and my husband, M. R., sells construction supplies. He has been doing this work for 10 years. I have passed the 12th standard (grade) in school and I run an academy where I teach students. I am also a mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of my children are getting their education from a school near our house. I’m applying for a loan to buy more construction supplies (cement and sand) to expand my husband’s business. 

I’m a group leader of a group of women in my neighborhood. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy scissors and razors for her hair salon. Abida Kanwal baji wants a loan to buy medicine for her medical store. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To biuy construction supplies

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena O. sells fried fish to make some income. She buys fresh fish from coastal areas and fries it herself. Abena supplies fried fish mostly to food vendors in her community.  Food vendors find it more convenient and affordable to buy fried fish than frying it themselves. She aspires to own a fridge to store her procured fresh fish. She has been in business for eight years. Abena wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk so she can distribute to more customers.
 
She is forty– three years old, married with six children- two girls and four boys. The eldest is learning a trade, one is a senior in high school and four are in the junior high and basic schools. Her husband is a rubber tapper.  Abena lives with her family in a small town called Asaman, a farming/commercial town in the Western Region of Ghana.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Frolence A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Frolence A. from Tukuyu. She is married and has two children aged 10 and 18. Frolence has been running a grocery business since 2005. She buys drinks wholesale and sells them retail. 

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Frolence currently earns about $150 USD each month from her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more drinks like beer, whisky, and soft drinks for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the varieties of drinks in her grocery shop. Frolence thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks like, beer, whisky, and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 39 years old and married to Jorge, a farmer.  They live in Barangay San Lorenzo in Ilagan, Isabela.  The couple is blessed with two children: Jaylord, an 11-year-old fifth-grader, and Jorge Jr., a 7-year-old elementary school student.  Florida says that her family enjoys their modest but happy living conditions and she is glad that they have a good relationship with each other.
 
Florida is a hog farmer.  She would like to borrow a loan amount of PHP 6,000.00 from lenders to develop her business.  She plans to use most of her loan to buy feed.  She believes that her business will continue to grow by being diligent and never losing hope.  She is hoping that her income will increase enough to save money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Fadhilat Group

texts.en:
Jabu has been a bread seller and owned a small restaurant in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $135. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Jabu is married, and has five children: ages 19, 17, 14, 12 and 2. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanahamis and MwaJ.. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more itmes to add her current stock.

loans.name: Rehana M.akbar Group

texts.en:
Rehana baji has lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is M.; he runs a garment business. He sells both ladies & gentlemen's garments. He has 5 years of experience in this business. Rehana baji is the mother of three daughters. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school. She prepares embroidered dresses on order and from this income she pays the school fees of her daughters. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy garments to increase the profit of her husband.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Amna baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell. Khadija baji wants a loan to buy jewelry to sell. Riffat baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zakia baji wants a loan to buy paint brushes for her paint business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments for resale

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de gblinkomé. Son mari est un déclarant en douane, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2007 et s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays. Son stock a diminué, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner, elle a  déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 25 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Gblinkomé district. Her husband is a customers agent. She earns an income from commerce in charcoal, a business she started in 2007. She supplies herself from inland locations. Because her inventory has shrunk, she would like to stock up again. She has already obtained a loan from WAGES and has repaid it. She's requesting a second loan to resupply herself with 25 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Luz Angélica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” vive en Jr. Bolognesi Nº 659, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años, 02 hijos estudiantes que aun dependen de ella y por ellos trabaja muy duro.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar todo lo que la ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente los atiende con alegría y entusiasmo. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00, comprará diversos abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Anhela convertir su bodega en un minimarket y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo cumple.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz Angélica is a member of the “Las Nazarenas” Microfinance Institute. She lives in the Bellavista district of the department of San Martín. She is a 35-year-old married mother with 2 school age children, for whom she works so hard, who still depend on her.

Her enterprising character and the love she has for her family motivated her to start her own general store, which kept growing little by little. She started to gain experience in this field, making a name for herself and being well-loved by her customers. She currently has a fixed clientele who visit her shop everyday to purchase everything that a homemaker needs. She personally attends to her customers with joy and enthusiasm. With this 1,800.00 PEN loan, she will purchase various products, such as: sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, crates of milk, boxes of canned fish in a variety of brands, eggs, and toiletries so that she can keep providing the best customer service.

She hopes to convert her small shop into a minimarket, stating that she will achieve her goal because she is a woman who accomplishes whatever she sets out to do.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods (rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, canned fish, toiletries)

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 04 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Alianza.

Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para aumentar el capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, para niños y adultos, también vende mantas bien surtidas.  Nos comenta que lleva también su negocio a las ferias de Desaguadero. 

Su mayor sueño es poder seguir trabajando. A ella le gustan las facilidades de pago  y los préstamos que da el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina is a member of the Communal Bank group "Flor Azangarina II", which is located in the Azangaro district of Azangaro Province, Puno Department. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children who have completed high school. She lives in the town of Alianza.

She just started working with Manuela Ramos and has received her initial loan of 500 soles, which will be used as capital for her business. She sells clothing for children and adults, as well as blankets. Sra. Catalina told us that she sells her merchandise at the open markets in Desaguadero.

Her biggest dream is to continue working. She likes the ease of payments for the loans given by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita 
Maria es casada tiene 58 años cuatro hijos de 33, 29,25 y 22 años que trabajan.
Maria siempre se dedico a su casa, pero su sobrina la animo para que venda productos de belleza por catalogo, ella es vendedora hace cinco años y le esta yendo bien. 
Desde que Maria esta en Finca  aprendió ahorra, a ser solidaria con las personas, y a ser amiga.
Maria necesita un préstamo de  1200 soles, para invertirlos en productos de belleza.
El sueño de Maria es crecer en las ventas y llegar a tener un cargo en la empresa  donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Melcochita Community Bank. Maria is married, is 58 year old, and has 4 children, who are 33, 29, 25, and 22 years old and are working. Maria has always been dedicated to her house, but her niece motivated her to sell beauty products by catalogue. She has been a vendor for five years, and it is going well. Since Maria has been with Finca, she has learned to save, to be in a solidary agreement with people, and to be a friend. Maria needs a loan for 1200 soles to invest in beauty products. Maria’s dream is to grow her sales and to have a position in the business where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in beauty products

loans.name: Alcon Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA VIOLETA QUINTERO ES ORIGINARIA DE UN POBLADO CONOCIDO COMO HUEHUETAN EN EL ESTADO DE GUERRERO, DESDE HACE APROXIMADAMENTE 6 AÑOS RADICA EN LA COMUNIDAD DE MARQUELIA, DONDE VIVE ACTUALMENTE CON SU ESPOSO Y 2 HIJOS EN CASA DE SUS SUEGROS. DOÑA VIOLETA SE HA DEDICADO A LA VENTA DE COCTEL DE FRUTAS Y BOTANAS LAS CUALES VENDE EN UNA ESCUELA DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS.

ELLA NECESITA DEL FINANCIAMIENTO PARA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO YA QUE ADEMAS QUIERE VENDER OTROS PRODUCTOS POR LAS TARDES COMO JUGOS Y LICUADOS, CON ELLO  PODRA INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y SUS INGRESOS PARA MEJORAR EL NIVEL DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA, BRINDAR UNA MEJOR EDUCACION A SUS HIJOS Y ADEMAS EMPEZAR A CONSTRUIR SU CASA.

ES POR ELLO QUE SE ACERCÓ A FUNDACION REALIDAD Y JUNTO CON OTRAS 9 PERSONAS FORMARON UN GRUPO AL QUE LLAMARON "ALCÓN", EN SU MAYORÍA SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE COMIDA ECONÓMICA, JUGOS, VENTA DE PESCADO Y CALZADO.  

AL IGUAL QUE VIOLETA, TODO SU GRUPO ESPERAN PODER EMPRENDER SUS NEGOCIOS Y TENER MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES PARA SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
Ms. Violeta Q. is originally from a community called Huehuetan in the state of Guerrero. She has been living in Marquelia for approximately 6 years with her husband and two children in her in-laws’ house. Ms. Q. has been selling fruit cocktail and snacks at a school for 2 years. She needs this loan in order to expand her business because she also wants to sell other products—such as juice and shakes—in the evening. In so doing, she will be able to boost sales and increase her income so that she can improve her family’s standard of living, provide a better education for her children, and start to build her own house. Just like Violeta, the rest of the group members hope to be able to launch their businesses and offer their families better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fruits

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy P., age 33, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of weaving, earning approximately US $3.3 per day. Her husband operates his car taxi for garment factory workers in the province, earning an income of US $10 per day which is the primary source of income for the family.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to have her husband’s car repaired to attract more customers to consume his transportation services. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: repair the car

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is 45 years old and married with five children. She sells palm oil and has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more palm oil to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: José Roberto

texts.es:
Don José Roberto C. P. de 37 años de edad es un pequeño agricultor, quien se dedica específicamente a la siembra de Sandías y frijoles. Oficio que aprendió desde muy pequeño, de su papá y sus tíos quienes se dedican al mismo trabajo.

Hace 14 años se independizo de su familia paterna e inicio su negocio con la convicción de sacar adelante a su familia. Algo que ha logrado con mucho orgullo, puesto que alega tiene muchas cosas que ha adquirido gracias a los avances que ha tenido con los financiamientos.

Su mayor anhelo es tener su parcela de tierra, ya que donde siembra son tierras que alquila. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus tres hijos de 18, 17 y 14 años y aun que alega que en este negocio se tienen altibajos por las bajas o alzas en los precios, ha podido superarse en gran manera y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.

Este crédito lo invertirá en la siembra de Sandia, es su noveno ciclo y posee un record crediticio muy bueno del cual se siente muy orgulloso.

loans.use: Compra de prductos para sembrar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sow seeds in his fields.

loans.name: Zoila Cristina

texts.es: Zoila Cristina M. D. M. vive con madre, esposo y su hija Gabriela D. 16 años, la familia M. residen en el departamento D. San Salvador. Es increíble como Zoila es reconocida por muchos clientes, por su  admirable empeño por salir adelante, son ya 26 años los que Zoila tiene D. poseer su negocio, la mitad D. su vida dedicada a vender en su puesto que se ubica actualmente en el mercado central, ella ofrece variedad D. ropa para niños y ropa interior para niños, damas y caballeros, el deseo D. Zoila es aprovechar al máximo los meses que se aproximan ya que su demanda se ve aumentada en época naviD.ña es para ello que solicita D. este crédito que le permita  surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila Cristina M. D. M. lives with her mother, her husband, and her daughter Gabriela, who is 16 years old. The M. family lives in the department of San Salvador. It is amazing to see how Zoila is being recognized by many customers for her admirable drive to succeed. She has owned her clothes selling business for 26 years (half her life!), where she sells a wiD. variety of children's clothing, lingerie, and children's and men's undergarments. Zoila wishes to take advantage of the coming months, since demand for her products increases during the holiday season. Zoila requests this loan to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her business

loans.name: Irma Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 01 hijo, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Cahuaya, estudio educación Primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años y su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado porcino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado mayor para engorde, la señora mejora el ganado y luego los comercializa  en las ferias regionales, una vez por semana.

Su mayor deseo es poner un negocio tipo emporio para expender carnes.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of San Pedro community bank in the community of Ancara, which is in the Ilave district of El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 35 years old, married, and has 1 child. She lives in the Cahuaya sector of Ancara and completed primary schooling. Irma has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan for 300 PEN allowed her to increase working capital for her business buying and selling pork. Currently, she needs a loan of 1,000 PEN which will allow her to buy livestock, which she will fatten then sell in weekly regional markets. Her greatest wish is to open a butcher shop. She enjoys saving and attending her group's meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle.

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en:
Loleta A. is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Pitonuu. She is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Loleta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting taro for sale. Loleta has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Loleta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loleta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Loleta is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Loleta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Wilma's Group

texts.en:
Wilma G. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has two school-age children. She is from the village of Facoma. Wilma has been in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2006, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase products to sell. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her ninth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay for the tuition fees of her children.

Wilma is the leader of a ten member group accessing a loan from ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "ASA Facoma".

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Noma M. is 29 and married with 1 child (3-months-old).  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Noma has 1 year of experience in this business.  Noma needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Noma joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Noma's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Noma M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Kazinga Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Cate is 58 years old and married with five children between the ages of 36 and 44. She also takes care of two orphans. 

Cate has a retail shop in Kazinga trading centre that has been operational for three years. This is the second time Cate has requested a loan from Pearl Microfinance, and she hopes this one will also work wonders for her. Cate hopes to expand her shop with more goods which she believes will help bring in more profits, hence more savings. 

She is grateful that she has been able to pay school fees for her children as well as taking good care of them.

loans.use: Expanding her shop with more goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ingredients for her business

loans.name: Janchiv

texts.en:
Janchiv is 27 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Janchiv and his family live together in a 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent, on a plot of land with a yard that belongs to his sister. Janchiv's wife is a very supportive person for him and his business. 

Janchiv attended training in carpentry in 2007, and after he finished the course he started his own business with a working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~ 70 USD). After 3 years of hard work, his working capital has grown to 500,000 tugrugs (~ 351 USD). 

Janchiv has been using his father-in-law's workplace and tools to manufacture wooden products. He has great communication skills and says, “I would like to produce high quality and finely crafted products for my customers.” He is requesting a 350,000 tugrugs (~ 246 USD) loan to purchase materials to manufacture wooden furniture and parts for a 'ger' (the Mongolian nomadic tent).

loans.use: To purchase wooden planks

loans.name: Rahmatillo

texts.ru: Холматов Рахматилло проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 54 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Рахматилло занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Рахматилло хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Rahmatillo K. lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 54 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker. Rahmatillo does agriculture. He grows mainly vegetables. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer. Rahmatillo wants to sow and collect a good harvest for reselling.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Zyryl

texts.en: Zyryl R. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Zyryl owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Zyryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Zyryl is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mukama Aliba Ayaggadde Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Parsis operates a thirty-year-old produce and water sales business in Nabuti, Mukono. She mostly sells bananas, charcoal, and maize. Before she ventured into this business, she was a farmer.

Her success and longevity, Parsis says, boils down to a long drawn out enterprising hard work spirit. As a result, her nine children have all received an education and she has also managed to construct her own rental apartments.

Parsis’s lucrative business has been bringing her profits to the tune of 210,000 shillings every month ever since she began. With this loan, she intends to inject a new impetus into her business by purchasing more produce and mineral water cartons.

loans.use: To buy more crops like maize and bananas and more cartons of mineral water

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en:
Imelda M. is from the town of Sinamar Norte, San Mateo, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Imelda is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Imelda M. group.

Imelda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $45 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly M., 46 years old, is a married woman and a mother. Currently, Ly M. stays at home to be responsible for the household's daily routine. She has been earning a small income by selling ice cream to kids from home. She also relies on the income from her husband’s business; he helps to contribute to the family by driving a trailer taxi. 

This couple has six children who are unmarried. Three of their children are employed: one is a taxi driver and two are garment workers. 

Ly M. seeks $500, which will enable her to improve the financial capital of her ice-cream sales business.

loans.use: To improve the financial capital of ice-cream sales business

loans.name: Mandahtuya

texts.en:
Mandahtuya T. is 48 years old and lives with her son in a traditional housing tent called a 'ger' in Hovd province, western Mongolia. Her daughter is married and another son is working on a road project in Bayan-Ulgii province. During the monitoring, she has been living alone. 

Since 1989, she has been working as a retailer and has obtained much experience in this field. Mandahtuya is a reliable client of XacBank with a good loan profile. She is a hard-working woman with a good manner and behavior. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and import food products such as rice, sugar, and flour from China.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Constantine

texts.en:
Constantine is a 58-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married and his wife is not employed or in business. He is a father to seven children, a number very common in the rural areas of the country and they live in a semi-permanent house but he hopes to construct a permanent house and also educate his children. 

Constantine is in cocoa buying and selling as his business and has been in it for seven years though he says sometimes prices for the cash crop fluctuate, thus affecting his cash flow.
