He also plans to open up a retail shop in future to increase his avenues for income. He intends to use the loan funds to buy cocoa from farmers for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing cocoa for resale

loans.name: Kanyantorogo Twekambe Women's, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hard-working and die-hard agriculturalist Edith K., age 49 years, has been maintaining a banana plantation and coffee plantation for more than ten years in Burema, Kihihi. This fetches her about $89 per month, though not enough to sustain her family of six children who are pursuing their education at higher institutions of learning. 

She has persevered at keeping her enterprise growing. Her aim for taking up this loan is to enable her to buy mulches and fertilizers for her plantations and also to hire additional laborers.  She is looking at an expansion plan and wanting to transport her products to bigger markets. This will help Edith increase productivity and also earn more revenue, allowing her to be able to live a more sustainable life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, mulches and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kuwoe Group

texts.en:
Sarah S., shown holding the sign, is the leader of Kuwoe Group. This 36-year-old mother of six children between the ages of 2 and 16, several of whom are enrolled in school from kindergarten to sixth grade, completed the sixth grade before Liberia's Civil War interrupted her education and she began having children.

Sarah sells a variety of personal-use products such as lotion, hair care products, and baby care products at the New Georgia Junction. She began her business eight years ago using 5,000 Liberian Dollars that her friends gave her. She will use her 4,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 21,000 Liberian Dollar loan to purchase additional inventory to sell including lotion, hair products, deodorant, and slippers.

Sarah's goal is to build a shop, buy land, and educate all of her children.

loans.use: To purchase personal hygiene products, baby care products, and slippers to sell

loans.name: Sophak

texts.en: Mr. Sophak S. and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Lok, have been married since 1999 and have three children, one son and two daughters. One attends school and the other two stay at home. Residing in a village approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, Sophak grows corn and eggplant on his farmland. Having received and repaid a previous loan, he is now requesting a loan of $1000 to start a new business selling cows and oxen. Sophak will use the extra income earned to better support his family.

loans.use: To buy cows and oxen for resale.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 55 years old. Flordeliza is married. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Flordeliza is grateful she has the farm that helps her provide for her family.

Flordeliza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Du's Group

texts.en:
Du T. N. is 51 years old with two working children. She has a shop that sells seafood in the local market. Her business started in 2004 and developed very well. Every month she makes 3,500,000 VND profit. To have this good business result, she has borrowed from our credit program to buy more kinds of food to meet the different demands of customers. Currently, she wants a loan of 6,758,000 VND to invest in her shop
 
Tinh  T.  T. is  50 years old. She is a farmer, growing rice and vegetables, and raising pigs. She wants a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy fertilizer and animal feed.

Hue T. P. is 49 years old. She has a small grocery shop in Coloa village and wants a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy more products to sell.

Nhan T. N. is 35 years old and has a shop that sells carpets. She  wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her shop.

Xuan T. D. is 35 years old. She is a farmer with 200 chickens she raises for eggs. She needs a loan of 5,450,000 VND to buy food for them.

Lan T. T. T. is 47 years old. She is a farmer raising ten pigs for meat. She wants a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy pig feed and improve her pig house.

loans.use: to invest in her shop

loans.name: Jessica Liliana

texts.es:
Jessica de 23 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas. 

Hace cuatro meses ella empezó con su tienda para ayudar con los gastos familiares a su esposo y así dales una mejor vida a sus dos hijos de 5 años y el otro de 8 meses. Trabaja en su tienda vendiendo víveres y dulces desde las 05h45am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar lácteos, enlatados y detergentes para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener un panadería y que sus hijos tenga una mejor vida económica.
texts.en:
Jessica is 23 years old and has a small store in the front of her home. She lives in a semi urban area called Fortín which is characterized by its dirt paths and hills.

Four months ago she began her store to help her husband with the family expenses and to give her family a better quality of life especially her two children who are 5 years old and 8 months old. Jessica works in her store by selling provisions and candy from 5:45 in the morning until 10:00 p.m.

With the loan she wants to buy dairy products, canned goods and detergents for her store. In the future she wants a bakery and that her children will have a better economic life.

loans.use: To buy dairy products, canned goods, and detergents.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina E. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 66 years old and married. To make a living, Lorina owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs, goat and other cattles for sale. Lorina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lorina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Lorina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Lorina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  solicito 500 $us. Vive en Achacahi y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su comunidad. Es Soltero.
 El crédito lo empleará en la compra de una vaca lechera, la cual será el comienzo para su nueva actividad, como productor lechero. Es el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Miguel is requesting a loan of $500USD.  He lives in Achacahi and works as a taxi driver in his community.  He is single.

Miguel will use his loan to purchase a dairy cow.  This will be the beginning of a new business for him as a dairy farmer.  This is his first loan from Impro and his first via Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow to begin working as a dairy farmer

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen

texts.es: Dorotea del Carmen tiene 61 años. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, verduras y maíz, hace más de 33 anos que se dedica a este negocio. Siempre le ha gustado trabajar Dorotea tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación, pues ha sido de gran provecho. Se levanta muy temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, por lo que sus clientes solicitan mucho el lo que es el maíz. Debido a esto es que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima  como frutas, verduras y maíz.
texts.en: Dorotea del Carmen is 61 years old and has been selling fruits, vegetables, and corn for more than 33 years.  She has always enjoyed working and Dorotea has been a Fundación client for a long time.  This has been very helpful to her.  She rises early every morning, and from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM, her customers make many requests for merchandise, particularly corn.  She is asking for this loan so that she can invest in inventory, such as fruits, vegetables, and corn.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Firyal

texts.en:
Firyal has been selling clothing, door to door, for the past 11 years. She is married with 2 children and lives in Saida, in the south of Lebanon.

This is Firyal's 7th loan with Al Majmoua and the extra income generated from previous loans allowed Firyal to contribute to her son's wedding as well as to paint her home.

Firyal is now requesting a loan of $2500 to buy more clothing & Brazillian gold to sell. She sells to her friends, neighbours, and anybody she comes across.

Firyal feels that she is a very brave and courageous businesswoman and wishes to help her family by contributing to the household expenses, improving all of their lives.

One day, Firyal dreams of opening her own shop and not having to go door-to-door to sell her wares.

loans.use: To buy clothing & Brazillian gold to sell.

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn is from the village of Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  She is 38 years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, Alyn owns and operates a retail (sari-sari) store, selling to local community members. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In August 20, 2009, Alyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She had fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her sari-sari store.  She is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her store. This will be Alyn 3rd loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as working capital for convenience store

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosmeri; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa deportiva, la socia atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the Comuzone I Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco. It is part of the province and department of Cusco.

The borrower is Rosmeri; she is 23 years old, single, with one son. She rotates through her daily activities for the athletic clothing sales business. She tends the business from 9 am to 6 pm. She wants to improve and grow her clothing sales business. She is requesting the loan to purchase clothes wholesale.

The borrower is happy with this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase clothes wholesale

loans.name: Munduz's Group

texts.en:
Munduz S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 56 and married to a hoist man. She has raised a son and a daughter. In the near future the son plans to go to Russia to work there. The daughter is married. 

In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Munduz sells convenience goods. She started with the initial investment of 3,000 KGS and now she earns 10,000 KGS per month. She also breeds livestock to make additional money. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase two sheep for breeding. In the future Munduz wants to see her son get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Ma Belgica

texts.es:
La señora Bélgica Domínguez P., es casada con el señor Dionisio Pérez Vázquez,   con quien procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales dos ya están casado y dos están  a su responsabilidad  y son: Pilar de doce años y la más chica es Ana cristel de seis años.

       Ella  es la primera vez que  solicita un préstamo en fundación realidad ,  y es para comprar materiales y  surtir su pequeña papelería  ya que hay cosas que le hace falta  y su clientela la busca,  lleva con ella dos años y le va bien a pesar que le hace falta algunas cosas.

       Con el apoyo de su esposo se animo a poner  su propia  actividad ya que en donde ella vive  no hay papelería cerca y los alumnos tienen que ir hasta la otra comunidad para comprar y para apoyarlos  en no irse muy  retirado  del pueblo.
 
      En los ingresos que ella obtiene lo invierte en la misma papelería  ya que hay  útiles que sele terminan y su clientela lo busca  para utilizarla y ella no les diga que no hay.
 
      Desea que su papelería  se incremente día con día para que con ella logre ahorrar para  sacar adelante a sus dos hijas que vienen creciendo y tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
Bélgica Domínguez P. is married to Dionisio Pérez Vázquez.  They have four children, two are already married and two are still in their care: 12 year-old Pilar and their youngest, 6 year-old Ana Cristel.

This is the first time that Bélgica has requested a loan from Fundación Realidad.  She is requesting the loan to buy materials with which to stock her small stationery store since there are items that her customers are looking for which she doesn't have.  Bélgica has owned her business for two years and it is doing well even though there are some things that she still lacks.

Bélgica decided to set up her own business, with her husband's support, because there isn't a nearby stationery store where she lives and pupils had to go to another village in order to buy their supplies.  She decided to support them so that they didn't have to travel far from their village.

Bélgica re-invests the profits that she makes back into her store since she often sells out of certain items and when her customers come to buy them she has to tell them that she doesn't have any.  She would like her stationery store to keep growing every day so that she can save up and get her two growing daughters ahead in life.  She would like them to receive a good education.

loans.use: To buy supplies to stock her stationery store

loans.name: Rufus

texts.en: Rufus is a member of Vision group in Faulu Kenya. He joined the group as a businessman who runs a barber shop. Rufus' business is located in the Kibera slums hence most of his customers are low-income earners. He started the business after leaving his previous job as a shopkeeper. Rufus hopes to establish more barber shops in other locations in five years. He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a shaving machine, TV and VCD player.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine, TV and VCD player.

loans.name: Luz Radiante Group

texts.es:
Vilma P. Peña, 47 años de edad, madre soltera, con 02 hijos, preside el grupo comunal "Luz Radiante".
Vilma desde hace 6 años instalò en su vivienda una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, donde realiza ventas al por menor.
Vilma es padre y madre para sus hijos, pues elL. soL. veL. por el bienestar de ambos. 
Actualmente Vilma viene pasando por un momento muy doloroso pues perdiò hace pocos dìas a un ser muy querido y cercano, su padre.
El prèstamo otorgado lo invertirà en comprar golosinas para diverficiar e incrementar sus ingresos.
(En L. Fotografìa Vilma se encuentra en el centro del grupo, viste de chompa color blanco y casaca color gris)
texts.en:
Vilma P. Peña is 47 years old, a single mother, and has 2 children.  She is president of the "Luz Radiante" (Bright Light) community bank.

Six years ago, Vilma set up a small grocery store in her home.  She sells her products retail.

Vilma is both father and mother to her children since she is the only one who looks out for their well-being.

Vilma is going through a very painful moment in her life right now since, a few days ago, she lost someone very dear and close to her: her father.

Vilma will invest this loan in buying candies to diversify her stock and increase her income.

(In the photo, Vilma is in the center of the group, wearing a white sweater and gray jacket).

loans.use: To buy candies to diversify her stock

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi A. has a small shop, where she sells food items such as tomatoes, onions, eggs, and other foodstuffs, at Abee near the fishing town of Elmina . She has been running this shop for more than eight years. Naomi uses her income to pay for her accommodations, utility bills, and food.  Naomi is applying for a loan because she would like to expand her business. Her plan is to buy more goods and increase the variety of goods sold at her shop to meet the needs of her customers. She will reinvest her profits into her business to keep it growing.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and increase the variety of goods sold at her shop

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia belongs to Pakpattan, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its dairy industry. Her home consists of two rooms and is located in the area of Khanpura. She has been living there with her family for the past 30 years.
 
She is 40 years old, married to M. M. and has four children. Her husband is well educated, and that’s why all of their children are enrolled in school except the eldest one, who has completed his education and runs a grocery store in the market.
 
Her husband also runs a grocery store in the community through which he sells daily use items like sugar, salt and spices to his clients at cheap rates. He is well known for his good customer dealings among his clients.

Razia is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. Through the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put into his store to fulfill the demands of his clients and earn better profits.

He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Razia is confident that an investment will bring better profits and improve his business.
 
She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Razia.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Melanita

texts.en:
Melanita P. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Melanita is separated from her spouse and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, buying and selling bananas and coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Melanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica A. is a 26 year old widow with one child who is not in school. Monica is currently in the business of selling tea and rice. She wants to use her loan to stock more tea and rice. Monica's future goal is to have an animal sales business.

loans.use: stock tea and rice.

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nelly Elizabeth tiene 30 años de edad, tiene dos hijos menores. Vive en en la provincia de Chepen 

Nelly Elizabeth se dedica a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. A si mismo se dedica a la venta de calzado por pedido.
El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos familiares y le ayuda  en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.
Nelly Elizabeth  desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos , de esta manera tener algunos en su almacén para su distribución. Por ello a creido por conveniente solicitar un prestamo a Edpyme Alternativa 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.
Nelly Elizabeth es una cliente antigua para Edpyme Alternativa, y solo trabaja con esta institución. Nelly Elizabeth  en todo momento, ha demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Nelly Elizabeth is 30 years old.  She has two minor children.  She lives in Chepén Province.

Nelly Elizabeth works selling cosmetics via catalogue.  She sells these products among her neighbors and acquaintances.  She strives daily to obtain more customers because the more orders she places the higher the income she earns from the company supplying her products.  She also sells shoes on order. The business helps her meet family expenses and helps her support her household economy.

Nelly Elizabeth wants to expand the business acquiring more products so that she can have some of them on hand in her store to sell.  To do so, she’s felt it advisable to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach her goal.

Nelly Elizabeth is a long standing Edpyme Alternativa client and only works with this institution.  Nelly Elizabeth has shown responsibility and punctuality all the time.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to stock her business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. As a supportive wife, Ekua's income helps to take care of the home. Ekua wants to increase her income. She needs to increase the quantity of smoked fish released to her customers so she can make more money. A loan will help Ekua purchase more fresh fish to smoke, to increase her income. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke to increase her income.

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Mrs. Ket has a small kiosk wooden house, from which she is used to selling a few fresh fruits and vegetables in the Baray district. She has been running this selling business for over eight years, earning a profit an average of US$5 to cover the daily expenses in her family. She also has a life partner in her husband who is a blacksmith. He is making around $9 each day to share the financial responsibility with Mrs. Ket. 

This couple has been married for many years and is blessed with a school-aged child. Mrs. Ket’s husband wants to have his own place for starting the blacksmith business but he doesn’t have cash to make it possible. Seeing that, Mrs. Ket has been seeking a Kiva loan to build a new smithy for her husband. Mrs. Ket hopes she will increase her income to make her family to live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to build a new smithy for her husband.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old and married. 

Ahmad has owned a bakery since 2005. He has more than five years experience; his bakery is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by and he has a good reputation. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate his shop and to make ceramic tiles. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to make ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Bera Cruz

texts.es: Doña Bera Cruz se dedica a una pulpería desde su casa de habitación. Dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 22 años, inicio primeramente vendiendo golosinas para los niños, y poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio de tal manera que pudiera vender granos básicos, que es lo que más compra la gente. Ella afirma que su objetivo al establecer este negocio fue buscando una fuente alternativa para brindarle manutención a sus hijos, sin embargo este negocio les ha servido muchísimo para salir adelante, ya que sus hijos pueden tener la oportunidad de estudiar. Actualmente está solicitando un este crédito para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, detergentes, pan, sopas y enlatados.
texts.en: Bera Cruz has a grocery store which is located in her own home.  She started her business 22 years ago.  She initially started out selling candies to children and gradually re-invested in her business.  This enabled her to start selling basic grains which is what people buy the most.  She confirms that her aim on setting up her business was to find an alternative source of support for her children.  The business has been a great help to her in getting ahead in life since her children have been able to study as a result.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy candies, basic grains, detergents, bread, soup and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy candies, basic grains, detergents, bread, soup and canned goods

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora  is 59 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 12 children.
 
Leonora  has a shop that sells beverages, canned goods and breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks to sell.

Leonora  has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Leonora  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
From Kisumu, Alice is 32 years old and married to Kennedy. They have three children who are in school.

Alice runs a grocery store. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES, which she intends to use to buy bananas, watermelon and passion fruit to add to her stock. She will use the profits made to help her with her family's needs and pay school fees for her children.

Alice hopes to expand her business and have a big house of her own in the near future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, watermelon and passion fruit to add to her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wrapping paper,flowers and books.

loans.name: Ana Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ana Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending, fish vending, and ready-to-wear clothing. Ana Fe is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

Ana Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Otgontsagaan

texts.en:
Otgontsagaan is 37 years old, divorced and lives with his aged mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2008 and before that, he used to work as a driver in a private company. He owns a small piece of land and a house. 

Currently, he is planning to build a garage beside the house because the Mongolian winter is freezing cold and it badly affects a car to stay outside during the winter. But because of financial difficulties, he needs additional funding to build it.
 
Otgontsagaan is taking a loan to purchase some bricks and other building materials to build a garage inside his fence.

loans.use: To purchase some bricks and other building materials to build a garage inside his fence.

loans.name: Muhabbat's Group

texts.en:
Muhabbat is the leader of this group. She is 47, and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has a son who is married and works in Russia. Muhabbat has been working as a post officer since 1990; her monthly salary is 3700 soms. In order to earn additional money to meet her daily needs, she breeds livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase feed for livestock. In the future, Muhabbat wishes to build a new house.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, 33 years old, is a married woman with six children, all of whom are in school.

She has a business of selling fish in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Monica requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income to buy a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Daisy Jane

texts.en:
Daisy Jane is single, 25 years old,and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Daisy Jane manages an internet cafe to earn a living and had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to acquire additional one set of computer for her internet cafe.Daisy Jane internet cafe helps the students of there villages for research.

Daisy Jane has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Daisy Jane hopes to expand her business for her future family that is coming over soon. She want also to have a big space for her internet cafe, she is savings for the renovation and with the help of GDMPC.

loans.use: to purchase one set of computers for her internet cafe

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Cristina is a married woman with six children aged between 2 and 15. Cristina's husband makes hollow blocks for a living.

Cristina has been making baskets for 15 years. She uses buri and rattan palms to make baskets. Cristina earns about 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with her business. Cristina plans to use her loan to purchase more buri and rattan palms. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more buri and rattan palms.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan tiene 22 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy alegre. Es soltera pero vive en compañía de sus padres, su hermano, y de su pequeño hijo, por quien se esfuerza por darle un mejor bienestar. La actividad que realiza, es la venta de ropa, mercaderái que trae de la ciudad de Lima, ahí adquiere variedad de ropa y a precios bajos. Asimismo elige aquellos cuyos diseños marcan la moda actual. Es así que dicha prenda es colocada a su clientes dejándo a crédito. Tiene dos años dedicándose a éste negocio, tiempo que le ha valido para hacerse conocida. manifiesta quer el tener este negocio le ha dado el gusto por ser independiente y cubrir sus gastos y velar por su hijo. Sin embargo algunso de sus clientes no le terminan de pagar la mercadería que escogio y eso le atrasa mucho en el negocio. Su mayor anhelo es poder abrir una tienda de venta de ropas. Este sería el primer crédito con la institución MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más ropa en mayores cantidades, todas de buena calidad y que sean a la moda.
texts.en:
Susan, age 22, is an enterprising and cheerful woman. She is single and lives with her parents, her brother, and her young son who she strives to give a better well-being. Her business involves selling clothes which she brings in from the city of Lima, where she is able to acquire a variety of merchandise at low prices. Susan tries to choose brand-name designs that are in fashion. When selling these clothes, she extends credit to her customers. She has been in this business for two years and has become recognized during this time.

Susan says that this business has given her a taste for independence since she is able to cover her expenses and provide for her child. However, some of her customers have not completed the payments for their merchandise, so Susan has fallen behind in her business. Her greatest wish is to open a clothing store.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Susan hopes to receive everyone’s support. The amount she requested will be used to buy more clothing in large quantities, all of which will be of good quality and in fashion.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Pablo Roberto

texts.es: Pablo Roberto tiene 37 años, es un hombre responsable que tiene bajo su cargo 6 hijos de diferentes edades. El se dedica a una pequeña pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación, inicio con esfuerzo propio ya que tenia la necesidad de tener un empleo y al mismo tiempo proveerle a su familia los ingresos del hogar. Uno de los sueños que Pablo tiene es poder realizarle mejora a su vivienda y con el paso del tiempo poder lograrlo. El solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar granos básicos, huevos, leche, fideos, aceite, jabón.
texts.en: Pablo Roberto is 37 years old.  He is a responsible man with six children of various ages in his care.  He has a small, home-based grocery store.  He started it with his own effort because he needed employment and to provide income for his family and home.  One of Pablo’s dreams is to make some home improvements and in time to do so.  He requests the loan to buy basic grains, eggs, milk, noodles, oil and soap.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
En el municipio de Managua, el señor Luis Alonso es una persona luchadora debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su casa para darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia, es una persona acompañado y tiene su cargo a  una persona.
Con este crédito que Ceprodel le ha otorgado agradece porque así le ha dado un mejor nivel de vida a su familia, con este desembolso lo utilizara para comprar materiales como servicio higiénico, bloque, cemento, hierro para construir baño para darle mejor seguridad a su vivienda.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, is Luis Alonso who is a fighter due to the fact that he has taken care of the wellbeing of his house in order to give his family a better quality of life. He has one person in his care.

He is thankful for the loan from Ceprodel that he has obtained as it has given a higher level of life to his family. He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as a toilet, blocks, cement, and iron to be used in bathroom construction in order to have better security in his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to improve his housing

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира честная и добрая женщина, она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она занимается скотоводством более 4 лет. Сейчас она имеет 5 голов быка и одну дойную корову. Она рано утро доит корову, и продает молоко соседям, а также кормит семью молокам. Кроме этого она занимается дехканским хозяйством. Она изучила, как выращивать сельхоз культур, как посеять его, в каком сезоне и как полит. Выращивание приносит ей хороший доход. Гулмира хочет расширить скотоводство и запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота и корма для них.  Она надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарна вам за ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulmira is an honest and good woman. She is married and a loving mother of two children. She has been working with cattle breeding for more than 4 years. Now she owns 5 bulls and a milk cow. Early in the morning she milks the cow, sells the milk to her neighbors, and also feeds her family with milk. In addition, she works with farming. She learned how to grow agricultural crops, how to sow it, in which season and how to water it. Plant cultivation brings her a good income. 

Gulmira wants to expand the cattle breeding and requests a loan for purchasing cattle and feed for them. She hopes for your support and is thankful to you in advance for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed for them

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 29 years old and married with two children, ages five and nine months. He runs a welding shop. He has been in the business for two years and has employed four people. His other source of income is from tailoring. He describes his business environment as good because his customers visit him regularly. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to improve his living standards. He hopes to expand his business to a company in the future. He has applied for a loan of 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is a married woman with seven children, five of whom attend school while two have completed school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mauwa has operated a food stall for the past six years; her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 45,000 she wants to purchase more stock of cooking oil, sugar, rice and beans for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cooking oil, sugar, rice and beans for her food stall.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es: Serafina es socia del Banco Comunal Fuerza, tiene su negocio de venta de cuy y gallinas, también vende gelatina, gracias Finca Peru pudo mejorar en su negocio y aprendió a ser responsable y a ahorrar, cosa que no lo hacía antes, le gusta las capacitaciones que le dan porque le ayuda mucho en su negocio, a si como en su vida personal. Serafina solicita un prestamo que lo invertirá en la compra de cuyes y construirá galpones para la crianza de cuyes.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Hilda Yaneth

texts.en: En mi comunidad me conocen por Hilda, soy comerciante y dueña de un negocio ubicado en una Plaza llamada San Sebastian. Tengo cinco años de tener mi tienda la que me ha generado ganacias y ayudar a mis dos hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Venta de ropa y cosmeticos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a boutique that sews and sells garments

loans.name: Satia

texts.en: Satia C. is 37 years old, married and has four children.  Satia’s husband has been unable to provide a steady income that can support their family.  Therefore, when she heard about the loan facilities available to women entrepreneurs, she joined SPBD’s program.  Satia was confident that she could run her own business and support the family.  She has since used two small loans to open a beach fale business.  Her fales are small open huts with thatched roofs built in the style of traditonal Samoan houses.  Satia caters to backpackers and picnickers.  She is sure of the demand for her fales given their unbeatable location on the white sandy beaches along Samoa’s coast.  She is anxious to build additional fales.  She will use another loan to put up three more fales.

loans.use: to build additional fales

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Mr. Cristino is 44 years old. He opened his own tapestry shop ten years ago, after having worked for several years at a tapestry that shut down and left him unemployed. His wife also contributes income to the family as she owns her own business selling clothes. They have three children together, they are all going to school and are excellent students.

Cristino's tapestry is doing very well, he has his own clientèle which is very satisfied with his work. In his tapestry he fixes all kinds of sofas, chairs and cushions.

He only owns one sowing machine and he is wishing to purchase a second one. This new sowing machine would allow him to work with thicker fabrics and even leather, since he wants to make his own designs of leather sofas which have a strong demand and sell for high prices.

The cost of the sowing machine he wants to purchase is of $550 at the local plaza. Hence he is requesting a loan for this amount which he is committing to pay back in a monthly basis.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


El señor Cristino de 44 años abrió su propia tapicería hace diez años atrás, luego de haber trabajado varios años en una tapicería que cerró dejandolo sin trabajo. Su señora también aporta con los ingresos de la casaella tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropas, tienen 3 hijos juntos, todos van al colegio y son excelentes alumnos. La tapicería de Cristino marcha muy bien, cuenta con una buena clientela que está bastante satisfecha con su trabajo. En su tapicería arregla todo tipo de sillones, sillas y acolchados; el cuenta con una sola máquina de coser y está muy deseoso de adquirir una nueva que le permitirá trabajar con telas mas gruesas y hasta cuero, pues el desea fabricar sus propios diseños de sillones de cueros que hoy día tienen bastante demanda y son vendidos a buen precio. El precio en plaza de la máquina que el desea adquirir es de $. 550, es por eso que solicita un crédito por ese monto que se compromente a pagarlos de forma mensual.

loans.use: Purchasing a sowing machine for tapestry/Compra de máquina de coser para tapicería

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es:
Ciriaco is 37 years old, and happily married for more than 12 years to Juana Benítez who is 36 years old. They have four children who are all students. Since a very young age Ciriaco began to work with his father in the manufacturing of balls (for sports activities) where he learned all the necessary skills for what he works in today. Thanks to this work he is able to provide the necessities for his family. After many years of working, he was able to little by little acquire his own independent set of tools. For the last 15 years, Mr. Ciriaco has been one of the princiapl providers of balls to sports facilities in the area.

He is asking for a loan in order to purchase leather and paints as his sales have increased recently and he needs to expand this part of the production.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Ciriaco tiene 37 años, está felizmente casado hace mas de 12 años con Juana Benítez de 36 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos todos en edad escolar. Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar con su padre como ayudante en la fabricación de pelotas allí fue donde aprendió esta actividad que hoy constituye su actividad principal, gracias a esto le está brindando la atención necesaria a su familia; después de trabajar mucho tiempo poco a poco fue adquiriendo sus propias herramientas independizándose hace 15 años, el Sr Ciriaco es uno de los principales proveedores de pelotas a las casas deportivas de la zona Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuero y pintura ya que las ventas han aumentado satisfactoriamente en estos últimos tiempos y necesita aumentar de esta forma la producción

loans.use: Purchase leather and paints

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.en:
María de Jesús Vazquez Péres develops a Mexican tradition that is important to keep: making piñatas. She started creating and selling piñatas for her neighbors and acquaintances 4 years ago. Today she has a wholesale customer. All began when she wasn’t able to afford the cost of school supplies for her two sons with her husband’s salary. María de Jesús works all day creating piñatas and her husband and children help her during their free time.

María de Jesús is requesting a credit for US$200.00 to be repaid at a 4-month term, that she will use in order to buy materials for the Holidays. This is the busiest time for piñata sales and she wants to be prepared and increase her income in order to be ready for the big expenses at the beginning of the year. With your help, she will be able to make her dream of growing her business come true.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

María de Jesús Vazquez Péres, recrea una tradición mexicana que es muy importante conservar, la elaboración de piñatas, desde hace cuatro años empezó a elaborar y vender piñatas a sus vecinos y conocidos y hoy tiene un comprador a mayoreo. Todo comenzó cuando el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para pagar los gastos de libros y materiales que piden sus dos hijos en la escuela. María de Jesús se dedica todo el día a fabricar las piñatas, y su esposo e hijos le ayudan en sus tiempos libres.

María de Jesús está pidiendo un crédito de US $200 a 4 meses para poder comprar material para la temporada navideña, porque es la temporada en que más gente anda comprando piñatas y ella quiere prepararse para obtener mas ganancias y así asegurar los gastos fuertes de inicios de año. Con su ayuda ella podrá hacer realidad este sueño de crecimiento en su negocio.

loans.use: Buying raw materials for her products.

loans.name: Damasa Martinez

texts.en:
Damasa has been selling curtains and sets of bedding for more than eighteen years. She has learned the rules of the market and is now a very experienced businesswoman with extraordinary abilities to attract people to her business and hold them. She has four sons who are married; her two daughters go to the university in Santo Domingo, the capital.

Damasa wants to push her business forward. She is requesting a loan to rent a locale where she can run the business. In fact, the entrepreneur is getting elderly and can’t walk along the streets to sell the products as she did before. She is also thinking about introducing tablecloths in the business so as to diversify the offering to the customers and thus attract more people.

Damasa is a very punctual and truthful woman. She has already obtained a loan from FSMA and she repaid successfully. This second loan will help the 50-year-old entrepreneur to reach her economic goals and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To rent a small locale for her business and buy curtains, tablecloths and bed spreads for resale

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
The communal bank Rubí was begun eleven years ago. Currently there are 26 members, and they have spent 34 seasons together. The founding members were Marcelina, Ceverina, Victoria, Dora, and Fortunata. In the communal bank, members learn to be punctual and responsible, to improve their self-esteem, to organize their daily activities better, and, above all, to save their money. The members manage different businesses, including selling groceries, pots and pans, vegetables, oils, coca, meat, clothing, jewelry; making cheeses and furniture; growing avocado, and performing various artisan tasks, including weaving.

Each member has her own store to tell, as in the case of Marcelina, who began her business traveling to markets twice a week with very few goods, and now goes to more fairs with stocked merchandise. Marcelina counts on two motor-taxis that she was able to buy using her savings from the communal bank to bring in additional income. Apart from these businesses, she makes typical regional clothing, including wedding gowns.

On the other hand, Fortunata weaves beautiful sweaters and skirts that she sells at markets. At first, Fortunata only sold garments she wove, and now, she sells fabric clothing and a wiD. variety of styles.

The members need different amounts for the loans, adding up to a total of $4,450 in loans from the communal bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, milk, oil, wool, dyes, cheese molds, pork, mutton, wood, lacquer, paint, corn, wheat, lubricants, coca, carrots, onions, and squash.

Their savings will be used for the education of their children, additional cash, an emergency, and future needs. The dreams of these women incluD. having a sawmill, having a larger business, running a business raising guinea pigs and generating biofuels, being a businesswoman selling jewelry, and getting their children ahead as good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Rubí se inició hace 11 años. Actualmente son 26 socias y ya tienen 34 ciclos juntas. Las socias fundadoras fueron Marcelina, Ceverina, Victoria, Dora y Fortunata. En el Banco Comunal las socias aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables, a mejorar su autoestima, organizar mejor sus actividades diarias y sobre todo a ahorrar. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes, ollas, verduras, lubricantes, coca, carne, ropa, joyería, la elaboración D. quesos, producción D. palta, fabricación D. muebles, feriantes y artesanía en telar. Cada socia tiene una historia que contar, como es el caso D. Marcelina, quien inició su negocio viajando a las ferias, 2 veces por semana, y con muy poca mercadería, y actualmente viaja a más ferias con mercadería surtida. Marcelina cuenta que con los ahorros que pudo reunir en su Banco Comunal compró 2 mototaxis que le generan más ingresos, además D. estos negocios, Marcelina hace ropa típica D. la zona como fustanes. Por otro lado Fortunata teje bellas chompas y enaguas, que venD. en las ferias. Al inicio Fortunata solo vendía prendas elaboradas por ella y, actualmente, venD. ropa D. fábrica y variedad D. modelos, Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 400 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,200 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra arroz, leche, aceite, lanas, tintes, moldes para hacer quesos, cerdo, carnero, madera, laca, pintura, maíz, trigo, lubricantes, coca, zanahoria, zapallo, cebolla. Los ahorros los utilizarán para la educación D. sus hijos, tener un capital mas granD., alguna urgencia y para el futuro. Los sueños D. las socias son tener un aserradero, un negocio mas granD., tener una empresa D. crianza D. cuyes y generar biogás, ser empresario en la venta D. joyas y que sus hijos salgan adelante siendo buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Investing in purchasing a wide variety of goods for many businesses, including foodstuffs, crafts, vegetables, and meats.

loans.name: Herminia Da Cruz

texts.pt:
Herminia Da Cruz Vitorino lives with her partner and four children in the neighborhood of Nhancondo, in Maxixe, Mozambique. All four of her kids are enrolled in school. She started a business of raising and selling chicken to help her husband with the household expenses, which were getting to be too much for him to cover on his own. She joined the program in November of 2007 and used her first loan to double the number of chickens in her coop. Herminia plans to use her second loan to buy feed and vaccine for the chickens. If things keep going well, she plans to buy a car to help with the transportation needs of the business, which include the transport of chickens to the market where they are sold to the public.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva volunteer.

Herminia e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 4 filhos. O marido de herminia e trabalhar numa Instituicao do Estado. Ele recebe cerca de $125. Com este salario ele enfrenta alguns problemas para sustentar a sua familia. Por isso Herminia teve que comecar a fzer negocio para apoir o seu marido nas despesas da casa. Herminia e sua familia vivem em Nhancondo, no Municipio da Maxixe. Ela cria frangos na sua residencia para a venda.Herminia tomou um primeiro emprestimo em Novembro de 2007. Ela conseguiu reembolsar todo o dinheiro pedido. e sem problemas porque sempre pagou pontualmente a sua divida. Assim ela quer pedir um outro emprestimo para a compra de vacinas e racao para os pintos, pois que ela aumentou a quantidade de 500 para 1000 pintos.Isso aconteceu graca ao emprestimo que ela tomou. Ela esta muito feliz por ter conseguido o emprestimo, sem ele talvez estivesse a enfrentar muitas dificuldades para repor o stock de pintos. Assim ela pensa em continuar por muito mais tempo a trabalhar com o FDM e com o KIVA.Os filhos de Herminia estao todos a estudar. Os mais velhos estao no ensino Secundario e os dois mais novos estao no ensino primario basico. SE o negocio continuar a correr bem num futuro ainda que a longo prazo ela e o seu companheiro pensam em comprar uma carrinha que lhes facilitara as deslocaoes para a compra de racao, transporte dos frangos ate ao mercado, incluindo a aquisicao dos proprios pintos.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and vaccine

loans.name: Irma's Group

texts.en:
In the town of San Roque, near the city of Carepegua, there is a group of women who have come together and work to improve their small businesses. These women cut hair, sell goods for the house, make clothing and food, and run small convenience stores. The support each other working with Fundación Paraguaya and taking out loans to help their businesses.

They are asking for a loan together to help them purchase ingredients, items in bulk, new clothing, and beauty supplies. Together they work to better their lives and the lives of their families.

loans.use: To buy clothing, food, ingredients, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs. Jesús G. C. is a member of the communal bank "Alfons Ugarte". She lives in the San Martín region, in the San Martín province, Tarapoto district. Her Technical Occupation Education Center is located in her own home which is especially designed for that purpose. It is located on Jr. Alfonso Ugarte # 241 in the city of Tarapoto, where she offers the degree of cosmetology. She started 10 years ago, motivated by a friend who saw she had the qualities necessary to direct a company of that type. She learned to manage a business through direct contacts who also ran similar businesses. Today, she is ensured the number of students who specialize in this degree each semester. She plans to expand adding a new classroom and replacing the cement floor with tile with a loan of 3,000.00 ($1075 USD) Soles which she will pay in 6 installments. This way, she will give her students a more comfortable and agreeable environment. She is married and lives with her son and daughter in law, who both support us. She is a hard working woman, a fighter who is persistent and who's vision is to expand a second floor of her house and build rooms to rent.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jesús G. C. , es socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte ” vive en la Región San Martín , provincia de San Martín ,distrito de Tarapoto, su Centro Educativo Ocupacional Técnico, está ubicado en su propia casa en ambientes especialmente acondicionados, esta se ubica en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 241 de la Ciudad de Tarapoto, en la que ofrece la carrera de Cosmetología. Se inicio hace 10 años motivada por un amigo que vio en ellas las cualidades para dirigir una institución de este tipo, aprendió a administrar esta empresa en su relación directa con otras personas que también desarrollaban la misma actividad, hoy en día tiene asegurada la cantidad de alumnas que cada ciclo se especializan en la carrera de cosmetología. El préstamo de S/. 3000.00 el cual pagara en 6 cuotas, tiene proyectado ampliar otro ambiente, cambiar el piso de cemento por mayólicas y pintar todo el local y así dar a las alumnas un ambiente mas agradable y cómodo. Ella es casada y vive con su hijo y su nuera de quienes recibe su apoyo, es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora, perseverante y visionaria anhela ampliar la segunda planta de su casa y construir habitaciones para alquilar.

loans.use: With the loan, she plans to change the floor of her business and other things

loans.name: Quintin

texts.es:
Quintin is a known tailor in the city of Itá. He has been married to María Cristina for 25 years. Together they have raised 5 children, who are between the ages of 12 and 25.

Quintin said that he began working with his father when he was 10 years old. At 15, he found work in a well known store in the capitol city, where he sewed clothes for the company. A few years later, he had changed himself into one of the best of his profession. Because of this he formed his own clientele until he became independent and began his own factory that to this day he runs from his home. At this point, he has 10 sewing machines and gives work to many people.

He says that things are going very well and that his business is growing more each day. For this opportunity, he needs a loan in order to buy fabric and thread, because he has a lot of demand and he wants to meet it.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Quintin es un conocido costurero de la ciudad de Itá, está casado con María Cristina hace 25 años, juntos han criado a 5 hijos que tienen entre 12 y 25 años de edad.

Quintin comenta que comenzó a trabajar a la edad de 10 años con su padre. A los 15 años consiguió trabajo en una conocida tienda de la ciudad Capital en donde cosía ropas para dicha empresa. Luego de varios años fue convirtiéndose en uno de los mejores en su profesión por lo que iba formando su propia clientela hasta que logró independizarse y montó su propio taller que funciona hasta hoy día en su casa propia.

En la actualidad ya cuenta con 10 máquinas de coser y le da trabajo a muchas personas.

Cuenta que le va muy bien y que su negocio va creciendo cada día más.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para la compra de telas e hilos debido a que tiene mucha demanda y desea cubrirlas.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Martha Genara

texts.es:
Martha Genara F. is a native of the city of Bluefields. She is 45 years old and married to Pedro Miguel Sevilla. They have 9 children. For the past 9 years Martha has been the owner of a stand where she sells clothing for women, men and children. This is the family´s only source of income. Her customers are men and women of all ages who prefer to buy from her because of the variety of goods she has. Currently, she needs to buy 10 dozen pants at $8.00 dollars per dozen, 12 shirts at $3.00 dollars per shirt, 24 children´s dresses at $14.00 dollars per unit, and other clothing. With this investment she can increase her earnings and meet her customers´ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Martha Genara F. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Pedro Miguel Sevilla ambos tienen 9 hijos. Martha hace 9 años es propietaria de un tramo donde vende ropa para mujeres, hombres y niños, siendo este el único ingreso de esta familia, sus clientes son hombres y mujeres de todas las edades que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos, en estos momentos necesita comprar 10 docenas de pantalones a $ 8.00 dólares la docena, 12 unidades de camisas a $ 3.00 dólares la unidad, 24 unidades de vestidos para niñas a $ 14.00 dólares la unidad y otra ropa. Con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, dresses for children and lingerie for women.

loans.name: Klaok

texts.en: Klaok P., age 53, is married and lives with six of her children. She and her husband work raising pigs. On average, this couple makes US$8 per day. Two of her children are married and no longer live at home. Klaok would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase more pigs to breed and also to purchase feed for the pigs. This loan would allow her family to increase their profits from raising pigs.

loans.use: To raise pigs.

loans.name: Bolivia Nueva Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto you will find the Alto Lima Center. To it belongs the “Bolivia Nueva” Association made up of 13 women anxious to progress in their small businesses. The majority of the group is married and they affirm that they need to help their husbands economically because they have an average of five children each and their husbands’ salaries aren’t enough to cover their household expenses.

The main activity of the association is trade and they sell woven wool sweaters, food, natural fruit juices, cosmetics and other items depending on the season - products they can offer at the “16 de Julio” Market in the city of El Alto.

They need capital to increase the amount of merchandise and in that way generate larger incomes for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de de Alto Lima a éste pertenece, la asociación “Bolivia Nuevar”, integrada por 13 mujeres ansiosas de progresar en sus pequeños negocios. La mayoría en el grupo son casadas y afirman que necesitan ayudar a sus parejas en la economía del hogar, ya que tienen un promedio de 5 niños y el sueldo de sus esposos no les alcanza para los gastos que tienen en sus hogares. La actividad principal en la asociación es el comercio, venden chompas tejidas en lana, comida, jugos de fruta natural, cosméticos y otros dependiendo de la temporada. Productos que los ofrecen en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas precisan capital para incrementar su mercadería de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para sus familias.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sediq

texts.en:
Sediq U. is 33 and married, the father of one child who is about three years old. Sediq's family has been living for a long time in Shewa district of Ningarhar province, which is an agricultural area where Sediq, besides his teaching, works as a farmer on his own lands.

Sediq U. was married five years ago. Before the wedding, he worked only as a teacher in a public school in his village and his monthly salary of 3,000 Afghanis ($US60) was enough for him at the time. But, after his wedding,s his family expenses were going higher day by day and he felt that he could not meet them with this income. Therefore, he started farming in his spare time and after two years he was able to buy some stock also.

SediqU. is a hard-working man and, utilizing all his capabilities in his business, he increased his monthly income from $US60 to $US200. Now Sediq U. has a happy life, but he wants to work only at his teaching once again. So, he decided to recruit a worker to replace himself for his stock and farming. He plans to pay a monthly salary, but first he wants to buy more stock and agricultural seeds to pave the way completely for the new worker. There for he has requested a loan of $US1,075 loan from AFSG and promises to repay it in 24 months.

Sediq U. hopes to continue this business for a long time and recruit more workers. Also, he thanks honestly the lenders for their help.

loans.use: To buy some stock and agricultural seeds

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth started her local restaurant four years ago at Obuasi, where she lives. Since then, she has become a popular food vendor in her neighborhood. She is now 46 years old, married with three children who are currently schooling. She serves many kinds of local dishes like fufu, rice balls, banku, and abetie among others.

Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. Abetie is prepared from dried milled cassava and it is served with soup.

Elizabeth wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Ama hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the group called Isaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loan. Elizabeth is in this photograph taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood for her little restaurant

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao N., 27, is married and lives with her husband and child in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Mao N.'s husband sells fruit and makes around US$5 per day. Mao N. makes a living as a farmer, but her income is currently endangered by the high rice seed and fertilizer prices and the bad weather conditions. Mao N. grows rice twice a year: during the dry season which lasts about 3-4 months, and then during the rainy season which is 6-7 months long. She would now like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to increase the fruit sales, as well as to be able to repair her house.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit for sale and repair of a house

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Don Carlos tiene 40 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama 14 febrero de la iglesia fraternidad 1 c al este en la capital de Managua, su esposa vende tortillas, frijoles cosidos, cuajadas y hielo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos ya que tiene tres hijos de 3, 7 y 13 años de edad, dos ellos están estudiando en el colegio del barrio, y se gasta mucho en cuadernos, uniformes. El negocio del sr Carlos son trabajo de metalúrgicos, elabora aparatos para soldadura artesanal desde hace diecisiete años, lo cual a prendió desde muy joven ya que trabajaba en soldadura y de albañil con su papa para ayudar a la familia, con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la compra de materia prima y seguir elaborando productos de soldadura para ofertar a sus clientes, pues gracias a Afodenic ha logrado mantener su negocio estable gracias a sus prestamos y facilidad de pago pues a futuro desea poner su propio taller.
texts.en:
Carlos is 40 years old, lives in a neighborhood named February 14 of the church fraternity 1C to the east in the capital, Managua. His wife sells tortillas, beans, curds and ice to help her husband with the bills since they have three children who are 3, 7 and 13 years old. Two of their children study in the neighborhood school and they spend a lot on notebooks and uniforms. Carlos' business is metallurgical work. He has made equipment for artisanal welding since he ws 17 years old, which he learned when he was young since he worked in welding and masonry with his father to help the family. This loan is to invest in the purchase of raw materials and to continue making welding products to offer to his customers. Thanks to Afodenic, he has been able to keep his business stable thanks to the ease-of-payment loans. In the future, he wishes to establish his own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase welding materials.

loans.name: Iddy

texts.en:
Greetings from Iddy in Kigali, Rwanda! Iddy is 28 years old, single and has two adopted orphans.

Iddy has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. He gets up at 5 am everyday to start transporting people to their work places. He needs to pay $6 per day to the owner of the motorbike in order to use it.  

Iddy is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf to buy his own motorbike taxi. He will be paying this loan in 8 months. His goal is to send all his siblings to school and build a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
Taiwo sells school bags, water bottles and slippers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to expand her business so she can meet the demands of her customers.

Taiwo needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more school bags and slippers to sell.

Taiwo is 49 years old and married with six children.

She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bags and slippers to sell

loans.name: Irshad Akbar Ali Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is a 49 year old married lady who has lived in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine places. People come to this city to visit the shrine places where they make wishes. Her husband's name is A. A., who is a milk seller by profession. He has been doing this work for the past 12 years. Irshad baji helps her husband get milk from the buffalo. Presently, they have one buffalo at their house.

Irshad baji has two sons. Her elder son works in a factory and the other one runs a grocery shop. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand their milk selling business.

She is a group leader of some more women in her neighbourhood. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy material (thread, elastic and cloth) for her ribbon making business. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Ghafooran baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Ana Luz P. D. V., resiD. en el barrio Candelaria D. Zacatecoluca. Vive únicamente junto a su esposo, debido a que sus hijos son mayores D. edad y tienen su familia propia. A pesar que el esposo D. Ana Luz tiene un empleo formal, debido a su sueldo contribuye poco a su hogar, es por ello que Ana luz decidió crear su propio negocio, en el cuál venD. productos para el hogar, tales como electrodomésticos, camas, entre otros artículos. Es por ello que solícita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda aumentar la cantidad D. artículos para el hogar y tener más que ofrecer a sus clientes, D. manera que estos la prefieran y D. esta manera ella pueda aumentar sus ventas y contribuir junto a su esposo a la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Luz P. D. V. lives in the Candelaria neighborhood of Zacatecoluca. She and her husband live alone now that their children are all grown and have their own families. Although her husband is employed, his low salary prevents him from contributing very much towards maintaining their home. So, Ana Luz decided to start her own business. She sells appliances, beds, and other household items.

Ana Luz is requesting a loan in order to increase the number and variety of products she offers her customers. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and contribute more to their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase appliances for her business

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night L. is currently in the business of selling fruits like mangoes and guavas at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Night is 29 years old and married. Her husband is an accountant. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open up a shop

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina K. is forty-five years old and married with five children.  She has two years of experience in a popcorn and ice cake business. She sells to the villagers seven days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $75.  SPBD loans are Sina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Part of her loan will be used for home improvement

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her business and materials for home improvement.

loans.name: Hafsa

texts.en:
Hafsa J. is 28 years old, married, and has three  children: ages 11, 9  and 2. Hafsa  has owned a small restaurant in the Mikunguni neighborhood of  Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to the Uvivu si kazi  group .  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $560. Daily she works at her business for 8 hours.  

Hafsa is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to increase her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future uses.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her current stock.

loans.name: 005-Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
"Chúc D. Thị (43) is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Chúc is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 05-Đông Sơn (10.05.005).

Chúc is married and has 1 school-aged child. To making a living, Chúc owns & operates a business making & selling food.  She sells a variety of food products in the local community.  Chúc has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 Viet Nam Dong (~$56 US) a month from these activities.

In 2004, Chúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to engage in business activities.  Chúc has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND (~$209 US) from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Her previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.  She is now requesting another loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in further expanding her business.  This will be the 7th loan taken out by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Chúc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Đỗ thị Thái (50) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

2.  T. thị Oanh (58) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business operating a service-based business.

3.  Lê Thị Thanh (60) is a 43 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

4.  Lê Thị Mậu (37) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

5.  H. thị Hoà (42) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

6.  N. Thị Hoà (65) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

7.  N. thị Nga (10) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 3,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

* Mrs. Nga is absent in the picture because she came 5 minutes late and other people in the group had gone back to their business

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: Many FPW borrowers have expressed a desire to borrow larger amounts to make more significant investments in their businesses. In response to this, FPW has recently added a new loan product of 6,000,000 VND with a 20-month term to its Thanh Hoa City branch portfolio.
