*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Chúc D. Thị  (43) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Chúc là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 05-Đông Sơn (10.05.005).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Chúc thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Chúc kiếm được khoảng 1.000.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Chúc đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Chúc đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Đỗ thị Thái (50) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2.  T. thị Oanh (58) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

3.  Lê Thị Thanh (60) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4.  Lê Thị Mậu (37) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

5.  H. thị Hoà (42) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

6.  N. Thị Hoà (65) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

7.  N. thị Nga (10) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina P. is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. Currently two have completed the senior high school and the rest are still schooling. Sakina says combining motherhood and business demands is very challenging. However the two must be attended to simultaneously. She has been selling bulk supplies of fresh and dried peppers for five years now. She buys the peppers, dries and mills them to get the powdered form she sells.

She treks to the nearest city centers like Kumasi to sell. She is able to support her household well through this business. She needs the loan to enable her to purchase more stocks of peppers. She hopes the loan would enable her to double her savings to provide quality education for the kids.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of fresh peppers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina Y. is from the town of Polanco. She is 57 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Marcelina owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale and also operates a sari-sari (variety) store at home. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Marcelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies, as well as stock for her sari-sari store. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies as well as stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Wonderful Jesus Group

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old, widowed and a mother with ten children. Currently all her children are in school except for her last born who is still breastfeeding. She is a trader who sells assorted products like cooking utensils and plastics like lunch boxes, etc. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She mostly sells by hawking (that is house-to-house selling). She has been in business for four year now. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock.

Mary requests a loan to buy more products like cooking utensils which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With this loan, she believes she will be better resourced and able to make more profit. Then, she can build a store to reduce the amount of walking on the street required to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance.

Mary is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Wonderful Jesus’. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory of cooking utensils, etc.

loans.name: Foliga

texts.en:
Foliga M., 29 years old, lives in the town of Lotofaga Alasopo. She is married and has a baby. To make a living, Foliga operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Foliga has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 550 WST a month.

In 2008, Foliga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Foliga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

Foliga is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be her second loan from SPBD. Foliga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna S. is managing a general store in the village of Rio Del Grande, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 56 years old and married to Julio, a tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) driver in their area.  They were blessed with five children who are all married.  Edna and her husband work hard to support their daily needs and at least to help their children financially, even though they are living separately from them.  

Edna wants her business to become more progressive and to increase her daily income.  This is the reason why she would like to borrow a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 from Kiva lenders.  She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so she can develop her store and purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: José

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José O. le está haciendo falta el vitropiso en toda la casa.
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero para la compra del vitropiso, ya que el se encargara de la colocación de vitropiso en horario adicional a su trabaja. 
Es empleado de una línea de trasportes en el departamento de tráfico, este es el ingreso que tiene para su mama que vive con el.  
Don José ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. En esté nuevo préstamo planea pagarlo con una parte de su ingreso.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose O.’s home is being built without flooring throughout the house. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy the material because at this time he does not have the money and he has taken charge of laying the flooring in addition to his work schedule. He is employed in a line of transportation with the traffic department. This is income that he has for his mother who lives with him. Mr. Jose has had three loans with FVP that he has paid punctually. He plans to pay for this loan with part of his income.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: laying flooring in the house

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa T. is from the village of Danao. She is 34 years old. Elsa is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Elsa is just starting this business.

In 2009, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nemrod

texts.en:
Nemrod C. is from the village of Manabay Ozamiz City. He is 22 years old. Nemrod is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Nemrod owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Nemrod has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nemrod joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemrod is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies and buy baby pigs to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nemrod from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and save for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed, supplies and piglets

loans.name: Maria Jenoveba

texts.es: Maria Jenoveba G. de 65 años de edad reside en el departamento de san Salvador. Es madre soltera, solo tuvo una hija, quien corrió con la misma desdicha de su madre, no contar con el apoyo económico del padre de su hija Gabriela de 9 años de edad, quien ahora vive con su abuelita María que cuida de ella, María recibe remesas por parte de su hija que se encuentra fuera del país. María y su nieta se apoyan mutuamente en las actividades del negocio, María ha instalado una tienda en su casa donde vende toda variedad de productos para el hogar, ella solicita de un crédito para comprar productos al por mayor, ya que de esas manera obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María Jenoveba G. is 65 years old and lives in the San Salvador region. She is a single mother of one daughter, who, like her mother, has had the misfortune of not being able to count on financial support from the father of her child. So, María's nine-year-old granddaughter Gabriela now lives with her while her daughter lives abroad and sends money for her support.

María has a shop in her home where she sells all kinds of household products. She and her granddaughter support each other in running the business. María is seeking a loan to purchase wholesale products for her shop in order to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ccotos, estudió educación primaria completa.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar redes para realizar pesca artesanal dice que eso es lo primero que se malogra, ella vende pescado en la plaza de Juliaca y Capachica, además se dedica también a la elaboración de artesanías en tejido a punto, luego del hilado.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprar una casa en Puno.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, married, and has 4 children. Francisca lives in the community of Ccotos and has an elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 8 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her business capital for selling fish.

Francisca is now requesting a new loan of 700 soles to buy fishing nets. She says that when you buy a net and begin fishing, it is the first piece of equipment that breaks down. Her catch is sold in the town squares of Juliaca and Capachica. In addition, she makes needlepoint and hand-knitted crafts.

Francisca hopes to buy a house in Puno. She enjoys the Communal Bank meeting and the seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Tary

texts.en: Tary is 38 years old, married with 2 children. His wife sells foodstuffs to make a living. He is a commercial motorcyclist. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his passengers. He has one motorcycle but he hopes to get another one to enable him convey more passengers to their location. He hopes to also hire a young boy to assist him.  He has been in this business for 2 years. He works for long hours to enable him meet the basic needs of his family. He is requesting for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase a motorcycle. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky F.'s main source of income comes from selling used clothing in her community. She is 21 years old, married and has three young children. They are from the city of Biray, Ozamiz City. Jinky has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 8000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Jinky joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jinky is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Leilyn

texts.en: Leilyn farms for a living. She is 28 years old and has been married for two years. She has a 2-year-old child. To finance her farm, she used to borrow from loan sharks but she was not able to save money and sometimes her income was hardly enough to feed her family. Upon learning about CEVI from fellow farmers, she settled her obligations and joined the MFI. She likes CEVI's program and thinks that the low interest rate is very helpful to farmers like her. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She will use this loan to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo D. C. is from the village of Bayabo East, Tumauini, Isabela. He is 36 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nilo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nilo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per cropping from these activities.
Nilo joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be his sixth from ASKI. Nilo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more wool scarves, sweaters, and gloves

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem S., age 57, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business preparing flowers at home for an organization, earning approximately an income of US$ 2 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2008.

Her husband is a cycle driver for people in the city, earning an income of US$ 2 per day. The standard of living of the family has improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy more flowers for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. (S. is preparing flowers with her daughter.)

loans.use: buy more flowers for resale

loans.name: Javzan

texts.en: Javzan is 36 years old and lives with her husband and son in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. In 2007, she started her tire repair business with her husband. Currently she has working capital of 1,350,000 MNT ($950). Javzan has been renting  space that belongs to one of her relatives for her business.  She says, “I would like to purchase my own plot of land with a yard and a ger." She is requesting a 580,000 MNT ($408) loan to purchase additional materials for the tire repair business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for the tire repair business.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory sells bags of garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to make a living in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Garri is made from cassava and it is a staple food in Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She is 42 years old and married with two children. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a friendly and happy woman. She says her only challenge is lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She needs a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more bags of garri (cassava flakes) to sell. She loves her business and family dearly and she hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri (cassava flakes) to sell.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en: Marcelino C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan De Oro City. He is 26 years old. and is single. Marcelino owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling electronic cellphone loads in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month. In 2010, Marcelino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Marcelino plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Coumba Daga

texts.fr: Madame Coumba Daga S. a 39 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Ouakam. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis 10 ans. C’est une parente bénéficiaire, mariée  qui a déjà bénéficié de 7 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle s’active dans le commerce de friperie, de  chaussures et divers autres articles depuis 2 ans. Le but du choix de son activité est d’éviter le chômage et d’aider ses enfants en  prenant  en charge leurs frais de scolarité. Ce qui l’intéresse dans son activité c’est la satisfaction des besoins de sa clientèle à moindre cout. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destine a l’achat de draps et de  rideaux en vue de diversifier ses produits de friperie. La réalisation de bénéfices que lui procure son activité lui assure la capacité de faire face aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Coumba Daga S. is 39 years old. She lives in the town of Ouakam. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC credit union for 10 years. She is a married beneficiary [of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Development Program for Children and Families (PDEF)] who has already received seven previous loans from the institution. For the last 2 years, she has been active in retailing second-hand clothes, shoes and other various items. The goal of the choice of her activity is to avoid unemployment and to help her children by providing for their school fees. What she likes in her business is to satisfy her customers’ needs at a lesser cost. She is requesting a loan of 300,00 Francs for the purchase of sheets and curtains in order to diversify her second hand clothes business. The profit she makes through her activity gives her the ability to provide for her children’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita S. is from the village of Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old. Lolita is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business vending of fruits & vegetables in her community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase more products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mrs. El S. is a married mother (her husband is pictured here). They are blessed with four children, all four of whom are single. To help with the family’s living expenses, two of the children are employed at different occupations. To pursue a daily income, El S. rents a shop inside the market where she sell meatballs to people who come to buy things for cooking. Her husband drives a taxi to earn a living. 

Mrs. El S. will be using her first loan to improve the capital of her meatball business.

loans.use: To improve the capital of the meatball business

loans.name: Tay

texts.en:
Tay P., age 27, lives in a rural area of the province of Siem Reap, which is the best territory for farming. She is a single woman who currently resides with her youngest sister in the family home. Her sister is an employee in a guest house. 

Tay P. owns a medium-sized farmland that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops as well as raising a few pigs on it. For the coming rainy season, when farming is possible, Tay P. needs a loan to buy farm supplies for the purpose of growing crops.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for the purpose of growing crops

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es: El Señor Sabas B. es un hombre muy trabajador y perseverante el es el sustento de su familia, cuenta con una tortillería y sale a trabajar desde muy temprano todos los días  para repartir los pedidos de tortillas que le hacen sus clientes, El Señor Sabas esta preocupado por la seguridad de su familia por eso tiene la necesidad de pedir este préstamo ya que la casa que avita  no cuenta con ventanas ni protecciones, la mayor preocupación del señor es cuando el tiene que salir a trabajar y dejar a su esposa e hijos solos. En la fotografia se aprecia al Señor Sabas con su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Sabas B. is a hardworking gentleman who perseveres as the breadwinner of his family. He works for a tortilla factory and leaves early for his job every morning so that he can make tortilla deliveries to his customers. Sr. Sabas is concerned about the security of his family, so he is requesting this loan because his house does not have windows to protect them. His greatest worry is leaving his wife and children alone while he is at work. In the photograph, Sr. Sabas appears with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install windows in his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials to build a wall at his house to have better security for his family

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia G. is currently in the business of selling dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil, onions and tomatoes to sell.  Nadia is 31 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock cooking oil, onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose B. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, who are all currently in school. Rose has a business running a small hotel, which she has had for less than one year.

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more things like cups, saucepans and plates. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and to provide her children with things like medication, food, and clothing. In the future, Rose hopes to own a house.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more plates, cups, and saucepans

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 50 years old and married and the father of 6 school-age children.  To make a living, Dionesio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dionesio has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2400 PHP a month for these activities.

Dionesio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesio has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dionesio from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Serik

texts.en:
Serik H. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a 'ger', the traditional nomadic housing tent. His son currently attends a local secondary school, and his two daughters, ages 4 and an infant, stay at home with his wife. 

Serik operates a taxi service in his town. He started her business in 2007 after moving to the city from the countryside. He sold his livestock and bought a new car which is used as his taxi today. His earnings are the only form of income for his family. Serik is a very generous and hardworking person. For the future, the family is very focused on growing his business. He hopes to build his own house with a yard. Serik is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to keep his car in good repair.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila A. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a farming business. She lives in Sitio Tunga, Barangay Dalingding, Daanbantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $115. 

Prescila is now borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Prescila aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Tsogtgerel

texts.en:
Tsogtgerel N. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and four daughters in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in a rented yard. All of his daughters attend the local school while his wife is currently unemployed due to health problems. She receives a disability pension of 56,000 MNT per month. 

Tsogtgerel works as a carpenter in his home, producing a variety of wood products. He has been engaged in this business for the past ten years and has made quality, unique furnishings for the people of his town. His monthly income is 300,000 MNT approximately. He works hard to expand his business so that he can purchase his own fence in the future. In the 10 years of owning his business, Tsogtgerel has gained much experience and knowledge in making quality furniture products. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy more timber and an ornament making machine.

loans.use: To buy more timber and an ornament making machine

loans.name: Leon

texts.es:
Leon vive en la zona de Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es jubilado, tiene una tienda donde elabora masitas, y tortas, con su esposa
Esta casado y tiene dos hijos.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de insumos, harina, manteca, levadura queso, y otros)
Es la novena vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Y la segunda vez que solicita el apoyo de Kiva, demostrando responsabilidad, en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con este crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos, y comprar insumos en cantidad para mejorar los costos de compra.
texts.en:
Leon lives in the Cota Cota area of the city of La Paz.

He is retired, and he has a store where he and his wife make pastries and cakes .  He is married and has two children.

The loan will be for working capital (to buy supplies, flour, shortening, yeast, cheese, and other things).

This is the ninth time that he has requested a loan with Impro.  It is the second time that he has requested Kiva’s support.  He has demonstrated responsibility with his payments.

With this loan he will be able to increase his earnings and buy supplies in large quantities in order to improve the purchase price.

loans.use: To buy supplies, flour, shortening, yeast, cheese, and other things for his pastry business

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Ciro; el tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; el socio trabaja hace un par de años con su carro de forma independiente y  trabaja dando servicio de taxi. 
 
El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su  carro y así poder  comprar repuestos para este mismo.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Puntualito". The bank is located in the district of Cusco which belongs to the Cusco province and department. 

The member's name is Mr. Ciro. He is 47 years old, lives with his live-in partner and has three children. The member has been providing taxi services independently for a couple of years. 

The member is requesting this loan to invest in the maintenance of his car and to buy spare parts for it. 

The member thanks those that are a part of his dream through this medium and he promises to make the loan payments in the time established.

loans.use: To invest in the maintenance of his car and to buy spare parts for it.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah M. is 30 years old and is married to a man who is an editor and publisher by profession. Together, they have one five-year-old daughter who is in primary school. Zipporah is a tailor and she also sells used clothes at the Githurai 44 market. She has been running this business for 6 years and she makes a monthly profit of 7,800 Kenyan shillings. Her husband supports her in providing for the daily needs of their family.

She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Thika Road office. With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she plans to use half to buy fabrics for making clothes and uniforms since children will require new ones in the month of January after the Christmas holiday, while the other half will be used to buy more used clothes for resale. If this loan boosts her business then Zipporah will buy more fabrics to grow her business. She would like to open a bigger shop and employ some people to help her. In the future, Zipporah dreams of expanding her business and hiring employees to increase her profit which she will use to buy a piece of land and build her own home with her family.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for making clothes and to purchase used clothes.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur T. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His oldest daughter and son both attend university, and his youngest son attends a local high school. Gantumur's wife helps him with his business. He operates a vegetable trading business, where he plants and grows a variety of vegetables on his own three hectare field to sell to dealers in the local markets. 

He also owns a bee farm, which consists of 19 beehives. During winter months, he keeps his bees in a special cellar, and in May he travels through the countryside to pasture his bees. When he has gone to migrate his bees, his children and wife are responsible for growing the vegetables. He started his vegetable planting business in 1992, and has since built a stable operation. Since 1998, he has been producing honey. 

During the past 12 years he has gained a lot of agricultural experience and knowledge of both his businesses. The family sells their seeds and honey during the warm months. They pickle their vegetables and sell those during the winter months. All family members are very hardworking people. Gantumur is a modest and experienced business man and says, "we work very hard during all warm months." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of seeds while the price for such products is cheap.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of seeds

loans.name: 14 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “14 DE DICIEMBRE” está iniciando su ciclo número uno en el Centro Focal de Senkata. Cuenta con ocho integrantes, todas ellas mujeres.  Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio, producción  y servicio, como ser: venta de cemento y estuco, tejido de mantas, venta de comida, tejido de camas, costura de chalecos, venta de condimentos, venta de batidos, tejido de corpiños.

La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Isabel, la tesorera, la señora Susania y como secretaria de actas la señora Mery. 

La señora Isabel, presidenta de la B.C. “14 de Diciembre”, es padre y madre de tres hijos.  Hace quince años por iniciativa propia, abrió su negocio de venta de comida en la “Ceja”, detrás del Colegio Capriles, por las mañanas, es éste negocio el que le ha dado la oportunidad de solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Este primer crédito de Bs 2000.- le servirá para comprar ollas.  Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, la respuesta es “la capacitación”.
texts.en:
The “14 OF DECEMBER” cooperative bank is starting its first cycle in the city center of Senkata.  They have eight members, all of whom are women.  All of their businesses are related to commerce, production and service, such as:  cement and plaster sales, knitting blankets, food sales, making bed linens and sweaters, condiment sales, selling shakes, and knitting bodices.  Management is comprised of a President, Isabel, a Treasurer, Susania, and a Secretary, Mery.

Isabel, President of the cooperative bank “14 de Diciembre” is both mother and father to three children.  More than fifteen years ago, on her own initiative, she opened a food sales business in the “Ceja” behind the Capriles School where she works in the mornings.  This business has allowed her to meet the expenses of her household.

This first loan of 2000 Bolivianos will allow her to buy cookware.  When asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replies “the training”.

loans.use: To purchase cookware.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne J. N. is a single mother of twenty eight years. She has one child of six years old and they live in Milimani in the outskirts of Kitale. She sells used clothes in the same area and gets a monthly income of eight thousand shillings and she has been in this business for four years now.

This will be Yvonne's first loan with KADET which she plans to use to buy one bail of second-hand clothes worth 10,000. With the income she is going to get, she plans to add more clothes for selling and also start saving to buy a plot to invest in future. 

In future she wants to educate her child to the highest level and also buy her own house.

loans.use: To add stock like buy more T-shirts for resale

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: To make a living, Maricel D. works in a family member's business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 27 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. Maricel has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Maricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong T. N. is 32 years old. She is living with her family in Xuancanh commune.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing  rice and corn with high productivity. Additionally, she raises 5 pigs for meat. Her hard-working manner gives her a stabL. income to manage her family life. Ms. Phuong joined our program in 2006. She has been a good group leader. Her loan sizes increase year after year and are used effectively in expanding her farming. Currently, she needs to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

Mai T. H. is 45 years old. She is raising 100 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

Than T. D. is 50 years old. She is raising 100 chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to improve the chickens’ house.

Hoa T. N. is 37 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

Loan T.  L. is 45 years old. She is running a shop that sell construction materials. She needs to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to invest in her shop.

Thanh T. D. is 48 years old. She is raising 300 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy food for the chickens.

loans.use: To buy food for pigs

loans.name: Sofia Davila Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOFIA DÁVILA” es un grupo que iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho mujeres.

La asociación comunal “SOFIA DÁVILA” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Walda  (este es su segundo ciclo en ese cargo), también se encuentra la tesorera la señora  Primitiva y como secretaria de actas la señora Constancia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción.  Entre esos negocios tenemos: venta de verdura, tienda de venta de carne, tejido de mantas, costura, tejido de camas, carnicería, tienda de barrio.

En el caso de la señora Walda, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que  actualmente tiene como negocio el tejido de mantas.  La señora Walda trabaja en este rubro desde hace 30 meses. Las ventas son realizadas por menor en la feria de la Zona 16 de Julio, de manera ambulante, los días jueves y domingo.  También, de esta feria compra la materia prima para las mantas.  

Doña Walda es una mujer de  36 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus cinco hijos.  El esposo trabaja  trasladando arena en una volqueta, la señora comenta con confianza que su pareja y ella se llevan bien.   El crédito que ha solicitado será destinado para incrementar el capital de trabajo y comprar lana.
texts.en:
The “SOFIA DÁVILA” communal bank is a group starting its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  Eight women are members.

The “SOFIA DÁVILA” communal bank’s governing body is as follows: Walda is President (this is her second cycle in that position).  Primitiva is Treasurer and Constancia is Recording Secretary.  The businesses the members are involved in are varied; they have to do with commerce, service and production.  Among the businesses we have: vegetable sales, meat sales, blanket weaving, sewing, bed weaving, butcher shop and neighborhood grocery store.

Walda, communal bank President, indicates that she currently has a business weaving blankets.  She has been in this line of work for 30 months.  Sales are retail in the 16 de Julio zone’s market in an ambulatory fashion on Thursdays and Sundays.  She buys her raw materials for the blankets at this market too.

Walda is 36 years old living with her husband and their five children.   Her husband works transporting sand in a dump truck.  She tells us quite candidly that she and her husband get along together very well.

She will use the requested loan to increase working capital buying wool.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita N. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Conchita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, and sells products such as shampoo, soap, snacks, canned goods and candy to members of the local community. She also sells a variety of blankets. Conchita has had her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

In 2008, Conchita joined Kiva field partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, used to to purchase additional inventory and as  working capital. Conchita is requesting this loan of 17,000 PHP, her sixth from HSPFI, with plans to use it to buy additional products to sell, such as canned goods and beverages. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and other products to sell at a small variety store

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Emerciana

texts.en:
Emerciana works hard to support eight children. Emerciana is married and has a food production/sales business in the Philippines.

Emerciana requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food product (barbeque).

Emerciana has been in this business for eight years and earns more income from refilling purified water.

In the future, Emerciana would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the barbeque she sells

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow her business and purchase a modern machine and equipment

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng S., 44, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. Cheng sells fruits and raises cows at home, earning an income of about USD 3 per day, while her husband is a construction worker who earns an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. Cheng is now requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more fruits to expand her business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to expand her business

loans.name: Aby Stella

texts.es: Aby G. G., de 40 años vive en el barrio Villa Paraíso con su esposo y sus hijos de 7 y 13 años;  ella es contadora publica de profesión,  y empresaria confeccionista por vocación,  actividad que desempeña desde un taller en su propia casa y que aprendió desde sus 12 años por tradición familiar, porque su madre, con la que aun trabaja,  la enseñó.  Inicialmente Aby  pegaba  botones y realizaba tareas adicionales sencillas  propias de la confección, hasta que montó su propio taller, y decidió aprender técnicamente todas las operaciones de esta actividad, como el diseño, corte preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas. En la actualidad su línea preferida es la femenina y enfrenta un gran desafío, que es la competencia y la ropa importada resulta más económica, sin embargo ella está estudiando sus propias posibilidades de compra por volúmenes, para ofrecer servicios de mejor calidad como las que ella fabrica, a precios más competitivos. Su meta más adelante es conquistar nuevos clientes aumentar sus niveles de producción y con ello sus utilidades, por eso recurre a su credikiva que es su primer financiamiento, con el cual comprará    en mayores volúmenes telas, hilos, encajes, botones y accesorios para hacer una producción dirigida a mujeres,  pues  le  han encargado vestidos a la medida de las circunstancias, porque desean lucir muy bellas con motivo de la celebración del día universal de las madres.
texts.en:
Aby G. G. is 40 years old and lives in Villa Paraíso neighborhood together with her husband and her children aged 7 and 13.  She is a certified public accountant by profession and a dressmaker by vocation.  She carries out her work from a workshop in her own home.  She learned the trade, which is a family tradition, at the age of 12.  She was taught by her mother who she still works with.

Initially, Aby stuck on buttons and carried out other simple dressmaking tasks until she set up her own workshop and decided to learn all the tasks involved in the business such as designing, cutting, preparing, assembling and finishing off garments.  Currently, Aby's favorite line is women's clothing.  She faces a great challenge in the form of competition and imported clothes which are cheaper.  However, she is studying the possibility of buying in bulk so that she can offer better quality services with the clothes that she makes, at more competitive prices.  Her goal for the future is to attract new customers, increase her production levels and increase her profits.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan which is her first loan.  She will use the money to buy larger quantities of fabric, threads, lace, buttons and accessories so that she can produce women's clothing as she has orders for dresses from people who want to look beautiful for celebrating Mother's Day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace, buttons and accessories in larger quantities

loans.name: Familia Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familia, inicia su ciclo numero 6, con 11 socias. Las cuales tienen diversos negocios como la venta D. pescado, confección D. prendas D. vestir, comercialización D. leche, venta D. queso, venta D. animales menores, bordados D. artesanías.
Tersa, es la Presidenta para éste ciclo, tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. 33,31,16,13 años D. edad. Tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en general en su casa. Ingreso a FINCA Perú por la invitación D. su hija. Le gusta por la facilidad D. los préstamos para trabajar y pueD. ahorrar.
texts.en:
The “Familia” communal bank starts its cycle #6 with 11 members who have various businesses like: fish sales, dressmaking, milk sales, cheese sales, sale of small farm animals and embroidered crafts.

Tersa, 48, is the President for this cycle.  She’s married and has four children who are 33, 31, 16 and 13 years of age.  She has a grocery store at home.

She joined FINCA Perú thanks to an invitation from her daughter. She likes it because the loans are easy to negotiate and she can save

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en: Davaanyam is 26 years old and lives with his parents and younger brother in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. He manages an auto parts repair business with the help of his younger brother. In 2009 he built his own workshop near to his home and began his service business. Since then he has gained much experience and is planning to conduct a tire repair business too. He is a polite man who is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with nine family members; four of them work.

Jaafar is a carpenter; since 2008 he has owned a workshop where he makes furniture. He has more than four years experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan  He is aiming to increase his income so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy carpentry machine tools.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 55 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Carmencita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Carmencita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Carmencita has been in this business for 10 years. Carmencita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Ev

texts.en: From Kompong Speu province, Mrs. Ev, 50, is a widow and the mother of three children. Two of them are still teenagers and attend school and the other one is employed as a sewing worker. She has been farming since 1984 and she makes an average of $1.25 a day. In the past, Mrs. Ev has always hired the neighbor’s cows for the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy her own cows and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. This will provide her with an additional fixed asset. With the rest of the funding, she will buy fertilizers to keep her crop growing well.

loans.use: to buy cows and fertilizers to keep her crop growing well.

loans.name: Aloysie

texts.en:
Aloise is a 45-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between the ages of 15 and 22, all of whom are in school.  Her husband owns a general store and she sells fruits.

She has been running this business for the past 18 years, and requires this loan so she can purchase 300 kg of tree tomatoes, 100 kg of oranges, and 500 kg of tangerines. She plans to save future profits so she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy different fruits such as oranges, tangerines and tomatoes

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is 37 years old and married with 3 children. He lives in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. Dan's dream is to have an income generating business with a profit of 100,000 UGX per week. 

He is a farmer and has been in practice for seventeen years now. With the profits he has been able to buy a car and also pay school fees for his children. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations. His dream is to own at least 100 acres of land for farming. 

Dan needs the loan facility to harvest soybeans and pineapples, and also to plow for the next season.

loans.use: To harvest soybeans and pineapples and to plow for the next season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 64 years old, married, and a mother of one son. Josephine runs a fruit and vegetable stall in Mwakingali, Voi and her business has been in operation for the last seven years. Her business has been doing well.

Josephine has been a KADET LTD client and this marks her fourth loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to expand her business by purchasing tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, avocados onions, cabbage and garlic. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and provide for her upkeep. Her dream is to become a successful business lady and to open a tendering business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, avocados, onions, cabbage and garlic

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is 46 years old, married to Benson and they have six school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a water tank. This will help her store water both for domestic and farming use during dry seasons.

In future, Jane hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Efficacité Plus Group

texts.en:
Horace is the leader of a Community bank named “Efficacité Plus”, which is composed of 22 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Horace, 35 and married, sells prepaid cards. He has been in business since 1997. With hard work and good management, he has been able to stabilize his business by delivering prepaid cards in order to increase his working capital. He makes a profit of about $20 daily. Horace’s ambition is to become a prepaid cards provider in his area. As he wants to develop his business, he has decided to join one of Hope’s groups. He is planning with the next loan to purchase dozens of prepaid cards and resell them at a profit. Horace has five children whose ages vary between 9 months and 9 years old. Two of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of prepaid cards to resell in order to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction materials for his home (cement, stone, sand, blocks and others)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with three children. Rebecca is 59 years old and lives in Tangub City.

Rebecca has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 PHP to  purchase stock for her general store.

Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Michael.  He is married and has 5 children aged 17, 15, 12, 5 and 4. He has 3 additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives.  

In 2009, Michael established his rice, wood, palm oil and garri business. He began this business after he retired as a driver from Oxfam.  He now has  something to do even as he is retired, transacting with a lot of customers. 

Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, Michael earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.   Michael has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy rice for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. 

In the future, Michael plans to improve on his business by dealing in a variety of rice, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La socia continua con el negocio de compra y ve ta de ropa ella trae ropa al por mayor y vende en uno de los mas conocidos mercados en la ciudad, ella también trae ropa para niños y adultos en esta ocasión la socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ropa al por mayor ya que se vienen las fiestas navideñas y desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ropas de temporada para niños y adultos.
texts.en:
This member continues with her business of buying and selling clothes. She acquires the clothes wholesale and the sells them at one of the most well-known markets in the city. She also brings in children’s clothes as well as those for adults.

On this occasion, the member is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale clothing since the Christmas holidays are approaching. She wants this loan so that she can invest in seasonal clothing for children and adults.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 50 years old and is married with 5 children aged between 11 and 20 years. She owns a business selling second-hand clothes in the market. She has been in this business for 3 years and the hours of her work are from 8 am until 5.30 pm every day except on Saturday.

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more second-hand clothes to sell. With the profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business, and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Anselmo

texts.es: Don Francisco es humilde agricultor de la zona de San Ignacio , desde hace varios , la mayor afectación que se le presento en este año fueron las lluvias , ya que donde estaba ubicado el cultivo pasaron enormes corrientes de agua , lo cual se llevo la producción pero por gracias de dios cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y juntos están tratando de salir adelante resembrando los pocos hijos de piña que quedaron , pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para una buena cosecha , lo cual solicita de apoyo económicos atraves de Afodenic hacia los fondo Kiva , para comprar exfoliantes , fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para la producción .
texts.en:
Don Francisco is a humble farmer from the area of San Ignacio. 

For many, the highest area of difficult concerns that presented itself this year was the rain, because of where it was located. The crops became huge running streams of water, which carried away the harvest but thanks to God, with the help of his daughter, together they are trying to get ahead by replanting offshoots of the pineapples left behind. 

But they do not have enough capital to buy the fertilizer and supplies necessary for a good crop, and this is why they are asking for financial support from Afodenic through Kiva funding, in order to buy exfoliants, fertilizers and supplies needed for farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 30 años convive junto a Rubén de 33 años; viven en su casa propia junto a sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar un futuro mejor. La tienda de Elva es la primera en abrirse en la ciudad de Quimbiri, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 01 año en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela ampliar su negocio y brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este será su préstamo número 09 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con su trabajo. Además le agrada ser parte de banco comunal ya que son personas responsables y solidarias. Con los 3,000 soles, invertirá comprando productos para incrementar en su tienda como: arroz, galletas, gaseosas, conservas, etc.
texts.en:
Elva is 30 years old and lives together with Rubén who is 33 years old. They live in their own house together with their 3 dear children and want to give them a better future. Elva’s store is the first to open in the city of Quimbiri; at 6:00AM in the morning her doors are ready to receive the shoppers who know the variety of merchandise that she has in her store and don’t hesitate to buy it, having the security of knowing they are going to find the things they need.

What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers. She has been in this business for one year and she thinks that the most difficult part is being inside the store all day without being able to leave.

She yearns to expand her business over time, and give her clients a better service. This will be her 9th loan with MFP, and she is asking for a small loan in order to be able to do her work. Further, she likes being a part of the communal bank because everyone is trustworthy and cooperative. With the 3000 soles, she will buy supplies for the store such as rice, cookies, soft drinks, canned foods and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, cookies, soft drinks, canned foods and other items

loans.name: Sab

texts.en: Mrs. Sab is a 46-year-old married woman who has been living in Pouk district. She is in the business of cultivating rice and raising some poultry at home. She is blessed with 6 children, two of whom are single and live under her income. Mrs. Sab will start growing her dry-season rice. However, it’s not easy to get the water from the river unless she rents her neighbor’s pumping machine, which costs much money. Mrs. Sab wants to own a machine for her farming so she doesn't have to rent. For this reason, Mrs. Sab would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a pumping machine, fertilizers and some poultry. She hopes this loan will be granted to her to improve her crops and their lives as well. Someday, she aims to uplift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine, fertilizers and some poultry.

loans.name: Maria Eyised

texts.es: La señora Maria Eyised se dedica a la elaboración de todo tipo de artesanías con madera, telas, joyas, hilos y bisutería gracias a los conocimientos adquiridos en una institución de Puerto Triunfo (municipio ubicado al oriente de Antioquia). Como la señora Maria Eyised es madre soltera requiere de la compra de materia prima con la cual pueda hacer sus productos, venderlos y obtener los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hija de 5 años. El sueño de la señora Maria Eyised es tener su propio almacén y brindarles buena educación y vivienda a su hija y padres.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Eyised makes all kinds of crafts out of wood, fabric, jewelry, yarn and imitation jewelry thanks to what she learned at an institution in Puerto Triunfo (a town located east of Antioquia).  Since Señora Maria Eyised is a single mother, she needs to buy raw materials with which to make her products, sell them and bring in the necessary income to support her 5 year old daughter.  

Señora Maria Eyised's dream is to have her own store, give her daughter a good education, and provide her daughter and parents with a nice house.

loans.use: purchase raw materials such as wood, yarn, fabric and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: Honoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Honoria; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa como pantalones, blusas, polos, chompas y casacas, ella vende en forma independiente desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, chompas, blusas y casacas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to communal bank “SAN VALENTIN”, which is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Honoria, she is 35, married and has 2 children. She alternates between her daily activities and the business of selling clothes such as trousers, blouses, polo shirts, sweaters and jackets.

She sells her products independently from 7 AM to 6 PM. This business allows her to support her children. The member's dream is to have a store where she can sell the clothes. She requests this loan to buy trousers, sweaters, blouses and jackets from wholesalers.

The member is happy for this loan and commits herself to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy trousers, sweaters, blouses and jackets from wholesalers.

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Зафарджон женат и ответственный отец двух несовершеннолетних детей. Более 4-х лет он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных и бахчевых культур. Жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за детьми. Кроме этого Зафарджон занимается откормом скота, и на сегодняшней день он имеет трех голов крупного рогатого скота.  Этот бизнес приносит ему хороший доход. С этой целью Зафарджон запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и мелкого рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Zafarjon is married and is a responsible father of two adolescent children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural and melon crops for over four years.  His wife is involved in household work and looks after the children.  Besides this, Zafarjon is involved in fattening up livestock, and today has three heads of cattle.  This business yields a good income.  Zafarjon is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and to buy small livestock.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and small livestock

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Ala is 46 years old, married, and has two children. He is a government employee . He has a smart boy in primary school. Because of his low salary, he always worries about making enough money to cover his family's needs and saving some for his children's school expenses. With this loan, now he can accommodate all these expenses.

He is requesting a $1500 loan to pay for his son's tuition fees and other school expenses. His aim is to see his children get the best education.

The story of Ala and his son is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients that are able to get better education.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, вместе с мужем занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Дамиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 9 овец. На 0,38Га собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земли выращивает экологически чистую фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дамира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец, удобрений, семян и топлива для обработки почвы и выращивания органической фасоли. Дамира является участником группы "Бай Дыйкан А4", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. Доходы от кредита Дамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и строительство сарая.
texts.en:
Damira is 32 years old. He is married, raising two children with her husband. She has secondary education. 

Her husband and she are raising livestock and cultivating crops. Thanks to Damira’s hard work, their household has 9 sheep. They own a 0.38 ha land lot and rent 2 ha where they cultivate beans. Their monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

To expand the business, Damira is requesting a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy 5 sheep, fertilizers, seeds and fuel to cultivate soil. Damira is a member of the group “Bai Dyikan A4”where three more people are members other than her, all together there are three of them. Damira is planning to invested the borrowed money to further develop her business and build a barn.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheep, fertilizers, seeds and fuel for land cultivation and growing organic haricot

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz was born in 1952 in Yenikand village, Salyan region. He is married and has 4 children. He has been running this business for 5 years.
He enjoys looking after fruit trees. He plans to create a new orchard.
He requests a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer and seedlings. He wants to increase the variety of fruit trees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Natia

texts.en: Natia is married with two children.  She started  her small grocery business from a small loan she got from joining the SPBD microfinance program.  Now on her third loan cycle, she intends to further expand her business by purchasing additional stocks.  She intends to set up a Elei  printing -- a traditional Samoan way of handprinting textiles -- business in the future using the additional earnings she will get from her business. She believes that with two businesses, in the future she will be able to significantly contribute to her household income.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her grocery shop
