loans.use: To purchase more materials

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a thirty-year-old married woman with three children living in her own  permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of looking after her children with the help of her husband and her desire is to educate them up to university. For five years she has been in the retail trade and she got her initial capital from her husband. Jackline needs the loan to buy cassava flour, cooking oil and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: Buying cassava flour, cooking oil and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre abarrotes, bebidas gaseosas y otros. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad dos años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido ayudar a su esposo a mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Roxana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Roxana, 25, is married and lives with her family in Olmos district, a commercially active agricultural zone located in Lambayeque province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small home based store.  She sells her neighbors various daily use items like groceries, soft drinks and others.  She’s been in business for two years and currently has a regular, established customer base.  Thanks to this activity she’s been able to help her husband support the family all this time.

Roxana wants to expand the business buying more merchandise in order to meet customer demand.  She has, therefore, deemed it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia C. is from the village of Laturan, Libona, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Cynthia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cynthia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling  rice per kilogram & animal feed & farm-related products in the local community. Cynthia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like sacks of rice & animal feeds. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Cynthia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like sacks of rice & animal feeds.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth V. is from the village of Rang-ay, Dagatkidavao, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Elizabeth is widowed and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables, like stringbeans, amplaya, tomatoes, onion springs and gabe in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green leafy vegetables, like malunggay. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green leafy vegetables, like malunggay

loans.name: Mrs. Sarong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is comprised of fifteen people who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their standard of living. The village bank president is Sarong, who was selected by the group members. 

Sarong was born in 1973. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories while the others are studying in the local public school.  Although the family works hard, it is difficult to earn enough to provide for the family. Sarong is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice to sell and support her family. She is requesting a loan to add to her savings and buy a breeding cow to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: Каримова Хайринисо проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает в районной больнице главным бухгалтером. Сама Хайринисо имеет высшее образование, фармацевт. Она занимается продажей медикаментов. В этой области она четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки медикаментов.
texts.en: Khayriniso K. lives in Hamadoni. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband works in the regional hospital as the chief accountant. Khayriniso has a degree as a pharmacist. She works selling medicines. She has been doing this work for four years. She is taking out a loan to buy medicines.

loans.use: to buy medicines for resale

loans.name: Totosa Plus Group

texts.en:
“Totosa Plus” is a group composed of 17 small-business owners. Its chairwoman is Virginie. The group's members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Virginie is 44 years old and the divorced mother of four children between seven and 22. All of her children go to school. Virginie is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She sells pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) at a market located north-east of Kinshasa and currently earns a weekly profit of 40 USD. She has been in this business for years and has acquired solid experience. Virginie has previously repaid eight loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory and will buy more pagnes to resell at a profit to increase her income. In the future, Virginie will seek to make more profit by importing her products herself.

loans.use: to purchase brightly colored African cloth to expand her business inventory

loans.name: Arnoldo Manuel

texts.es: Arnoldo es soltero, tiene 27 años de edad, se dedica a prestar servicios de asesoria tecnica, ya que tiene como profesion perito contador con orientacion en computación, en una institución de microfinanzas, lleva 3 años de experiencia en este trabajo, debido al trabajo que realiza cada día, vió la necesidad de contar con el equipo necesario, por esa razón acude a ASDIR para solicitar un préstammo que le servirá para comprar una computadora, la cual es muy importante para mejorar su desempeño. Espera mejorar su condición de vida, con la inversión que esta realizando.
texts.en: Arnoldo is single and 27 years old. He has worked for 3 years in a microfinancing institution giving technical support since he is by profession an accountant specialized in computing. Due to the work that he does each day he needs to have the equipment necessary which is why he went to ASDIR to get a loan that will help him buy a computer which is very important to improve his productivity. Arnoldo hopes to improve his quality of life with the investment.

loans.use: buy a computer.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Loida has been in this business for five years. She works hard to support her family.

Loida requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of fish to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Loida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, single, and lives with one family member.

Farid has had a food market since 2007. He sells vegetables, fruit, cheese, juices, bread, daily use items and dairy products. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2700 loan to buy two freezers and one refrigerator and to purchase additional foodstuffs for his market. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two freezers and one refrigerator and purchase additional foodstuffs for his market.

loans.name: Leovira

texts.en:
Leovira is a married woman with two young children aged 6 and 4. She is 29 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for four years. Her husband is a motorcycle driver.

Leovira sells items like eggs, canned goods, and coffee to the people in her community. She works hard to provide the needs of her family and save for her children's future. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as noodles, canned goods and soft drinks.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as noodles, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Obama Group

texts.en:
Jibileth, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who go to school.  She has been running a food vendor business for five years now.  She works from 6am to 11am (for five hours) daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees, household expenses and also kept on increasing her food stock and has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy rice, maize, ground nuts and millet.  What she does is mix and grind all of them together.  She puts some aside for selling as dry food and with the other portion she makes porridge which she sells from door to door. Her dream is to one day build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Obama" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize, ground nuts, and millet.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en: Jaqueline is a 31-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with two children, ages 3 and 6 years old. Her husband works as a technician and she sells vegetables. She has run this business for the past seven years, and the profits it has generated have enabled her to feed her family. She requires a loan so she can purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes, peanuts, and onions, that she will sell for a profit. With the future profits from her business, she plans to pay for her children’s school fees and accumulate savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all go to school. She has no additional family members to support. 

Saidat  is a tailor. She sells her clothes on a wholesale basis in a shop. She has been in business for many  years. Saidat works seven days a week. She has no other additional source of income. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her aspiration is to build her own shop where her customers can find her to buy clothes. She lives in  a rented  house and has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include power, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 41 years old and married with five children. She has been raising pigs for ten years in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Aileen is requesting a loan of 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aileen is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zebedayo

texts.en:
Zebedayo is 50 years old, married and a father of five children.  Zebedayo is a pool care taker in Nyali, Mombasa. He has been in this business for the last eleven years and it has been a success. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. Zebedayo plans to expand his business by purchasing cleaning equipments and chemicals for his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase pool cleaning equipment and chemicals

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is 47 years old and married with three children aged 21-7, living in Hioma, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on him and his desire is to educate his children up to university. He runs a produce store and he has been in the business for three years. He faces a challenge of seasonal changes which affects his business profits and his dream is to export his produce to other East African countries. Vincent needs the loan facility to buy rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos que frequenta a escola.Fez a 4ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua nora e o neto que vivem com ela. 

É  comerciante ha mais de 5 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( sumos, feijão, amendoim, peixe, cervejas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 16.000.00mt, 17.000.00mt,  19.000.00mt, e 21.000.00mt todos para o comercio.  
No futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para fazer crescer a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is single and the mother of four children, who go to school. She went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports her daughter-in-law and grandson, who live with them.
She's had a shop for more than 17 years and earns 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM). She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (juice, beans, peanuts, fish, beer, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries. Her first loans, in the amounts of 16,000, 17,000, 19,000, and 21,000 meticals, were all used for the business. In the future she hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products (juice, beans, peanuts, fish, beer, etc.) for her shop.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Evelyn has a shop that sells noodles, snacks and electronic loads from several networks like Globe and Smart. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy snacks, noodles and electronic loads to sell. 

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, noodles and electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano de 36 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Luciano tiene como actividad laboral la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 1000 para comprar material y dar mantenimiento a su máquina, así puede seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho, lo que le permitirá tener más ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida.  Luciano con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio adelante y a superarse en la vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Luciano is 36 years old and lives with his family in their home, which has water and electricity and is located in the urban zone of the district of Bambamarca belonging to the department of Cajamarca.  This zone is characterized by its agricultural activity and cattle raising.

Luciano's daily work is the making and sale of articles of clothing.  For several years, he has had his business in his residence.  He counts on his own clientele and also does special orders.  There isn't much competition in his area and with the income that he obtains, he will be able to cover the daily needs of his home.  

He has requested a loan from Edpyme by means of Capital Alternative Seed of 1000 to buy material and to provide maintenance to his sewing machine.  Thus, he can continue offering a good service and completing the orders that have been made, permiting him to have greater profits and improve his quality of life.  Luciano, with a lot of effort and hard work, has known how get ahead in his business and to triumph in life along with his family.

loans.use: to purchase material and provide maintenance for his machine.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with six children. She is 39 years old and resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte in the Philippines. 

Alicia started a business venture selling seafood products, including crabs and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 3,000.00 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 4,000.00 to pay for the cost of harvesting crabs. Alicia has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Alicia wants to expand her business and to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of harvesting crabs.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla lives in Changamwe, Kenya and operates a mobile money transfer shop. The business has been in operation for seven months. She is married and has one child who is in school. 
She learnt about Milango from her friend and decided to join the organization. Priscilla is applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase a photocopier machine. 
She looks forward to opening other branches of her mobile money transfer shop, though her main challenge has been the lack of capital. The photocopier will provide additional income while at the same time acting as security/collateral for future loans.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier machine

loans.name: Judy Alejandra

texts.es: La señora Judy a sus 23 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza. La señora Judy aprendió esta actividad cuando trabajó en almacenes por temporadas, debido a la necesidad de ingresos para su manutención y gastos de estudio, la señora Judy decidió iniciar con la venta de mercancía como prendas de vestir y posteriormente incluyo productos de belleza.  La señora Judy necesita comprar una estantería para exhibir sus productos, surtido de productos de belleza y ropa. Lo anterior le permitirá tener suficiente inventario para suplir la temporada de fin de año, con lo que espera la señora Judy sus ventas incrementen. El sueño de la señora Judy a corto plazo y como meta es terminar sus estudios como delineante de arquitectura y consolidar su actividad con el montaje de un local.
texts.en:
Judy is 23 years old and her business is selling clothing and beauty products.  She learned this business when she worked seasonally in different stores.  As she needed to make income with which to support herself and cover her education expenses, Judy decided to start selling merchandise such as clothing to which she later added beauty products. 

Judy needs to buy shelving so that she can display her products (beauty products and clothes).  This will allow her to have enough stock to meet demand during the end-of-year season when Judy hopes that her sales will increase.  Judy's short-term dream and goal is to finish her studies (she is training to become a draughtswoman).  She would also like to consolidate her business by setting up sales premises.

loans.use: to buy shelving on which to display her products, and to buy beauty products and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El socio sigue con su negocio inicial y sigue viajando constantemente a ún bello Distrito en la provincia de Quispicanhis donde aún se conserva el folklore tipico y oriundo de la zona, al igual que su modo de vida ancestral, el socio cuida de su cultivo de maíz y en esta ocasión el socio deshierbara su terreno de cultivo y tambien apoyara a su mamá en la mobilidad escolar, el socio desea invertir en la compra de abono y para el pago para deshierbar su terreno de cultivo de maíz y apoyar a su mama con la mobilidad.
texts.en:
This client continues with the business he started and still travels constantly to the beautiful district of Quiquijana, where native traditional folklore and ancient methods of living are kept alive.  The member takes care of his crop of corn.  On this occasion, he is removing weeds from his farmland and also helping his mother who drives a school vehicle.  

The member wants to invest in the purchase of compost and to pay someone to remove weeds from his cornfield.  He will also help his mother with her vehicle.

loans.use: to buy compost, pay for labor to remove weeds, and cover the costs related to his mother's vehicle.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a hardworking woman who is in the business of selling water. She has been engaged in this business for the last six years.

She was introduced to KADET by other women in a group in her area of residence. She is now applying for her first loan through KADET, which she plans to use to buy more water pumps so that she can distribute more water to the residents in her area.

She hopes to make a profit from this loan because she would like to start a grocery shop as a secondary business in order to generate more income. She dreams of being rich and stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy more water pumps

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 57 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, además de ser amable y cordial, esta casado con Alicia quien es ama de casa. Vive en compañía de su esposa y de uno de sus hijos de 22 años ya que los otros dos son independientes. La actividad que realiza Víctor es la agricultura contando con un terreno de 6 hectáreas y del cual utiliza 3 hectáreas cultivando yuca. Producto que una vez cosechado es comercializado en el mercados de Lima y así como a otros mercados de su localidad. Tiene a su cargo 4 peones, a quienes paga por día trabajado un monto de 20 nuevos soles. Le gusta su actividad porque le gusta trabajar en el campo, comenta que se inició en ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio y como ya tenía conocimientos básicos lo puso en práctica. Asimismo en su casa de campo cuenta con luz eléctrica por lo que se sienten más cómodo. Su plan es ampliar sus ingresos económicos poniendo una bodega en su casa, para que su esposa pueda atenderlo. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero para lograr alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta estar a gusto con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general para implementar su nueva bodega donde atenderá su esposa.
texts.en:
Víctor is 57, and a hard-working, enterprising man, besides being warm and friendly. He is married to Alicia, who is a housewife. He lives with his wife and one of his children, who is 22, as the other two are on their own. 

Victor is a farmer, and has a six-hectare piece of land, of which he uses three hectares for growing yuca. Once the product is harvested, he sells it in the Lima markets, as well as in other markets in his area. He has hired four workers, whom he pays the amount of 20 nuevos soles for each day of work. 

He likes what he does, because he likes to work in the countryside. He says that he got started in this business because he needed a trade, and as he already had the basic knowledge, he put it into practice. As well, he has electricity in his rural home, so they feel more comfortable. 

His plan is to increase his income by setting up a store in his house, so that his wife can look after it. This will be his fifth loan with MFP. He feels thankful to receive the financial support for reaching his objectives. 

He also says that he is comfortable with the work of his communal bank, as he considers its members to be responsible people. 

With the amount of 3,000 nuevos soles that he has applied for, he will buy assorted groceries for launching his new store that his wife will run.

loans.use: To buy basic household products to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 40 años, está casado con jorge de 45 años, fruto de esta relación tuvieron 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari.
Marcelina, cuenta que a los 12 años de edad ya realizaba las labores agrícolas de cómo preparar un terreno para sembrar, la cosecha e incluso ya estaba preparada para realizar la comercialización. Fue así, que desde entonces ella junto a sus padres cultivaban cacao, café y plátano, aunque le daban mayor importancia al cacao y café, por ser productos que tienen mayor demanda en el mercado tanto nacional como internacional y por tal su valor es alto. Ahora continua con esta labor, cultivando café, pues en la cosecha anterior recolecto una buena cantidad de granos y por ende superó su ingreso económico. Es por esta razón que desea ampliar la siembra de café. En las labores que realiza siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su querido esposo quien le apoya en los trabajos más forzosos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete  en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará más almácigos de café.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 40 years old, has been married to Jorge for 45 years, and as a result of this relationship has 3 kids with whom she lives in her her own house located in the district of Pichari. 

Marcelina tells us that at 12 years of age she already knew how to perform agricultural tasks like preparing the earth to plant seeds, harvesting, and was already prepared to do the marketing. Ever since then, along with her parents, she has cultivated cocoa, coffee, and plantains, although they gave more importance to cocoa and coffee for being products that had greater demand in both the national and international markets and for their high value. Now she continues with this work, cultivating coffee, but in the past harvest she collected a large quantity of grains and surpassed her income. For this reason she would like to increase the amount of coffee she plants. In the work that she does she always counts on the support of her loving husband who helps her with the most difficult jobs. This will be her second loan with MFP, so she promises to promptly repay her debts. With this loan, she will buy more coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy more coffee seeds to plant

loans.name: Georgine

texts.en: Georgine has one child who is three years old. She is 29 years old and married to a businessman. She has spent three years in the business of selling different items in a boutique. With the loan, she plans to invest in the boutique by adding more items for sale such as rice, sugar, soaps, and lotions. She will use the profits to build a house. She anticipates that in the future, she will become a very strong businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, soaps, and lotion to resell.

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita works hard to support her family. Marcelita is married and has a ambulant vending dry goods business in the Philippines.

Marcelita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her business.

Marcelita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marcelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her business

loans.name: Vasilisa

texts.en:
Vasilisa, age 24, is married and a mother of one. She lives with her family in Iringa District, Tanzania where she is also a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills to students in a nearby secondary school. 

She requests a Kiva loan to start a grocery business near her village. She will use the money to buy groceries in bulk and sell them at her shop. 

This will enable her to support herself and pay for her child’s education and household expenses.

loans.use: to start her grocery business by purchasing products in bulk

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en: Chipo is 26 years old and is the eldest child in a family of 4. She has been operating a grocery shop since 2010 after she was trained by PENYA in the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program. Chipo lost her parents 7 years ago due to a chronic disease. She is therefore looking after her siblings and has been paying for their school fees with the money she earns from her grocery shop. At her shop, she is able to provide supplies to people from the surrounding villages who would have otherwise had to travel distances of more than 5 kilometers to the nearest business center. Chipo will use this loan to purchase stock for her shop in bulk. She will purchase supplies such as sugar, salt, soap, school bags, plasticware and other general grocery supplies. This is Chipo's second loan, after having succeffully repaid a loan she got from PENYA in 2013. PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program. PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments. Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably. Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, school bags, plasticware, soap and sugar in bulk for stocking her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the capital

loans.name: Jahid

texts.en: Jahid is the resident of Beylagan town. He has his own business of selling kitchen and home supplies. In 2003 he applied to Nermicro Beylagan branch and borrowed the first loan in amount of $500. Subsequent loan in amounting $800 was used for expansion of the business. Now he is in need of new loan to increase the variety of goods and to expand the business more.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Malama

texts.en: Malama is twenty-nine years old.  She runs a stall at her village’s local flea market and sells a variety of products.  She caters mostly to local women and sells popular Samoan dresses and a variety of cosmetics and hair accessories.  She is able to clear a weekly profit of about ST 200 (USD 80), and she puts this income towards her children’s education.  Through the stall, she keeps current with their school fees and purchases their uniforms and school supplies.  Her primary aim is always to provide for her children and she views any investment in her business as an investment in their future.  She is applying for a small loan to help expand her product line and hopes this expansion will enable her to make some small improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy more stuff for her flea market and to improve her home. She is applying for a loan of USD $850.00

loans.name: Narcizo

texts.es:
Mr. Narcizo is divorced and has three children; he used to work in construction but this was a transitory job and on occaision he wouldn't obtain any revenue; his parents had a grocery store with the result that making good use of his experience in this line of business, he decided to open his own store and commenced selling a few grocery items and soft drinks seven years ago.

Little by little he has been shooting up more and in order to continue growing he asks for a loan of $650 that he will use on the purchase of fruits and vegetables in order to have a better assortment and to offer better service to his customers; he is prepared to pay back this amount in six months. You can help Narcizo and better his quality of life; decide to support him; he will thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Narcizo es divorciado y tiene tres hijos, él trabajaba en la construcción pero este era un trabajo temporal y en ocasiones no obtenía ningún ingreso, sus padres tenían una tienda de abarrotes así que aprovechando la experiencia que tiene en este giro decidió abrir su propio negocio y comenzó vendiendo pocos productos de abarrotes y refrescos desde hace siete años.

Poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor y para continuar creciendo solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de frutas y verduras para tener un mejor surtido y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, él esta dispuesto a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Narcizo y mejorar su calidad de vida, decídete a apoyarlo, él te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for his grocery store.  Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Ganine

texts.es:
Business Description

Ganine and her husband have 25 years of experience in vehicle repair. She was able to learn some things about vehicle repair, and later her husband was the one who acquired greater knowledge, since from the age of 12 he worked along with a friend. At present, he has a workshop located in their home, where he also provides employment for one of his children, who already knows the trade, as well as for two other people. He works every day of the week from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m.

Loan Use

The loan is requested to invest in the purchase of spare parts for cars. At present they just repair the vehicle without replacing any of the parts. What they want is to have the spare parts on hand, which will improve the service they offer.

Personal Information

Ganine is 39 years old and has 4 children, including 3-year-old twins. Her house is of mixed construction (part concrete, part cane). In the future, she plane to start a car-washing business. She hopes with this investment that she will be able to improve her income and meet the goals she has in mind.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Ganine junto a su esposo tienen ya una experiencia de 25 años con el servicio de reparación de vehículos. Ella pudo aprender en parte la reparación de los vehículos. Luego de esto su esposo fue la persona que adquirió mayor conocimiento ya que desde la edad de 12 años trabajaba junto a un amigo. Actualmente tiene un taller ubicado en su domicilio. Del que le da trabajo a uno de sus hijos que ya sabe el oficio. Además de 2 personas conocidos de el. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo solicita para invertir en la compra de repuestos de carros. Actualmente ellos solo realizan la reparación del vehiculo sin poner ningún repuesto. Lo que desean es poder tener los repuestos a mano con el que mejoraran el servicio que en este momento ofrece.

Información Personal

Ganine tiene 39 años. Y 4 hijos. Tiene 2 gemelos de 3 años. Su casita es de construcción mixta. Ha solicitado crédito con el que poco a poco esta terminando su casita de cemento. A futuro espera montar un negocio de lavadoras de autos. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder mejorar sus ingresos. Y cumplir con sus objetivos que tiene en mente.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a display case and more merchandise

loans.name: You

texts.en: Mrs. You S., age 54, sells Khmer noodles to customers, making around $1 each day in profit. Her husband, age 59, works making and selling traditional medicines, making around $2 each day. They have three children. One is a garment worker making $80 per month, one is a construction worker making $50 per month, and one is a student. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to invest in her business by buying more noodle supplies and also buy rice crops from the farmers to resell in the market for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make noodles and purchase rice crops.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
A. Mavzuna is 28. Her elder son is 8 and already goes to school, and the daughter is only 4. Mavzuna is selling make-up and cosmetics. Her husband has another trading place in a different market. He also sells make-up for women. Mavzuna has been in the business for two years already. 
Mavzuna is dreaming of expanding her business and opening her own store and establishing contacts with the suppliers of well-known producers. Mavzuna and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating their kids so that they become experts in future. 
Now Mavzuna requests 990.00 US Dollars in order to purchase new cosmetics, such as lipsticks, mascaras, powder, cream for skin, etc. with the purpose of enlarging her range of goods. This is her first loan; however, she is quite sure that she is able to pay it in a timely manner. Mavzuna would like to thank everybody for supporting her and promises to pay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing the goods for selling and increasing the stock

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi R. is single. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Valeryi works as a taxi driver. He has always loved cars and wanted to work with vehicles. His elder brother is a taxi driver too and Valeryi has followed in his footsteps. Flexibility and customer friendly service are some of the reasons Valeryi’s business has been so popular in the community. Valeryi has received and promptly repaid all of his loans from Nadiya Ukraine with no defaults. He has been in this business for 1.5 years. His current daily profit is about $40-50.

Valeryi would like to receive a loan of $400 to repair his vehicle and install new technology that will help his car run on methane gas. A reliable car that consumes little fuel will enable him to serve more clients, handle tough competition and expand his business. Profits generated will not only promote continued growth for Valeryi’s business but will also provide him with a good and stable income.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz has an account with the community bank Mujeres Valientes (Brave Women), located in Jr. Coronel Portillo No. 810, in the Calleria district, within the city of Ucayali. She is 70 years old, is a mother of 3 children, and is married to her husband who is now retired. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of S/300 she invested the funds in a small grocery store business.

The small grocery store has grown and so have the sales of cold drinks. Seeing that her children are independent she busies herself only with the grocery store and homemaking.

with the loan of $450, to be repaid in a 5 month term, she will invest in the purchase of 2 boxes of soft drinks, sugar, milk, pastas, breads, and snacks.

Beatriz, regardless of her age, still has the energy to keep working. She a woman to be modelled for her desire to feel valued and because she values herself. Thanks to the guidance given by her community bank, she is succeeding.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Beatriz pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N° 810, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 70 años, es madre D. 3 hijos y su esposo es jubilado. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300 deciD. invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad la bodega creció y también venD. bebidas refrescantes. Como sus hijos ya son independientes sólo se dedica a la bodega y a las labores domésticas del hogar. Con el préstamo D. S/.1,300, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra D. 2 cajas D. gaseosas, azúcar, leche, fideos, panes y golosinas. Beatriz, a pesar D. su edad, sigue teniendo las energías para seguir trabajando. Es un ejemplo D. mujer a seguir por sus ganas D. sentirse útil y valerse por si misma y gracias a los consejos dados en su banco comunal lo está logrando.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, sugar, milk, pastas, etc

loans.name: Enedina's Group

texts.es:
Victoria, Hida, and Enedina have been members of the “Poder” communal bank for 3, 3, and 6 years respectively.

Victoria is a 42-year-old married mother of 8. She and her husband sell herbal medicine that they prepare themselves, using herbs that have healing properties. They sell their products in the streets of the city of Ayacucho.

Hida is a 43-year-old married mother of 2. She makes trips to the markets and towns in the Ayacucho region, where she buys cereal, small animals, cheese, and other products sold in these markets.

Enedina is a 48-year-old woman who lives with her partner and 5 children. Four times a week, she makes trips to the local markets, where she sells fruit. From those markets, she brings cheese and small animals. Enedina also sells food for parties, and will prepare and sell local dishes during Holy Week.

Victoria, Hida, and Enedina need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 Peruvian soles respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of medicinal herbs, sangre de drago (dragon's blood--medicinal resin), copaiba balsam, wheat, peas, broad beans, meat, potatoes, and rice.

Victoria, Hida, and Enedina dream of owning a house, improving and stabilizing their businesses, and seeing their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria, Hida y Enedina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Poder hace 3, 3, 6 años respectivamente.

Victoria es casada, tiene 42 años y 8 hijos, Victoria junto a su esposo venden medicina natural que ellos mismos preparan a base de hierbas con propiedades curativas, sus ventas lo realizan ambulantemente por las calles de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Hida es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Hida viaja a las ferias y pueblos de la región de Ayacucho, donde compra cereales, animales menores, quesos, productos que son vendidos en los mercados de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Enedina es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Enedina viaja a las ferias 4 veces por semana, donde vende frutas, y de las ferias trae queso, animales menores. Además Enedina por fiestas vende comida y por la Semana Santa venderá comida típica.

Victoria, Hida y Enedina necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas medicinales, sangre de drago, aceite de copaiba, trigo, arveja, haba, carne, papa, arroz.

Los sueños de Victoria, Hida y Enedina son tener casa propia, mejorar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda estable.

loans.use: Purchase of medicinal herbs, sangre de drago (medicinal resin), copaiba balsam, wheat, peas, broad beans, meat, potatoes, and rice

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Even though she has been working in her grocery store for 20 years, María continues with the same strength, and even more, than what she started with. She is a 58-year-old woman and mother. Thanks to her efforts, the location of her grocery store is being modified and expanded because the space that she had before is very small when compared with how much her business has grown in the last few years. She started by selling drinks that she made herself, then she participated in sales campaigns on different dates of the year (Christmas, Mother's Day, the start of the school year, etc.).

It was when she built her house that it occured to her to build an additional room with the idea of starting a business. As such, once her house was constructed, she decided to open her grocery store. Little by little, she has implemented it, and now, she not only sells groceries, but also office supplies.

María's main motivation in these months is the education of her youngest daughter, who is 18-years-old, and who wants to enroll in a graphic design school.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

A pesar de que ya lleva veinte años trabajando en su bodega, María continúa con las mismas fuerzas, e incluso más, que con las que empezó. Ella es una mujer y madre de familia de cincuenta y ocho años de edad. Gracias a su esfuerzo, el local de su bodega está siendo modificado y ampliado pues el espacio que tenía antes ya le quedaba muy chico para lo mucho que ha crecido su negocio en estos últimos años. Al inicio ella empezó vendiendo bebidas hechas por ella misma, luego participaba de campañas de venta en diversas fechas del año (navidad, día de la madre, época escolar, etc). Fue cuando construyó su casa que se le ocurrió construir una habitación adicional con la idea de poner un negocio. Por lo tanto, una vez que estuvo construida su casa, decidió abrir su bodega. Poco a poco la ha ido implementando y, hoy, no solo vende productos de bodega sino también artículos de oficina. La principal motivación de María en estos meses es la educación de su última hija quien tiene dieciocho años y desea postular a una institución para estudiar diseño gráfico.

loans.use: To finish remodeling her grocery store

loans.name: Betilú

texts.es:
First Loan

Betilu is a member of the Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Betilu lives with her common-law spouse, is 31 years old and has 2 children. Betilu, together with her husband, sells pottery and crystal. Betilu has a stand in a shopping centre located in a major street in the city of Ayacucho. Her husband sells door-to-door in the streets of the city, his products varying depending on the demands.

Betilu requires a loan in the amount of 3200 soles. The funds will be invested in the purchase of thermos containers, plates, and cooking pots, all to be purchase in the city of Lima.

Betilu's dream is to expand her busniess and relocate it to a shopping centre with more traffic, and to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30375&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Betilu pertenece al Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Betilu es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Betilu junto a su esposo venden locería y cristalería, Betilu tiene un puesto en un centro comercial ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, mientras que su esposo vende caminando por las calles de la ciudad, sus productos son variados dependiendo de la demanda.

Betilu necesita un préstamo de 3200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de termos, cubiertos, platos, ollas que serán adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Los sueños de Betilu son incrementar su negocio, ubicar su negocio en otro centro comercial más concurrido y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Betilu requests a loan in the amount of 3200 soles. The funds will be invested in the purchase of thermos containers, cutlery, plates, and cooking pots, all to be purchase in the city of Lima.

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru:
Davron G. lives in the Gissarsky area. He is married and has three children. He works buying and selling small livestock. He has been doing this business for 14 years. He brings sheep and goats from other areas and sells them locally. The business brings in quite a good income; therefore, Davron has decided to increase his product turnover. This will help to increase profits and to improve living conditions for his family. Because of this, he has decided to take out a loan to be repaid in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Гулямов Даврон житель Гиссарского района. Женат и имеет троих детей. Занимается купле-продажей мелко рогатого скота. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 14 лет. Привозит овец и коз из других районов и продает у себя в районе. Бизнес приносит неплохой доход , поэтому Даврон решил увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить получаемую прибыль и улучшить условия жизни для своей семьи. В связи с этим он решил получить кредит со сроком в 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product turnover

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhan K. lives in Preak Tanop Village in Kandal Province, where she and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Phuong, farm and fish. They cultivate crops twice a year on their plantation, rice during the rainy season and vegetables during the dry season. Since the field is far from her water source, Mrs. Sokhan K. is requesting a loan to purchase a pump to water her field. She will also use part of the loan to buy fertilizers to support her crops. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to water her field and fertilizers to support her crop.

loans.name: Sophany's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophany K. Sophany is leader of five-member group, selling traditional Khmer cakes. She carries the cakes to customer's homes in her village Her husband is a bricklayer. She has been selling since 2006 and typically earns around $2 a day. She has four children, two of whom are married and two are construction workers. They live in Ratanak Commune, Battambang Province.

To expand business and increase income, Sophany would like to request a loan for her traditional cake-selling business, purchasing items such as rice, ingredients, and fruit.

Her group members follow: Mrs. Soeurn T., who is requesting a loan to use in her impure gold-selling business; Mr. Cheal Y., who is requesting a loan to use in her business selling sweets; Mrs. Savry H., who is requesting a loan to use for her second-hand clothes business; and Mr. Bunthoeun S., who is requesting a loan to use for selling cooked food. Mr. Bunthoeun is at the left side of the picture.

loans.use: For traditional cake selling business, purchasing such as rice, ingredients, and fruit

loans.name: Wilfredo René

texts.es: EL SEÑOR WILFREDO, ES UN SEÑOR MUY RESPONSABLE, TRABAJA CON LA INSTITUCION HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO Y RECIENTEMENTE CUMPLIÓ CON SU SUEÑO DE COMPRAR UN PEQUEÑO TERRENO PARA ASI CONSTRUIR SU HOGAR Y ADEMÁS, PODER DEJAR ALGÚN PATRIMONIO A SU FAMILIA, PARA QUE SUS HIJOS, NO SUFRAN LOS INCONVENIENTES QUE ÉL TUBO QUE PASAR, Y ADEMÁS MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA, CON ESTE PRÉSTAMO PIENSA COMENZAR LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU CASITA, PARA QUE ASÍ, SUS TRES PEQUEÑOS HIJITOS TENGAN UN HOGAR PROPIO DONDE VIVIR.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a very responsible man, working with this institution for a good stretch of time. He recently realized his dream of purchasing a small plot of land for where to build a home and this way leave his family with a legacy. He doesn't want his children to suffer the inconveniences that he had to go through and he wants to give them a better quality of life. With this loan he wants to start building his house, so that his three little ones can have a proper place to live.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fashionable jewelry to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Djamil

texts.en: Djamil is 48 years old, and is married with two children. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and is settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He has been in the carpentry business for six years. He would like a loan 970 AZN to buy the necessary materials to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for improving his business

loans.name: Nila

texts.es: Nila tiene 25 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña que está estudiando y es la razón para seguir adelante, vive con su conviviente quien la apoya mucho. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro,  el mismo que lo maneja su pareja, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 2 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que le ayuda mucho en sus gastos diaR. familiares. Le es rentable ya que ella es la encargada de administrar las ganancias diarias que recibe. Debido a la gran demanda de este tipo de transporte en la selva, tiene que lidiar con la competencia constantemente. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero comprará repuestos para mandar a repara su moto.
texts.en:
Nila is 25 and has a little girl who is a student and her reason for forging ahead. She lives with her partner, who is very supportive of her. She owns an auto rickshaw, which her partner has used for the past two years to earn a living transporting passengers. What Nila likes about this work is that it helps her with the family’s day-to-day expenses. It is profitable since she is the one who manages the daily earnings. Because of the high demand for this type of transportation in the rainforest, she is continually up against competition. This is the first time she has requested a loan from MFP. She will use the money to purchase spare parts to maintain her auto rickshaw.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her auto rickshaw

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Agness B. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one dependent who is staying with her because the girl is attending school nearby. Agness has been running a drink stall since last year. It is said that Coca Cola is one of the most recognized symbols in the world, and it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of shop selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola, Ltd. in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

Agness works at the business 13-16 hours per day and is assisted by two employees. Agness currently earns about 200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 775 USD in order to increase her inventory. Agness thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A., 42 years old, is married and lives at Bucana, Sicayab Dapitan City. Her husband, Reynaldo A., is an LTO Enforcer. They have 3 children, one who is already in College and the 2 are in Elementary School. Her husband’s salary cannot meet all their needs, so that’s why she struggles to have her own business. She used her husband salary to open-up a small sari-sari (small grocery) store in front of their house. But still the items of her store are not enough for the demand of her customers.

She heard about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and immediately joined the institution on July 20, 2007. She’s been a MIGS member of the Cooperative, so she has gotten several loans already. Now she’s applying for 10,000 php to buy basic goods for sale for her sari-sari store. 

She is looking forward to make her sari-sari store a mini-grocery someday for her to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy basic goods for sale

loans.name: Omar Augusto

texts.es:
El señor Omar Augusto Domínguez y su esposa la señora Katy Salas tienen dos hijos para los cuales quieren lo mejor.
A la vivienda le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de ella pero por el momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para comprar el material ya que Don Omar Augusto trabaja en la construcción y en horas adiciones realizar la mejora. Es por eso  que están solicitando un crédito, ya que están preocupados cunado los  niños salen a jugar no tienen seguridad. Planean pagar este préstamo con el ingreso que generan de su trabajo,
(En la foto apareces la esposa la señora Katy Salas ya que el señor Omar Augusto se encontraba en su trabajo)
texts.en:
Omar Augusto Domínguez and his wife, Katy Salas, have two children whom they love more than anything. Their home is missing a fence around it, but at the moment they don't have the necessary funds to purchase the materials. Omar works in construction and in his spare time he plans to make the improvements. It's for this reason they are requesting a loan, since they worry for their children's security when they go out and play. They plan to repay the loan with income from Omar's job. (Katy is in the photo because Omar was at work when it was taken)

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence around home

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухабат живет с мужем, ей 59 лет. Оба спруга находятся на пенсии, но она такая маленькая и приходится заниматься предпринимательством. Она продает варенный горох на центральном рынке. Ее муж готовит горох дома, а она реализует его. Варенный горох популярное блюдо у таджиков и поэтому прибыль остается хорошая. У Мухаббат имеется постоянное торговое место на центральном рынке. Кроме того Мухаббат и ее зять держат маленький продуктовый магазин по месту жительства. Мухаббат планирует уевличить свой оборотный капитал и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Muhabbat lives with her husband. She is 59 years old. Both spouses are retired, but their pension is small and they must be entrepreneurs. She sells boiled peas at the central market. Her husband prepares the peas at home and she sells them. The peas are a popular food among the Tajiks, so her income remains good. She has a permanent sales place at the central market. In addition, Muhabbat and her brother in law keep a small grocery store where they live. Muhabbat decided to increase her working capital and apply for a loan from Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of peas wholesale

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam S., 42, is a villager from Pursat province, where he cultivates rice to earn a living. He puts in two rice crops per year on farmland inherited from his grandparents. Besides his farming business, he also has a job as a requirement worker. His wife works with him in the field as well as raising animals for sale. The family lives with one teenage child who is a student in the local public school.

Because farming is the family's most important source of income, they are looking for a loan in order to buy 3 water buffalo. This will help with the hard physical labor of plowing the fields and they can make additional income by hiring out to other farmers.

loans.use: To buy 3 water buffalo

loans.name: Adejoke

texts.fr: Adejoke O.  est une femme de 49 ans, marée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de divers articles au bord da la route à Lomé. Pour permettre à son activité de répondre aux exigences de la clientèle, Adejoke espère avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, construire une baraque et l’approvisionner afin de donner un cadre convivial à sa clientèle. Cette chance lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et par conséquent mieux épargner pour la survie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adejoke O., 49, is married and the mother of 4 children. She sells various items along the roadside in Lomé. In order to allow her business to respond to the demand of her clientele, Adejoke hopes, with this second loan from FECECAV, to build a little shed and outfit it, so as to have a more welcoming venue for her clientele. This good fortune will allow her to increase her turnover and thus be able to save better for the survival of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construct a shed and furnish it with goods

loans.name: Assumane Chicale

texts.pt:
Assumane nasceu em Nampula, tem 41 anos de idade estudou ate a 8ª classe vive maritalmente é pai de 3 filhos com idades comprieendidas entre os 2 aos 13 anos de idade. Somente os dois mais velhos e que vão a escola.

Assumana mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da Swazilandia a procura de emprego, trabalhou alguns anos numa residência como guarda e conseguiu abrir uma barraca no mercado central da Namaacha. Assim Assumane decide largar o emprego e dedicar se ao seu negócio, hoje ocupa 3 bancas e conta com ajuda dos seus sobrinhos que vivem com ele e da lhes um subcidio de 800.00mt mensalmente pois com o primeiro emprestimo que teve na hluvuku e Kiva seu negocio melhorou muito, Assumane conseguiu construir  um barraca na sua residência para melhor satisfazer a necessidade dos seus vizinhos  e clientes. Trabalha das 7h as 22h tem como melhor produto(cigarros, lampadas, colas, fios electricos e cosmeticos)tem um rendimento mensal de 8.000.00mt, consegue por mês poupar 1.000.00mt porque esta prestes a dar continuidade da sua obra criando assim mais espaso de lazer para sua familia.para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive em Nampula enviando lhe em cada 6 mêses uma valor de 1.000.00mt.


Este é o segundo empréstimo de Assumane na Hluvuku e Kiva. Os primeiros 11.000.00mt foram usados para comprar produtos de revenda e construir uma barraca na sua residevcia  e pagou cem nenhum problema. E estes 20.000.00mt seram usados para comprar produtos da sua barraca que se encontra na residência, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo e pedir um novo emprestimo para completar o seu grande sonho o de comprar um carro que lhe permitira nos seus trabalhos diarios.
texts.en:
Assumane was born in Nampula. He is 41 years old and went to school until the 8th grade. He is married and the father of 3 children with ages between 2 and 13 years old. Only the two oldest are in school. Assumane moved to Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, in search of work. He worked a few years in a residence as a security guard, and he was able to open a stand in the central market of Namaacha. As such Assumane decided to leave his job and dedicate his efforts on his business. Today he occupies 3 spaces and has help from his nephews who live with him. He pays them an amount of 800MT per month. With the first loan that he received from Hluvuku and Kiva his business improved a lot. Assumane was able to construct a stand at his house to better satisfy the needs of his neighbors and customers. He works from 7:00am until 10:00pm. His best products are cigarettes, lamps, glues, electric filaments, and cosmetics. He earns 8,000MT monthly and is able to save 1,000MT. He is ready to continue his work thus creating more leisure time for his family. Besides his children he is also supporting his mother who lives in Nampula, and he sends her 1,000MT every 6 months. This is Assumane's second loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The first 11,000MT were used to purchase products to resell and to build a stand at his house. He paid it off without problems. This loan of 20,000MT will be used to purchase products for his stand that one normally finds at home. He is confident that he can pay off the loan before maturity so he can request another loan to complete his dream of purchasing a car, which will assist him with his daily work.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria B. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, four sons a daughter. All of her children are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Victoria is a trader. She trades in eggs. She procures crates of eggs from poultry farms in her community and nearby communities at affordable prices and sells in the local market. She also treks to other towns to sell. She distributes some to retailers and beverage sellers. She has been in business for four years and is requesting a loan to procure crate of eggs in bulk. Victoria hopes to continue to expand her business so she can give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy eggs in bulk

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de sus suegros. Hace 4 años decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su casa porque en su barrio no existía una tienda cercana, con el apoyo de su esposo con en el capital que requería pudo implementar su tienda, la que ahora atiende todos los días incluyendo los domingos. Para Betty este trabajo es una actividad tranquila, que le permite estar en su misma casa para atender a sus hijos; además, es una fuente adicional de ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, lo que la hace sentir satisfecha por su labor. Para un futuro cercano, Betty desea incrementar la cantidad de sus productos para ofrecer mayores opciones de consumo para sus  clientes, ya que por el momento sólo vende los comestibles de básicos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y en fortalecer la unidad de su grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de mercadería para abastecer su pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
Betty is 35 and lives in her in-laws' house with her husband and 2 children. Four years ago she decided to open a grocery store in her home because there isn't one near her neighborhood. With help from her husband she had the capital she needed to open her store, which she now tends every day, including Sundays. This is a laid-back job for Betty because she can be in her own house where she can care for her children. It also provides an additional source of income to support the household, which makes the work very satisfying. In the near future, Betty would like to expand her inventory so her customers can have more products to choose from. At present she offers only basic food items. This will be Betty's first loan with MFP, so she is committed to making prompt payments and building up the unity of her group. She plans to use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes  du  groupe Sabougnouman sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames dans le quartier Bananissabakoro de la ville de  Ségou (4ème  Région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants par femme.
Elles font essentiellement le commerce d’articles divers tels les pagnes wax, les produits cosmétiques,  du savon, des chaussures, du bois de chauffe, des céréales (riz, mil et arachide), des fruits et légumes, pommes de terre, bananes, pommes, mangues, oranges, etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur  deuxième  prêt  solidaire. Le premier prêt fut correctement remboursé sans aucune difficulté.
Ce  nouveau prêt servira à  acheter, 5 complets de pagnes wax, 20 cartons de savon, 5 sacs d’arachide, 2 cartons de pommes, 3 sacs de mil, 250 kg de banane, un chargement de charrette en mangues, 8 chargements de charrette en  bois de chauffe. Elles se ravitaillent en fruits et légumes à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et aux autres produits à la foire hebdomadaire du grand marché de Ségou. Elles revendent toutes leurs marchandises en détail au comptant  et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers et dans les différents marchés de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et aider les époux à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The women of the Group Sabougnouman are married, mostly in monogamous families in the neighborhood Bananissabakoro in the city of Ségou (4th Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). On average, they are 45 years old with 5 children per woman.

Their business is basically to sell various items, such as wax “pagnes” (brightly printed cloth), cosmetics, soap, shoes, firewood, grains (rice, millet and peanuts), fruits and vegetables (like potatoes, bananas, apples, mangoes, oranges) etc.

With the goal of increasing their business, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom this is their second loan together. The first loan was properly repaid without difficulty.

This new loan will be used to buy 5 sets of wax “pagnes”, 20 cartons of soap, 5 sacks of peanuts, 3 cartons of apples, 3 sacks of millet, 250 kilograms of bananas, one cartload of mangoes and 8 cartloads of firewood. They will supply themselves with fruits and vegetables in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and the other products in the weekly large market in Ségou.

They will resell all of their merchandise at retail for cash and credit from their homes, walking around the neighborhoods and the other markets in Ségou to a clientele composed of men and women.

They anticipate an average monthly profit of 26,000FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan and to help their spouses provide for their families. Their ambition is to buy a house to live in.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of items for their business.

loans.name: Alba Lorena

texts.es: la sra. Alba L. tiene 33 años de edad, ella tiene un pequeño negocio en la colonia sagastume de la ciudad capital de Tegucigalpa, su negocio es una pulperia, tiene un año de tener su negocio, antes se dedicaba a la venta de golosinas en el porton de un centro de estudios de la colonia sagastume, junto a su esposo se ayudan mutuamente y salen adelante con todos los gastos del hogar. Alba es una mujer preparada, con el credito que esta solicitando lo quiere invertir en la compra de mas mercaderia para sutir mas su pulperia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba L. is 33 years old. She has a small business in the Sagastume district in the capital city of Tegucigalpa. She has had a general store for one year. Before this, she sold sweets in the door of a school in the Sagastume district. She and her husband help each other and take care of all the household expenses. Alba is a competent woman, and with the loan she is requesting, she wants to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to increase the supply of goods in her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, churros, bread, cookies, sweets, soups, pastas, sauces, salt, butter, candies, toilet paper, canned juice, and razors

loans.name: Naotala

texts.en:
Naotala T. (1040000260) is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Faleseela.  She is married and has five school-aged children.  To make a living, Naotala owns & operates a business planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Naotala has been engaged in this business for over 17 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

Naotala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Naotala has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  Naotala is now requesting a new loan of 2500 WST, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out Naotala from SPBD.  Naotala plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen S. is already 33 years old and engaged in mushroom production and a direct sales business. She is happily married to Darwin who is a truck driver. They live happily in the village of Isidro Paredes in Diffun Quirino.

Aileen also sells her mushrooms in other villages and sometimes in their market. Maintaining the business needs enough financial capital to buy the needed amount of mushrooms. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 for her to further develop her direct sales business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora  Luz Marina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nueva Flor”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 4 hijos y estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el centro poblado Rosa Cami sector Lupaca.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado ovino.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ganado vacuno para engorde, Luz Marina también se ayuda con su chacra y vende productos de la region.

Su mayor deseo poder darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Marina is a member of the Communal Bank "Nueva Flor" which is located in the district of Ilave, Province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, is married, and has 4 children. She has an incomplete elementary school education and lives in the community of Rosa Cami, in the Lupaca sector. Luz Marina started working with the movement Manuela Ramos a year ago. Her initial loan was for PEN 500 which she used for the purchase of sheep. Now she is asking for a loan of PEN 1,000 which she will invest in the purchase of feeder cattle. Luz Marina also supports herself with her farm and the sale of regional products. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with an education. She likes saving and social gatherings.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is 45 years old and married to Virgilio, a ferry (small passenger boat) driver, who is 48 years old. She is a mother to three, two sons and a daughter. All of her kids are in school and they are very studious. She lives in the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines.

In 2007, Norma joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with hopes of getting access to capital to fund her business. For more than eight years she has been engaged in the resale of frozen foods as her primary business and fishing as her secondary business. Recently she decided to make fishing her primary business. She believes that fishing, as compared to the resale of frozen foods, brings her much more income for sustaining the needs of her family, especially with all of her kids attending school.

Now on her fourth loan, she is requesting 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her fishing business. Part of the loan money will still go to her resale of frozen foods. Specifically, some of the amount will be used to pay for two bundles of fishnets for her fish cage and some will be used as rolling capital for her frozen foods business.

Norma is positive that her business will succeed with the help of ASHI and with the trust of KIVA lenders. She dreams of supporting her children in their schooling until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To buy fishnets for her fish cage and as rolling capital for her frozen foods business.

loans.name: Rours

texts.en: Rours P. is 30 years old and resides with her husband in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been raising pigs and is able to make US $2 of profit every day.
