Her husband, Yuon Sok (pictured here) has a business making rice wine. He typically makes about US $2.50 each day. This couple has two young children. Rours P. would like a loan of US $500 so that her husband can purchase more rice to make rice wine.

loans.use: producing rice wine

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en: Rechel B. is from the town of Oroquieta. She is 20 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Rechel owns and operates a dried-fish buy and sell business, selling dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month In 2000, Rechel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rechel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to make improvements and renovations to her house. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To make renovations to her house

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 49 años, es madre de cuatro hijos,uno de ellos es menor de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la municipalidad Distrital de Yarina Cocha. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y también tiene una pequeña bodega, ella cuenta con un motocarro  pues allí salen a vender sus productos por diferentes lugares del distrito. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Flores de los Próceres” desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que le permitió invertir en la compra de pescado fresco y seco.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, comprará pescado seco para venderlo en otra ciudad. La meta de Lucia es construir su casa y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Lucia, 49, is an enterprising woman who lives in the Yarinacocha district, Ucayali district. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is an adult. Her husband works in the district municipality of Yarina Cocha. She sells dried fish and also has a small general store. She has a motocar (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that she uses to travel to the various areas of the district selling her wares. For the past 5 years she has been a member of the “Las Flores de los Próceres” communal bank. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy fresh and dried fish. With this 1,500 sol loan she will buy dried fish to sell in another city. Lucia's goal is to build her house and have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Gbonkolenken Group

texts.en:
This is Mariama B., Fatmata C., Isatu F. and Hawanatu K.. They named their group Gbonkolenken. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. They are requesting for a loan of SLL 2,600.00.00. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve their standard of living.

Mariama B. (right) is the leader of this group. Mariama is forty-five years of age. She was born in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have five children. Three of her children are in secondary school and one is in secondary school. Mariama sells cooked rice, vegetables, and meat, and has been in this business for three years now. Mariama will use her share of the loan to buy bags of rice and gallons of palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), and to renovate her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy rice and palm oil, and to renovate her restuarant

loans.name: Kalamba Tukole Group, Mubende

texts.en: Nalongo N. has owned a restaurant for 14 years. She is 49 years old and married with four children. She also takes care of two dependants from Kalamba. N. ensures that she has good customer relations. She is able to make some profit that enables her to run her home and support her family. Generally, loans have helped her pay school fees for her children and allowed for business expansion. She would like to expand and transform her restaurant into a big business as well as to complete her family house. She needs a loan to be able to buy and stock more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena O. is from the village of Galas. She is 62 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Elena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month. In 2008, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida J. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Nida is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns and operates a service-based business, providing motorcycle services to transport passengers in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $50 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Nida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further develop her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia P. D. N. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos los cuales asisten a la universidad y ayudan con el negocio. La señora Rosa posee una panadería, en la cual se encarga D. elaborar pan dulce, (nombre que se le da al pan en El Salvador, el cual es D. sabor dulce como su nombre lo indica). Durante mucho años ella se ha dedicado a este tipo D. trabajo, a través del cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y así mismo le ha brindado la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar y pagarles los estudios universitarios a sus hijos, los cuales le ayudan  cada tarD. a elaborar el pan. Rosa comercializa sus productos en su propia casa, lugar en el cual lo venD. por mayor o por unidad. Así mismo posee una ruta D. clientes a los cuales les lleva el pan hasta sus propias casas.  Rosa es una señora muy entusiasta y trabajadora, la cual ha dedicado gran parte D. su vida a la elaboración del pan, obteniendo gran experiencia, lo que le permite tener muchos clientes. Razón por la cual ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. harina, levadura, miel y otros ingredientes más y así elaborar mayor cantidad D. pan para los clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia P. D. N. is 50 years old and lives in Santa Tecla, a zone of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and their three children who are in college and help with the business. Mrs. Rosa has a bakery, where she works making pan dulce (a name given to the bread of El Salvador, and which is sweet, as indicated by its name). For many years she has worked at this type of job, which has allowed her to help her children get ahead, provided the means for her husband to take care of the home's expenses and, paid for their children's studies. Their children help every afternoon preparing the bread. Rosa sells her products out of the home, in bulk or individually. She also has a sales route and delivers bread to the houses of certain customers. Rosa is a very enthusiastic and hard-working lady. She has devoted a large part of her life to making bread, and has a lot of experience, which allows her to have many customers. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more flour, yeast, honey, and other ingredients to make more bread for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and yeast

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is a 30-year-old single lady with one daughter. She used to sell cereals but now she  sells ladies clothes and earns extra income from her salon. Anastacia, being a member of Faulu Kenya, has benefited by taking loans. Now she requests a loan of Kes. 15,000 to buy more stock. She dreams of owning a salon and a boutique in the future.  She describes herself as hardworking and God fearing.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace W. G. is thirty-one years old, married, and has two children aged eleven and six years old, to whom they hope to give quality education. Her business is located at Mukuru kwa Njenga, an established slum business area, in Thika. 

Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. Grace has been selling electronics like DVDs, radios, televisions, etc., for the last seven years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is lack of enough working capital for the business. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 55,000 to buy more electronics to expand her business. She hopes to have many electronic shops in future. She wants to be a market leader in this business. She is very humble, respectful, and sociable.

loans.use: Electronics

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel tiene 74 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdo. Esta actividad es muy popular en nuestro país, pues la mayoría de las personas tienen este medio de vida para sobrevivir. Hace más de 5 años, que se dedica a este negocio cuando dio inicio fue por su familia, pues anteriormente su mama se hacía cargo, fue así que Víctor aprendió de este negocio por tal razón él decide establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cerdos. Víctor desea construir 2 cuartos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is 74 years old. His business involves buying and selling pigs. This activity is very popular in Nicaragua since many people pursue this livelihood in order to survive. Victor has been in this family business for more than five years when he took it over from his mother. He learned everything about the business and decided to establish it from his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more pigs. Victor hopes to build two rooms to add to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy pigs

loans.name: Lalitha

texts.en:
Lalitha is a 47-year-old married woman living with her husband and daughter in the Galle district of Sri Lanka.

Lalitha has a cinnamon garden that she cultivates with her husband.  They started this business two years ago with her first loan from BRAC.  She is a very honest woman, and her husband and daughter help her to cultivate and sell her cinnamon.

Now she is asking for her second loan from BRAC in the amount of 45,000 LKR to help purchase some new land to further expand the cinnamon garden.

Ultimately, Lalitha hopes to renovate her house with her additional income.

loans.use: to help purchase new land to expand the cinnamon garden

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto de 32 años de edad es casado con la sra. Martha Raquel Pérez con quien tiene una hija de 8 año estudiando la primaria, es un pequeño productor de la colonia del Serrano en el municipio de Nueva Guinea , la actividad principal que desarrolla es la ganaderia y la agricultura, desde muy pequeño inicio estas labores en su finca, por lo tanto cuenta con una gran experiencia, ademas se dedica a la comercailización de gando y establecimientos de cultivos de raices y tuberculos. 

Esta solicitando su 9no credito para compra de terneros los cuales los piensa desarrollar (engordar) para cuando obtenga un buen peso venderlos a un precio que le deje buena ganancia, pues asi lograra sacar adelante a su familia. 

Sueña con tener buen inventario ganadero y mejorar la raza de su hato, ademas desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.Luis Albertose caracteriza por ser una persona amable y de muy buenas costumbres,expresa estar agradecido con AFODENIC porque gracias a los creditos obtenido ha salido adelante.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 32 years old and married to Ms. Martha Raquel Pérez, with whom he has an 8-year-old daughter who is in elementary school. He is a small-scale farmer in the Serrano housing development of the Nueva Guinea municipality. His main business is stock-breeding and agriculture. He has been working on a farm from a young age, which means that he has extensive experience. He also sells livestock and tuber and root crop fields. He is requesting his 9th loan in order to purchase calves that he plans on fattening up to sell when they have reach the appropriate weight, thus getting good profits and helping his family get ahead. He dreams of having a good number of cattle and of improving the breed of his herd. He also hopes to improve his family's living conditions. Luis Alberto is known for being a friendly and well mannered person. He states that he is grateful to AFODENIC because thanks to their loans, he has been able to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Mrs. San Heng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The nine people who make up this village bank loan live I. Pring village I. the Takeo province. They will all use their loan for different purposes to improve their businesses I. the future. 

Mrs. San H. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is widow with a child who is a farmer like she is. Now her problem is that it is time to harvest her rice field, but she does not have enough money to support it. So, to improve her rice production, Mrs. San H. is applying for a loan to hire farming laborers to harvest her rice field I. this current year.

loans.use: To hire farming laborers to harvest her rice field

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino A. T. was born 42 years ago in Mandia, in the Manica province of Mozambique. He is still pursuing secondary school studies, at the moment 10th grade. He still has two more grades to finish secondary. He lives with his partner and has a child with her. He also has two children in his home town from a previous relationship.

Faustino supports his child, his wife, a younger brother, a nephew and a niece. His son, brother and niece go to school; his nephew will start going in the near future.

Faustino left his hometown to come to Maputo province in 1994 when he was transferred by the army. He has worked in the army since 1987 as a naval mechanic. He learned this job from a British cooperation project in 1989 in Zambezia, a northern province.

Faustino is asking for a loan to keep constructing and improving the house he owns, where he lives with his family. Specifically, with the money from Kiva he will buy an electric pulley to extract water from the well on his property, as you can see in the photo.

This is Faustino’s third loan with Hluvuku. The previous loans were also used to help improve his house. He dreams of buying a car one day when he finishes improving and developing his house.

loans.use: To buy an electric pulley for the well at his home

loans.name: Vath

texts.en:
Mr. Vath K. is 38 years old and is a villager who lives in Treang village in Takeo province. He is a pig middleman and also a pork seller, who earns a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Thim Yun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice (his wife is in the picture with him). This couple does not have any children. 

To support his business, and in order to increase his income to improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Vath K. decided to ask for a loan to buy 125 kg of pork to sell.

loans.use: To buy 125 kg of pork to sell

loans.name: Triunfadoras Sin Límites Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Triunfadoras sin Límite” y está conformado por 12 socias, pertenecientes a la comuna de La Florida.
Ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta de artículos de aseo, ropa, mermeladas y manjar caseros, gorros, comida, papas fritas, sopaipillas, costuras y peluquería.
La socia entrevistada fue Katherine, quien es la  delegada de educación. En la foto se encuentra en la 2º fila, en 2º lugar de izquierda a derecha y viste suéter azul. Ella vende productos de chocolatería, principalmente alfajores y cuchuflis (barquillos rellenos de manjar). Vende sus productos en almacenes y en jardines infantiles. Lleva 4 años con este negocio.
Katherine es cosmetóloga, por lo que también hace terapias de relajación, digitopuntura y manicure a domicilio. Además cuando se ha enfrentado a momentos de crisis económica le pide la máquina de coser a su mamá y hace buzos para un colegio.
Invertirá este préstamo en manjar, chocolates, galletas para los alfajores y palitos para brochetas de chocolate.
Su meta es vender solo por cajas, ya que hasta ahora vende mayormente por unidad.
Su gran sueño es tener una tienda de disfraces.
Las motivaciones de Katherine son sus 2 hijos de 12 y 5 años y su esposo, el cual ha sido un apoyo fundamental para ella.
Lo que más le gusta de participar con Fondo Esperanza es que ha podido motivarse y valorar más su negocio, al saber que puede seguir con los préstamos, si  es responsable, cosa que procura concientemente.

La Florida es una comuna ubicada al  suroriente de Santiago, capital de Chile,  Su población actual representa a todos los sectores económicos que hay en la Región Metropolitana, habiendo un sector de nivel alto, medio alto, medio y medio bajo. La zona cuenta con modernos centros comerciales y es un comuna en crecimiento.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Triunfadoras sin Limite” and is made up of 12 members who are from the community of La Florida. They work mostly in selling cleaning products, clothing, jams, and custards (flan), hats, food, French fries, typical fried pastries, dressmaking and hairstyling. The member who was interviewed is Katherine, the education delegate. In the photo she is in the second row, shown standing second, going from left to right, and she’s wearing a blue sweater. She sells chocolate products, mostly candies and cuchiflis (bars filled with caramelized sweetened condensed milk). She sells her products in stores and child care centers and has been working in this business for 4 years. She is a beautician and she also does relaxation therapy, shiatsu, and manicures in people’s homes. Also when she is faced with times of economic crises, she borrows her mother's sewing machine and makes jerseys for a school. She will use the loan to buy the caramelized milk spread, chocolates, cookies to make the typical candies, and plastic sticks to make chocolate bars. Her goal is to sell only by the box, because now she sells mostly individually. Her biggest dream is to have a costume store. Katherine’s motivation for all this is her 2 children, 12 and 5, and her husband, who has been a basic support for her. What she most likes about participating with Fondo Esperanza is that she has been able to become motivated and appreciate her business more. She does this knowing that she can continue receiving loans if she is responsible, something that she is always working to achieve. La Florida is a community located in the southeast of Santiago, the capital of Chile. Its current population has all economic levels that are found in the metropolitan area: upper, upper middle, middle, and lower middle classes. The area has modern commercial centers and is a growing community.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chocolate, caramelized milk, cookies and plastic sticks.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame N. sells vegetables, groundnut paste, salted fish and other foodstuffs at Abura.  Maame has received a senior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a chain saw operator. Maame has been selling vegetables for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables and other foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and other foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Fátima del Rosario M. N., tiene la edad de 47 años vive en el Barrio Nindiri, es casado y su esposo labora como chofer apoyándole en los gastos que se incurren mensualmente tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad que estudian y apoyan a sus padres en las actividades del hogar y la finca.

Ellos se dedican a la Agricultura, desde hace 15 años, fue gracias  al apoyo de sus suegros que lograron incursionar en esta actividad que ha sido la fuente de ingresos de la familia durante todos estos años, es ahora que ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que le permitan brindarle un mantenimiento a sus terrenos para que se produzca a futuro una mejor cosecha, esta inversión les permitirá mejores condiciones económicas, que favorecerán el desarrollo económico a la familia y sobre todo a sus hijos que están iniciándose en el mundo universitario, así mismo como proyectos familiares para el bienestar de todos.
texts.en:
Fatima del Rosario M. N. is 47 and lives in the Nindiri neighbourhood. She is married, and her husband works as a driver, helping her with their monthly costs. They have 3 grown children who study and support their parents in the household and farm activities. They have been farmers for 15 years. It was thanks to the support of their parents that they were able to enter into this activity which has been the source of their family's income for all these years. They are now requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural materials which will permit them to maintain their lands so that they produce a better harvest in the future. This investment will allow them better economic conditions, which will help the economic development of the family and above all of their children who are joining the world of university. It will also help with family projects for the well-being of all.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purcahse of agricultural materials that will allow them to maintain their lands so that they produce a better harvest in the future

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer S., 32, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Lino S., a security guard. They are blessed in their marriage with good health and strong physiques that enables them to work and prepare for their future together.

Jennifer operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.

Jennifer earns by buying supplies at the wholesale price and selling retail in small quantities. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Jennifer is requesting a Php 10,000 loan that she will use to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She has been a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for almost two years now.
 
Jennifer dreams of having a successful and peaceful life. She also hopes that she will be having a comfortable and well-off future with all the hard work she puts into her business.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: El Marquez Group

texts.es:
El Márquez es un grupo conformado por 13 personas, ellos viven en la Comunidad Cerro del Márquez, Estado de México, y de ahí escogieron el nombre. Los integrantes son: Damiana A. (Venta de Antojitos)), Teresita R. (Frutas y Legumbres), Placida Pérez (Venta de Antojitos), Martha B. (Tienda de Ropa). Josefina S. (Herrería), Adriana A. (Bisutería), Guadalupe C. (Frutas y Verduras), Oswaldo Q. (Frutas y Legumbres), Gonzalo S. (Albañilería), Eduardo S. (Equipo de Sonido), Isabel Reina López (Venta de Catalogo), Alejandra C. (Dulcería) y Modesta Crescencia B. (Venta de Catalogo).

Alejandra C. es integrante del grupo, tiene 31 años de edad, su familia esta integrada por su esposo y sus tres hijas quienes estudian actualmente (Secundaria, Primaria y Preescolar). Ale trabajaba en una casa realizando el aseo pero la paga era muy poca y viendo que los gastos en su familia iban incrementado día a día, decidió comenzar una actividad que le ayudara a tener una mejor solvencia económica, y que al mismo tiempo le permitiera pasar tiempo con su familia así que comenzó con la venta de dulces, frituras, refrescos, jabón, etc,. Todos los días desde muy temprano saca sus productos afuera de su domicilio, los días de mejor venta para ella son los fines de semana y en temporada de fiestas ya que es cuando vende mas refrescos, ella tiene ocho meses con su negocio y esta muy contenta y desea superarse. Ale tiene muchos planes tanto para su vida personal como para su negocio pero los mas importantes son que sus hijas salgan adelante y puedan terminar una carrera y hacer una pequeña accesoria para hacer un poco mas grande su tiendita. El crédito solicitado lo va a utilizar para la compra de mercancía como: refrescos, jabón, aceite, dulces, etc. y así tener una mejor clientela, y con las ganancias obtenidas comprar lo necesario para sus hijas..

El Márquez agradece a Kiva el apoyo brindado a través de Fundación Realidad ya que así sus metas serán cumplidas.
texts.en:
El Márquez is a group made up of 13 people. They live in La Comunidad Cerro del Márquez in the state of México and this is where they got their name. The members are: Damiana A. (snack sales), Teresita R. (fruits and vegetables), Placida Pérez (snack sales), Martha B. (clothing store), Josefina S. (blacksmith), Adriana A. (imitation jewelry), Guadalupe C. (fruits and vegetables), Oswaldo Q. (fruits and vegetables), Gonzalo S. (masonry), Eduardo S. (sound equipment), Isabel Reina López (catalog sales), Alejandra C. (sweets) and Modesta Crescencia B. (catalog sales). Alejandra C. is a member of the group. She is 31 years old, married and has three daughters that are currently in school (high school, elementary, and preschool). Ale used to work as a housekeeper, but the pay was very little. Realizing that her family's expenses were increasing day by day, she decided to find employment that would help her to better meet her financial obligations and at the same time allowed her to spend time with her family. This is how she started selling sweets, fried foods, soft drinks, soap, etc. Very early every day she sets up outside her house. The best sales are on the weekends and during the holiday season as this is when she sells the most soft drinks. She has been doing this for eight months and is very happy and wants to succeed. Ale has many plans, as much for her personal life as for her business, however the most important thing is that her daughters succeed at finishing school and to enlarge her sales area. She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy merchandise like soft drinks, soap, oil, sweets, etc., and in this way increase her clientele. With her earnings she will buy necessities for her daughters. El Márquez is grateful for Kiva's support through Fundación Realidad since this will help them to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, soft drinks, oil, fried foods and sweets

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena M. is a 61-year-old woman who supports her family through three business ventures: food vending, rice and fish vending and coco wine production. She lives in Purok 6 within Barangay Linao, a part of Kabankalan City in the province of Negros Occidental on the Visayas islands. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard selling food, rice and fish and producing coco wine, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12500 PHP. She earns this amount because of her hard work and her business acumen; at harvest time, she exchanges cooked food for raw rice from farmers.

Azucena is now borrowing 20000 PHP so that she can expand her food vending activities. This will be her fifteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 17500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Azucena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Urkupiña Group

texts.es:
Es grupo de personas muy trabajadoras viven en la zona de Villa Obrajes , la presidenta es la Sra. María se dedican a la venta de edredones y ropa lleva en esta actividad varis años, le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela y le hicieron varios pedidos, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería al por mayor como ser ropa de temporada de calor ya que estamos en primavera, esta muy agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad que le brinda. 
la Sras. Ayda y  Gloria   madres jóvenes se dedican a la venta de ropa  para niños y bebes en la zona de san Antonio  los dias de feria madrugan para rescatar mercadería  y poder vender en el transcurso  de la semana el préstamo será destinado al aumento de capital ya que con eso podrán obtener mas ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida de sus familias ese su mayor deseo de ellas.
texts.en:
This group of very hard working persons lives in the Villa Obrajes area.  The president is Mrs Maria, who makes a living selling quilts and clothing.  She has been in this activity for various years.  She is doing very well since she has many customers and has gotten various orders.  With the proceeds of the loan she will buy merchandise at wholesale, such as clothing for the upcoming hot season since it is spring here.  She is very grateful to the foundation for the opportunity that it gives her.
The ladies  Ayda and  Gloria are young mothers and make a living selling clothing for children and infants in the San Antonio area.  On market days they get merchandise very early and thus have it to sell during the week.  The loan will be for the increase in working capital which will allow them to make more income. Improving the quality of life of their families is their biggest dream.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 40-year-old married man with two children.  He sells stationery supplies to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and has managed to employ two people.  He also sells fish for extra income.   He was previously selling tailoring materials such as zippers and buttons.  He has requested for 50,000 KES to buy books and pens to sell.  He hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.  In five years, he wants to expand his business and employ more people.

loans.use: To buy books and pens

loans.name: Fight Poverty Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Fight for Poverty” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo near Freetown.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the left (first row) is Dauda K. who is the leader of this group. Dauda was born in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. The thirty-year-old is married and has three children.
 
Dauda sells charcoal, firewood, 'gari'  (quick cooking food made out of cassava roots), etc. He has had ten years of experience in business. With his share of the loan, Dauda will buy charcoal, firewood, 'gari', etc. in large quantity.

loans.use: Buy charcoal, firewood, 'gari', etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Helder Wilvindert

texts.es:
Helder de 41 años, tiene una tienda de víveres. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Trabajo en una empresa de chofer pero como necesitaba más ingresos hace tres años atas con el dinero que le dieron al liquidarlo de chofer compro algunos víveres y con la ayuda de su esposa pudo ubicar una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad trabaja con su esposa desde las 06h30am atendiendo la tienda. En su tienda vende arroz, aceites, enlatados etc. Con ayuda de sus hijos también puede atender la tienda ellos al llega del colegio le ayudan. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como granos, enlatados para tener más variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere cambiar su tienda en otro sector para tener más clientela.
texts.en:
Helder is 41 years old.  He has a grocery store.  He lives in a peri-urban area called Paraíso de la Flor which is located in a region which is characterized by its dirt roads and mountains.

He used to work for a company as a driver but he needed more income so three years ago he used the money they gave him when he lost his job as a driver to buy some basic foodstuffs and with the help of his wife he set up a small store in the front part of his house.  He currently works with his wife from 6.30am serving in his store.  In his store he sells rice, oil, canned goods, etc.  His children also help him to serve in the store when they get home from school.

He will use this loan to buy foodstuffs such as grains and canned goods so that he has more variety in the products he offers.  In the future, he would like to have his store in another district so that he can have more customers.

loans.use: To buy canned goods and grains

loans.name: Enriqueta Indelira

texts.es:
Enriqueta de 48 años, vende frutas en un vehículo. Vive con su esposo y tres hijos en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.

Empezó vendiendo frutas en un triciclo para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Como la demanda era mayor y si le generaba buenos ingresos decidió comprar un carro con los ahorros que tenia. Por esa buena decisión en la actualidad se estaciona con su camioneta y comienza a vender las frutas ubicándolas en el balde de la camioneta. Trabaja junto a su esposo desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar frutas y verduras para tener más variedad en las ventas. En el futuro quiere mejorar de construir su casa y comprar otro vehículo para vender a un mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is 48 years old and sells fruit from a vehicle. She lives with her husband and three children in a periurban area called Paraíso de la Flor, characterized for its unpaved roads and mountains.

She began selling fruit from a tricycle to help her husband with the family expenses. Since the demand was large and she was earning good income, she decided to purchase a car with the savings that she had. Because of this good decision, she currently parks her truck and begins to sells fruit from the back of the truck. She works with her husband every day from 8am to 5pm.

With the loan, she wants to buy fruits and vegetables to have more variety in her sales. In the future she wants to improve the construction of her house and purchase another vehicle to sell more.

loans.use: Fruits, vegetables

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 41-year-old married man, blessed with three children.  For a living, he does carpentry.  He has been engaged in the business for over eight years.  Besides carpentry, he farms so as to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his financial status.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene su negocio que es la venta de productos plásticos, esta no es la primera vez que se le brinda la oportunidad de obtener un financiamiento, por lo que se siente muy contenta. Es una mujer que ha pasado por muchas dificultades en su vida, pero ha sabido sobrellevarlas. Ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de tenedores, bolsas, vasos, platos, entre otros pues en esta temporada recibe mucha demanda de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en: Maria Mercedes has a business selling plastic products.  This is not the first time she’s had the opportunity to receive a loan, for which she is very grateful.  This is a woman who has gone through many difficulties in life, but has known how to overcome them.  Currently, she requests a loan to purchase forks, bags, glasses, plates, and other items, since during this season customer demand is high.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.ar:
وسام في عمر 39 سنة متزوج وله 6 اولاد يعمل في بيع وتصليح الالكترونيات له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله ويطور
فيه دائما فهو محب للتجدد والتطور ما يميزه هو الدقة والصدق في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة
الى شراء مسجلات مستعملة وتلفزيونات لإعادة بيعها زبائنه هم من محيطه وجيرانه يحب عائلته ويسعى جاهدا الى تأمين لقمة العيش
لهم فهم كل اهتمامه له خبرة واسعة في عمله
texts.en: Wissam is a 39-year-old husband and father of six who loves his family very much and always works hard to secure their daily bread. His 20 years of experience selling and repairing electronic devices has been marked by dynamism and thoroughness. Wissam’s customers are comprised of his neighbors and fellow community members. He is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase used televisions and tape recorders for resale.

loans.use: To purchase used televisions and tape recorders for resale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Goals are nothing unless one makes the effort to meet them. Isabel D., 49, knows this, and gives her best to accomplish the goals she has set for her and her family. 

She is married to Oscar D., 59, who is a cook for their own food vending business. They have six children, with one attending college now. Isabel’s family resides in Ascoville, Malaria, Caloocan City.

Isabel currently runs a sari-sari (variety) store that caters to needs that are more immediate than the nearest grocery in the community. Isabel has operated her variety store from home for years now, along with her food vending business. With the help of her husband as cook, they cook and sell viand, delicacies to accompany rice, which are usually present in Filipino homes every meal time. 

Serving their community with these businesses, they gained regular customers who keep her businesses alive. She employs no one and earns an estimated income of PHP 6,000 a month.

To help Isabel continue operation of her businesses, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use this to buy additional stock for her store and more raw ingredients like meats, vegetables and sacks of rice for her food vending business. She will see to it that her store will not lack any valuable thing that her customers need, so that they will make her their number one sari-sari store in the community.

Isabel has learned the value of improving one’s business, and thus works to innovate hers. She does not emphasize any problem she encounters but rather focuses on its solution. Goals cannot be met just by identifying the problem, but by acting on them. The most important goal she has in mind is to support her children until their college graduation, with which she will feel most fulfilled.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her variety store and raw ingredients needed for her food vending business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Given a green thumb, Josefina D. V., 57, aims to make best use of her skills and be a blessing to her family and community. Josefina did not manage to reach high school; nevertheless, the dedication she gave to agriculture yielded a personal success which she can be proud of. Josefina is married to Maximo, a farmer, and they have one child, who now works and has a family. 

Josefina has a farm where she grows ornamental plants and fruits like bananas and pineapples. This farm is located near their house, so Josefina can easily manage it. Josefina has been running this business for around ten years now, and she sees that more years of growth will be added to her business. Monthly, Josefina earns around Php 11,500.

To help her continue operation of her ornamental farm, she would like to request for a Php20,000 loan. She does so to further help her grow her farm. She intends to use the loan money to buy fertilizers, a crop growth regulator called ethrel, and plastic and wire for the physical maintenance of the farm. She believes that the loan will truly benefit her business, and eventually her family and community.

Frequent typhoons that hit the country also affected Josefina's farm. But despite these storms in her life, she is still determined to see her farm yield many fruits and become more profitable in the years to come. Just as she delights in seeing her plants and crops grow, she will be ever delighted to see her grandchildren grow in all aspects of their lives and become good members of society.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of agricultural supplies for her farm

loans.name: Benno Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BENNO est créé depuis 2008. Il a 6 cycles d'existence. Il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont toutes du même quartier. On remarque dans le groupe une bonne solidarité et une bonne cohésion de groupe. Elle s'activent toutes dans des activités génératrices de revenus. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de ARTILLERIE-NOB-SA-JËKËR

Madame FATOU S. (debout tout à fait à droite de la photo en écharpe bleue) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa nièce.

Elle développe une activité de petit commerce : elle vend des chaussures, des vêtements et de l'huile d'arachide.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement afin de mieux accroitre sa production

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la nourriture et de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales
texts.en:
The Benno solidarity group was set up in 2008 and has been through six loan cycles. It is made up of 16 ladies who are all from the same neighborhood. There is a noticeably good solidarity and cohesion within the group. The ladies all have income-generating activities and the group is part of the Banc Villageois in Artillerie-Nob-Sa-Jëkër.

Mrs. Fatou S. (standing on the far right of the photo and wearing a blue scarf) is in charge of the group. She is 43 years old, married and mother to four children. She is also responsible for her niece.

She is building up a small business, selling shoes, clothes and peanut oil. Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her business by increasing her stock in order to grow her production. Her aim is to contribute to food costs and help her husband out with the various family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, clothes and peanuts (to make into peanut oil)

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en:
Nana Ekua K. operates a device to extract palm oil in Jukwa which is near Abura in Cape Coast. Nana buys baskets of palm fruits and with the help of the device you can see in the picture she extracts the oil which then is sold by street vendors. 

Nana sees the potential of her business growing if she can only purchase larger quantities of palm fruits. This is the reason why she applied for a loan. She will use the money to buy the needed palm fruits to satisfy the needs of more customers. 

Nana is divorced and is taking care of three children. Most of the money is used to feed her children and send them to school. The little which is left will be reinvested to keep her business running.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of palm fruits.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline R. is from the village of San Ramon. She is 41 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Jacqueline owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Jacqueline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacqueline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jacqueline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 35 years old and married with 3 children between the ages 3 and 8 years old. Jean Marie Vianney earns a living by sewing different styles of clothes. This is his 10th successful year in this business. His business is well-organized. He employs three people to help him.

Jean Marie Vianney needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more fabric for sewing. By expanding his business and adding more equipment and workers, Jean Marie Vianney hopes to earn more profits, and he will save for his future. Thus, he will create another job for the people in his community.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric for sewing

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence G. is 41 years old and single. She is currently in the business of selling food. She intends to use use her loan to stock more food for resale. Her future goal is to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to stock more food for resale.

loans.name: Leonardo S

texts.en:
Leonardo S N. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 60 years old. Leonardo is married and has an adult child. 

To make a living, Leonardo owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Leonardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Leonardo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to  purchase bagoong (fish paste), rice and soft drinks for resale. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Leonardo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bagoong, rice and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con integrantes del comité San Cayetano de Conavi Aregua, el cual se dividió formándose dos grupos, de esta forma se inició el comité Kuña Guapa del barrio Caacupemi de Conavi San Cayetano.
Actualmente se encuentra en el 6° ciclo del programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está integrado por 19 señoras quienes se dedican a diversas actividades, sobre la base de la cooperación mutua, compañerismo y solidaridad con cada una de las integrantes.
La Sra. Gloria tiene 43 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Nestor quien es docente, tienen 3 hijos. 
Es la tesorera del grupo y en esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para invertir en su taller de costura comprando insumos para la elaboracion de sus prendas.
texts.en:
The present committee was formed with members from the San Cayetano de Conavi Aregua committee which split into two groups.  This is how the Kuña Guapa committee from Conavi San Cayetano’s Caacupemi neighborhood came to be.

It is currently in its 6th cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women Committee and is made up of 19 members who are in a variety of activities based on mutual support, companionship and solidarity among each other.

Gloria, 43, is married to Nestor, who is a Teacher, and they have three children. She is group Treasurer and on this occasion is asking for a loan to invest in her dressmaking workshop buying supplies needed to make her articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Sâr

texts.en: From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Sâr is 30 years old and married. She was married years ago and she has two single children who still study in the public school. She and her husband are currently recycling sellers. They buy used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the items in bulk to other countries. The used goods they deal in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Sâr would like to request a loan to pay for construction costs.

loans.use: to pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  E Group

texts.fr:
FOTEMOGOBAN E est un regroupement de 10 femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. EIles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles  à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne font la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide  comme la majorité des femmes du village. 
BARAKISSA, la présidente du groupe, debout au milieu avec une écharpe,  compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de désherbage.
Après les récoltes sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforment en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
FOTEMOGOBAN E est un regroupement de 10 femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. EIles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles  à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne font la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide  comme la majorité des femmes du village. 
BARAKISSA, la présidente du groupe, debout au milieu avec une écharpe,  compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de désherbage.
Après les récoltes sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforment en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira was born in 1974 and lives in Yerevan with her husband and 5-year-old son. She is an accountant and has a Bachelor's degree in economics. After university Naira worked as an accountant in different organizations.

Three years ago Naira with her husband set up their own bakery in rented place. They produce various sorts of bread and "lavash" (typical Armenian  flat unleavened wheat bread). Naira’s parents-in-law help with the  business and her husband distributes their production to city food shops. 

Thanks to the profit from their business, Naira and her family bought the necessary furniture for their house and also they are able to support Naira’s and her parents-in-law families. 

Naira is asking for a $ 2,000 loan to buy flour supplies, oil, yeast, etc. for her bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour supplies, oil, yeast, etc. for her bakery.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 27-year-old businessman; he is married to Ruth who is a housewife. They are blessed with one child aged five years old. Samuel has been in the business of baking cakes for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 12,000 which he uses to support his family members.

He is a new client and is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. 

Samuel will use the loan to boost his baking business by buying a motorbike for transporting cakes to his customers. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. His hope is to open a mini supermarket.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting cakes

loans.name: Americo

texts.en: Americo is 76 years old and married with three children. He is retired and enjoys spending more time with his family. He is asking for a loan to make improvements to his house. Specifically, he wants to add to the office he has in his house. He plans to purchase paint, wood panels, and other materials he may need to renovate his office. Americo is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint, wood panels, and other supplies to renovate the office in his house

loans.name: Gulbika

texts.ru: Gulbika zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Yey 57 let. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenenc iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i dochkoy. Ona uje 14 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov, seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Gulbika is married with three children.  She is 57 years old.  She  is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her husband and daughter.  She has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for fourteen years.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle to increase her milk production.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Marichi

texts.en:
Marichi is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Marichi has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy fish to sell.

Marichi has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Marichi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Dufashanye Group

texts.fr:
Marie est une commerçante âgée de 42ans qui habite  la localité de Nyamugari au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de tomates, petit pois et du poisson sec appelé « ndagala »depuis 22ans. Elle était marchande ambulante de fruits avant de commencer le présent commerce. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée  a Eric et ont ensemble 8 enfants dont 5 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 150,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de tomates,petit pois et poisson sec « ndagala » à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« DUFASHANYE».
texts.en:
Marie, 42,  is a small-scale retailer who lives in Nyamugari in the center of the country in the province of Gitega. She has been selling tomatoes, green peas, and dried fish called "ndagala" for 22 years.  She was a street vendor selling fruit before beginning her current business. She did not go to school. She is married to Eric and they have eight children, of whom five are in primary school. 

The Kiva loan of 150,000 Burundi francs that she will receive will allow her to increase her working capital so as to buy larger quantities of tomatoes, peas, and dried fish for resale so that she can make a good profit. 

She is a member of the community group called "DUFASHANYE".

loans.use: to increase her working capital to buy large quantities of tomatoes, peas, and dried fish  called "ndagala" for resale.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a forty-six-year-old single mother of five children, renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for seventeen years. She started with 130,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is limited funds to meet the different demands of her customers and her vision is to have a boutique, educate her children plus having her own house. Resty needs the loan facility to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en: Virginiah is married and blessed with four children. For the last 2 years, she has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. She also does a mobile phone-money-transfer business to boost her income. In the next 5 years, Virginiah wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to buy animal feed. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Shulamita

texts.en:
Shulamita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Shulamita has a bake shop that sells breads, cakes & pastries. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries. 
Shulamita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Shulamita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries

loans.name: Vache

texts.en:
Vache is 30 years old. He lives with his wife, 2 sons and parents in Vanadzor city. For about 6 years he has produced wooden doors and windows, hangers, skirting boards, wooden angles and many other accessories which are made from wood. Vache rents a workshop near his house and runs his production work there.

His wooden products are sold in different furniture and building materials stores in Vanadzor and Gyumri cities. Vache also has a lot of individual orders. Most of them are his old clients who prefer to buy his hand made wooden accessories.   

Vache needs a 600,000 AMD loan to buy wood raw materials and a more powerful motor (engine) for his tool (machine) which will facilitate and accelerate his production.

loans.use: To buy wood raw materials and a motor (engine).

loans.name: Iwan

texts.en:
Iwan is 25 years old and has been an employee at a printing company since 2002.  The job has provided enough income to live day to day since he was 18.  He was even able to buy a motorbike on credit.  Additionally, it has enabled him to support his parents.  However, he has not been able to have any savings from it and now he wants to get married.  He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to pay for the wedding expenses.  

Someday he hopes to have enough money to open his own printing business rather than continue to be an employee.  He would also like to help his parents open a grocery store in the future so they can have their own income.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años, y tiene 02 hijas D. 24y 14 años, y un hijo D. 21años, solo la adolescente está a su cargo y cursa el 3 año D. nivel secundario.A partir D. los 16 años empezó a trabajar con la venta D. chupetes, golosinas y kekes en las afueras D. su casa, esto le permitió contar con independencia económica, desD. entonces, la idea D. negocio fue su iniciativa propia, al lado D. su esposo decidieron incursionar en el negocio D. la venta D. lubricantes y aditivos para vehículos ya su esposo es mecánico, también se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza. Inicia su negocio con un préstamo D. 2,000.00 nuevos soles.Con este préstamo D. S/.500.00, comprará  insumos como repuestos, lubricantes, aditivos.
Carmen Rosa,es una mujer luchadora  y emprendedora,  su sueño es ampliar su negocio, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Amor y Paz” (Love and Peace) which is located in the District and Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martín. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children: two daughters (ages 24 and 14) and a son (age 21). Her teenage daughter is still under her care and in her third year of high school.

Sixteen years ago, Carmen started working by selling lollipops, candy, and cupcakes outsiD. of her home. This allowed her to be financially independent. Since then, she took the initiative of starting her own business. Carmen and her husband decided to open a business selling vehicle lubricants and additives since he already works as a mechanic. In addition, Carmen sells beauty products. She started this business with a loan of 2000 PEN.

Carmen Rosa is currently requesting a loan of 500 PEN in order to buy supplies such as spare parts, lubricants, and additives. She is a determined and enterprising woman. Her dream is to expand her business.

Carmen is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing opportunities to women like her so that they can make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, lubricants, and additives.

loans.name: Socorro Veronica

texts.es:
Socorro es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene  39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior incompleto.

Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.

Ahora solicitará  un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles,  préstamo que invertirá en la compra de cuatro faros de prendas de vestir (chompas juveniles), lo vende en la ciudad de Cusco y entrega pedidos.

Su sueño de la señora es poner una tienda-boutique.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el compañerismo, la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Socorro is a member of the “Ahorro es Progreso”  communal bank, located in the district and province of Puno, in Puno department. She is 39, in a common-law relationship, and has three children.

She has an incomplete secondary school education.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business of selling clothing. Now she will apply for a new loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, to buy four bundles of clothing (children's sweaters). She sells her merchandise in the city of Cusco, and fills orders. 

Her dream is to set up a store/boutique.  What she likes best about the communal bank is the camaraderie, the easy terms for loans, and being on time.

loans.use: To buy four bundles of clothing (children's sweaters).

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela cuenta con 29 años de edad y está casada con el señor Juan López con quien tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo Roberto y azucena estudian, están cursando tercer año de primaria y tercer año de preescolar, ya que el más pequeño apenas tiene 2 años, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos enteros y por pieza desde hace 1 año.
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quería independizarse un poco y ganar su propio dinero, también para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos, también para contar con una mejor solvencia económica y calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas pollos y alimento para criarlos.
Doña  Ángela tiene una meta es la de construir un local, para poner su pollería, ya que así podrá tenerlo muy bien surtido y contar con una mejor producción y atención a su clientes, ya que así mejorara e incrementara aun mas sus ganancias, para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y puedan tener una muy buena carrera profesional.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad por el gran apoyo que les están aportando, puesto que con esa ayuda va a mejorar su negocio y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ángela is 29 years old. She is married to Juan López and they have three children. Roberto and azucena are in school. One is in the third year of primary school and the other is in the third year of preschool. The youngest one is two years old.  Ángela has sold whole chickens and chicken parts for one year.
She says that she decided to invest in this business because she would like gain some independence and earn her own money. She also started this to help her husband with the household expenses and to help her children. The business also helps her to have greater economic solvency and quality of life. The loan she received was invested in the purchase of more chickens and food for raising the chickens. 
Ángela has a goal of building a place for her poultry store since she has a good selection and she counts on having a larger production and better customer service. This will improve and increase her earnings in order to secure the future of her children and allow them to have good professional careers. 
She gives thanks to the fundación realidad for the great support that the organization provides. With this help, she will improve her business and the lives of her family members.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of more chickens and food for the chickens.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglass is a resident and a farmer in Kitale Western Kenya. He is married with six children all of whom are of school going ages. He has been in farming for six years with the farm currently producing maize and milk for the local market.

Douglass has requested a second loan of 50,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo, with the first one of being 25,000 KES. He says the loan will help him venture into his poultry farming business. He is optimistic that he will be able to service the loan with his farming returns due to high demand for poultry products in the area. He adds that the income will also help him boost his dairy farming and enable him to buy a motorcycle for taking supplies to the market.   

He mentions that diseases are the major impediment for farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Gema Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gema, ella tiene  21 años de edad, está casada y aun no tienen  hijos. Su esposo es comerciante. Ella estudia Educación Infantil en la Universidad.

Ella realiza el crédito para su esposo, el tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad el cual es en sociedad con una hermana, venden camisas, corbatas, cinturones y varios artículos de hombres, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, además el también en su carro realiza transporte escolar, la mercadería se la envían directamente de fabrica. Lleva en este negocio por más de 5 años y les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar todo tipo de ropa de hombre. Lleva 3 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio departamento ya que donde viven es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the "Renacer" communal bank meet very two weeks in the El Florón housing development in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees. 

This is where we met Gema. She is 21, married, and they have no children yet. Her husband is a small business owner. She studies Early Childhood Education at the University.

She is taking out the loan for her husband. He has a shop in the center of the city, in partnership with a sister. They sell shirts, ties, belts, and various articles of men's clothing. They work every day from 8:00am to 6:00pm. In addition, he uses his car to transport schoolchildren.

They send him the merchandise directly from the factory. He has been in this business for more than five years, and it has gone very well for them. He is going to use this loan to buy all kinds of men's clothing.  

She has been in the communal bank for three years, and likes it, because the interest rates are very low. 

Her dream is to have her own apartment, since they are renting the place where they live.

loans.use: To buy men's clothing.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí de 27 años de edad, convive con Fredy con quien tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años. Esta familia vive en un hogar propio en la comunidad nativa San Román Bajo en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Noemí es una mujer que trabaja sin descanso. Su anhelo de superación por el bienestar de su familia es su motor principal. 
Es así que, en su 3 parcelas de terrenos de cultivo siembra café, maíz y piña. Una vez cosechado traslada sus productos hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki ó Santa Ana, ahí vende los frutos de sus cosechas a compradores que se llevan en grandes cantidades. 
En el trabajo recibe la ayuda de Fredy quien además de cuidar su hogar, destina parte de su tiempo a las labores del campo. Noemí anhela comprarse más terrenos para aumentar su producción. Y de esa manera piensa brindarles a sus hijos la educación y una calidad de vida adecuada. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Noemi obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “La Bella Durmiente”, del que se muestra esperanzada. Con el dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos para esparcirlos en su café, maíz y piña.
texts.en:
Noemí, age 27, lives with Fredy, with whom she has 2 children ages 6 and 3. The family lives in their own house in their hometown of San Román Bajo, in the district of Perené of the Chanchamayo province. Noemí is a woman who works nonstop. Her main motivation is her family's well-being and her wish to see them get ahead. 
In her 3 plots of land, she cultivates coffee beans, corn, and pineapples. Once harvested, she transports her produce to the either the city of Pichanaki or the city of Santa Ana, where she sells her produce to buyers who purchase in bulk. At work, she gets help from Fredy, who, besides taking care of the household, also sets aside some of his time to work in the fields. Noemí hopes to purchase more plots of land in order to increase production, which is how she plans to provide her children with an education and an adequate quality of life. This will be her first loan from MFP, and she feels excited about it. She is now a member of the "La Bella Durmiente" (Sleeping Beauty) communal bank, and she feels hopeful. With this loan, she will purchase sacks of organic fertilizer to use on her coffee bean, corn, and pineapple crops.

loans.use: to purchase sack of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 53 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has six children.

To earn a living, Clarita has a piggery. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Clarita has requested a loan of PHP 22,000 to purchase feed for the pigs and to buy piglets to raise and then sell.

Clarita has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Clarita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the pigs and to buy piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza pasa al cuarto ciclo, todas las señoras se dedican a la cría de animales de corral, como ser gallinas y cerdos también venden huevos y quesos. Todas ellas se unieron con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio del trabajo unido de ellas salir adelante y luchar por sus familias.
Luisa también cría animales y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados y granos para sus animales y de esa forma poder seguir con lo que viene haciendo hasta hoy.
Luisa está muy esperanzada en que con su comité podrán crecer y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
texts.en:
La Esperanza (Hope) is a Committee currently working its fourth cycle. All the members engage in breeding farmyard animals such as chickens and pigs, selling eggs and cheeses as well. They all joined forces to help each other out and to get ahead and fight for their families by working together.
Luisa engages in animal breeding, and she is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and grains for her animals, in order to keep on engaging in her activity.
Luisa deeply hopes that the members of her Committee will succeed in progressing and in helping each other out

loans.use: To buy animal feed and grains.

loans.name: Martha Yicenia

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 32  años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de 17, 11, 10 y 1 años, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es vaquero.
