Doña Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ayudarle  a su marido a salir adelante ya que el no gana mucho con su labor de vaquero, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, compra chanchos, pollos o chivos cuando están pequeños, los mantiene por un tiempo adecuado y luego los vende a los comerciantes que llegan hasta este lugar a comprar estos animalitos para llevarlos a o tras ciudades donde venden la carne en los distintos mercados.
Este crédito es para comprar dos chanchos y alimento para chanchos y pollos.  Lleva 10 ciclos en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener salud y darle a su pequeña lo mejor.
texts.en:
The Credit Group San Pedro De Pueble meets once a fortnight in the parish of Pueblo Nuevo in Cantón Santa Ana, a place where people are honest and work in the countryside and with cattle. It has beautiful countryside and friendly people.

Here lives Martha who is 32 years old, has a common law partner and together they have five children aged 17, 11, 10 and one years old. The three eldest study in college and at school. Her husband is a herdsman.

Martha is a very hardworking woman who likes to help her husband get ahead, as he does not earn a lot in his job as a herdsman. She earns a living raising animals, she buys pigs, chickens or goats when they are small, keeps them for a sufficient amount of time and then sells them to traders who come to where she lives to take them to other cities where they sell the meat in various markets.

This loan is to buy two pigs and food for pigs and chickens. She has participated in ten loan cycles and she likes the help the loans provide. Her dreams are to have her health and give her small daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and food for pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Siprin's Group

texts.en:
In Ondati village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Siprin has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Siprin is a friendly member of the community with four children. Siprin lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, dirt floor, and iron roof.

Ondati village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Ondati borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Siprin’s family, and the 13 other households using the local water source, need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Siprin has volunteered to be the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Siprin volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community to treat water, hence preventing water borne diseases. Pamela is another volunteer promoter from the surrounding community who is part of this group loan.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Siprin’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For boosting up the Tailoring business.

loans.name: Gardashali

texts.en:
This 46-year old man has 5 years of experience as a carpenter. He lives in Yenikand village in the  Salyan region. He is married and  has 2 children.
He has steady clients who order products every day.
This business creates income enough to cover family expenses.
Gardashali has a lot of orders but he does not have enough capital to satisfy his clientele.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy wood and another planing machine in order to meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy a planing machine

loans.name: Taulagia

texts.en: Taulagia is married and has ten children.  She and her husband have struggled to support this large family.  Since she joined the SPBD program several years ago and gained access to micro-loan facilities, things have been better.  She has been able to borrow to invest in her family’s plantation, where they raise taro, taamu, yams and bananas.  With another loan she was able to start a taxi business.  Between the plantation and the taxi business, she can provide the basic necessities for her large family.  Taulagia continues to have dreams of a better life and is willing to work hard to achieve them.  She has repaid all of her previous loans in full, and now is applying for an additional loan to buy a second-hand pick-up truck that she can use to deliver her plantation goods to the local market.

loans.use: Buy pickup truck and tools

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria Concepcion is a hard working woman who labors every day to progress. She is married with three children, who are 14, 9 and 7 years old. Her husband has a small stand where he sells corn, but the income is not stable, and sometimes it is very low. The family was able to purchase some land where they could build their own house, and the payments that they are making have reduced their income even further. Because of that, Maria began selling cosmetics from catalogs 7 years ago. Maria’s great desire to offer the best to her family and to get ahead have motivated Maria to work hard.

Maria is getting more clients every day, and she is asking for a $200 loan which she will use to purchase merchandise to meet the demand. She agrees to pay back the loan in just 3 months. You can be an important part of in the life of Maria and her family by contributing to the growth of her business. They send their thanks.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Concepción es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza día a día por salir adelante, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 9 y 14 años de edad y el más pequeño de sólo 7 meses de edad. Su esposo tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende elotes, el ingreso que obtiene no es estable y en ocasiones es muy bajo, se les presentó la oportunidad de adquirir un terreno para construir su propia casa y los pagos reducían aun más los ingresos, por esta razón Maria comenzó sus ventas de cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 7 años. Los deseos de darle lo mejor a su familia y de poder salir adelante han motivado a Maria a trabajar mucho.

Sus clientes cada vez son mayores y para cubrir su demanda Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar este préstamo en solo 3 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de Maria y su familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. José D. and his family run an autmobile repair and painting shop. His son and another worker help him run the business. He has had this business for five years. They have bought a lot next to his house where they park the cars they are working on, so that he can run his business more effciciently.

Purpose of the Loan

He would use the loan to buy raw materials and to pour a cement floor over the earthen floor of his workshop.

About the Applicant

José is 57. He has five children, two of whom attend school. His wife sells soft drinks to help meet household expenses. His goal is to update his workshop with the latest technology.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Descripción del Negocio

Don José y su familia tienen un taller de pintada y enderezada de vehículos, a el le ayudan en el trabajo un hijo y un obrero, este negocio lo tienen hace cinco años, ellos han comprado un terreno al lado de su casa donde ubican a los vehículos para realizar mejor su trabajo

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas materia prima y para arreglar el piso de su taller pues aun lo tiene solo de tierra y desea hacerlo de concreto

Información Personal

El tiene 57 años y cinco hijo de los cuales dos estudian su esposa vende bebidas gaseosas para ayudar en el hogar, sus meta es de mejorar su taller con tecnología de punta

loans.use: To install a cement floor in his shop

loans.name: Leitioa

texts.en: Leitioa is a 47 year old mother. She is married with one, lovely child. In the past, Leitioa used to work for one of expensive hotels in her country. When her mother passed away last year, she resigned from her job to care for her sick father. She had many struggles, especially with her financial situation. After her father passed, she left working on her family’s plantation because she then had no one to look after, but having no one to rely on, she has decided to turn her plantation once again. Her first loan she spent on the plantation, and with her second loan she has more plans for her growing plantation. Her husband is looking after, and they are one of the most happy couples in their area. Leitioa's is also getting money at least twice a week from selling her taros.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Soloman

texts.en:
Soloman has a retail store in which the largest part of his business is the selling of dry staples. He mostly sells rice, flour, sugar, salt. He sells Pakistani rice and Ugandan Rice. The flour is cassava flour and maize flour.  He also sells millet and sorghum. He also carries a few canned and boxed items. 
Soloman is married, 34 years old, and has four children. He also cares for two orphans. Almost all persons in shantytown districts care for orphans. These are usually children of deceased brothers or sisters. AID’s and malaria are the largest contributors to the deaths of young adults. Because of the limited amount of resources people have, often the orphaned children they care for cannot attend the schools that their own children attend. However, hey are equally loved, as this is generally seen as life in the community, not a burden.
Soloman has had his business for three years. He is requesting a loan of $475 so he can keep his supply of dry staples replenished, satisfy his customers and hopefully expand his business. This will help him care for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more 25-50kg sacks of flour, rice, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru:
J. Gulnoza has been in the business of selling woolen yarns and socks for 10 years. She is married and has 3 children. The whole family lives together with their mother-in-law. After several unsuccessful attempts to find a stable well paying job, her husband decided to breed sheep, whose wool Gulnoza is selling and using in socks knitting. Her mother-in-law has taught her to do that and now this is their main source of income. Her daughters also knit socks and help their mother. Her husband and son take care of wool processing, cleaning, and drying. This business involves their whole family.

Gulnoza wanted to use the loan from Kiva to purchase a different kind of wool - angorka, so she could mix it when knitting socks. That way, she will be able to raise the prices of her goods and obtain higher earnings. These winter months are the best season for sales of warm wool socks. She really hopes for your support.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Джураева Гулноза занимается продажей пряжи и шерстенных носков на протяжении 10 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей, они живут вместе со свекровью. Муж после неудачных поисков постоянной хорошо- оплачиваемой работы решил заняться разведением овец, шерсть которых Гулноза продает, а так же вяжет из них теплые шерстяные носки. Этому научила её свекровь и теперь это их основной источник доходов. Её дочери тоже вяжут носки и помогают маме. Обработку, чистку и сушку шерсти производят муж и сын. Можно отметить, что это их семейный бизнес. В КИВА программе Гулноза захотела участвовать с целью получения займа на покупку другой шерсти- ангорка, для дальнейшего присоединения её при вязании носков. Она сможет, повысит цену на продаваемую продукцию и получит больше прибыли. Эти зимние месяцы сезон продаж теплых шерстяных носков. Она очень надеется на вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalia belongs to the local bank Las Mercedes. She works selling typical food at the weekly markets that occur on Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday in the district and province of Carhuaz, in the Ancash department. With a loan in the amount of 1,000 Peruvian sols, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy cooking oil, 1 bag of potatoes, 1 bag of salt, and smaller quantities of other ingredients. She will also buy 10 table benches and a dozen avocado trees. Rosalia is 38 years old, a widow, and mother of 3. She started this business when her husband died in order to provide her children an education and give them a good start in life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosalía pertenece al banco comunal Las Mercedes. Se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas en la feria semanal que se dan los días miércoles, viernes y domingos en el distrito y provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un balde de aceite, 1 saco de papa, 1 saco de sal y otros ingredientes en poca cantidad , también comprará 10 bancas para mesa y 1 docena de paltos. Rosalía tiene 38 años de edad, es viuda y tienen 3 hijos. Inició este negocio cuando murió su esposo con la finalidad de educar y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy cooking supplies and other items (benches)

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.en:
Shely P. is an energetic and lively 28 year old woman with 7 kids (ages 9, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, and 8 months.) She is happily married and loves her kids more than anything else in the world. When she is not working she enjoys reading her Bible. With her first loan funded by Kiva, she was able to begin running her own business selling clothing to other people in her community. With this next loan she hopes to expand her business. Her goal is to have a boutique in Puerto Plata that sells nice clothes and shoes. She would also like to expand her home because there are nine people and not much room!

This Bank of Hope has been part of Esperanza’s microfinance program for over a year. Three of the four groups are applying for their second loan and one group is applying for the first time. The group of twenty women is very diverse: some have come over to the DR with their families from Haiti, and others were born and raised here. For these five women, this is an opportunity they have only dreamed of. Because it actually costs money in the Dominican Republic to even save money – its unfathomable for these women to think that they would be offered a loan from someone besides a greedy loan shark, much less an organization that anticipates their personal growth and success.

On behalf of Esperanza, Shely, and the entire group we would like express our gratitude for your generosity and support!

loans.use: to purchase new clothing and shoes

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. M., 22-year-old, is married and has e a one-year-old son. Her husband is a sales assistant. They live in Haileah. Mrs. M. has been selling used clothing for five years now, and she hopes to have her own store and expand her business.She is asking for a loan in order to buy used clothing in bulk to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Tiene 22 años de edad, habita en Hialeah. Es casada. Su esposo es auxiliar de ventas. Tienen un pequeño de un año de edad. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, aspira tener una tienda y ampliar su negocio. Solicita un préstamos para comprar una paca de ropa de usada para surtir mejor su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a used clothing

loans.name: Zary

texts.es:
Mrs. Zary A. P. is a member of the “Dynamic Women” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region of the Picota province, district of Picota. She works selling groceries, sweets, and soft drinks from her own home located at 386 Jr. Arica, where people from her neighborhood come daily to purchase her products. She decided to start her business with her sister’s help, with the goal of being able to control her own finances and increase the standard of living for her household, as she has a daughter who is a student. With the loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid over 6 months, she will purchase essential products such as: sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, oil, preserves, packets of noodles, detergents, and toilet paper, among other things, and in this way she will be able to meet the needs of her customers. Zary is 27 years old and her daughter is still dependent on her. Her goal for the future is to increase her sales and start another business selling soft drinks wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Zary A. P., es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Dinamicas ”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, en su propia casa ubicado Jr. Arica Nº 386, donde acuden diariamente a comprar los moradores del barrio. Decidió iniciar su negocio con el apoyo de su hermana con la finalidad de manejar sus propios ingresos y aumentar su nivel económico para su hogar, ya que tiene una hija que esta estudiando. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, conservas, paquetes de fideos, detergentes y papel higiénico entre otros y así poder llegar a satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 27 años y una niña que todavía depende de ella, su meta en el futuro es ampliar sus ventas y poner otro negocio de bebidas gaseosas al por mayor.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila, wife of Mr. Y., has been a resident of  the city of Kasur for the last 23 years. She is the mother of five children: one daughter and four sons. Her daughter is married; her eldest son received an education up until 7th grade and now drives a tractor; her younger son works in a factory; and her youngest son is enrolled in school. Jamila is a housewife, while her husband is a farmer, and she looks after the land in the absence of her husband. They have two buffalos that produce milk which is sold door to door by her employees. She would like to apply for a loan to buy anoter buffalo to expand her milk business.

loans.use: To expand the milk business

loans.name: Fidelia's Group

texts.es: Mi nombre es Fidelia A. F. soy comerciante, tengo 45 años de edad, tengo 15 años de vivir en esta comunidad, tengo 2 hijos que actualmente estan en la escuela, tengo una pequeña pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitacion, aqui vendo todo tipo de productos de consumo popular tambien desde hace 10 años me dedico a la elaboracion y venta  de pan de levadura, tengo una ventaja la cual es que mi negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico porque circulan muchas personas que vienen de otras comunidades y aldeas vecinas, actualmente estoy solicitando apoyo monetario para poder surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes mayor y mejor variedad de productos

loans.use: compra de mercaderia como ser pan, mantequilla, manteca, aceites, arroz, azucar, leche, harina de maiz y de trigo, frijoles, queso, embutidos, sal, agua.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru:
Rustamjon S. lives in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan. He is 50 years old and is married with 5 children. He has a university degree in construction engineering. For the past ten years he has been working in animal husbandry. He buys young bull calves and feeds them for about 40-45 days before selling them at a profit at the market. This work helps him provide for his big family. At present Rustamjon would like to buy another bull calf. Therefore he would like to obtain a loan for three months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Шарипов Рустамджон - житель района Рудаки. Возраст 50 лет, женат , имеет 5 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности инженер-строитель.Клиент занимается животноводством более 10 лет. Он покупает на рынке молодых бычков и откармливает их 40-45 дней и прдает на рынке по выгодной ему цене. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ему содержать его большую семью. В данный момент клиент хочет купить еще одного бычка для откормки.Для этого он берет кредит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf

loans.name: Juma Sadik's Songambele Ukonga Group

texts.en:
Juma, age 36, is married with four children ages 9, 7, 4 and 2 weeks. He owns a general store where he sells products such as food and cosmetics. He opened the store six years ago and works daily from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. With his store, he is able to earn a monthly profit of about $430.

In the past, Juma has taken out four loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to build a home for his children and buy more items to sell to his customers. He has paid the loans back successfully, and now hopes for a new loan to increase the size of his shop. He will share this loan with the members of group, which has 17 people in it. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Juma is standing in the last row, second from the right.

loans.use: To increase the size of his shop

loans.name: Nancy Felicia

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Nancy es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Nancy tiene su casa en el barrio de Santa Elena, Nanci junto a su esposo venden artículos diversos, dependiendo de la demanda como guantes, sombreros, frutas, lentes, pescado y entre otros productos novedosos, actividad que realizan caminando en toda la ciudad de Ayacucho, para lo cual cuentan con un triciclo y en algunas oportunidades viajan a los distintos pueblos de la región.

Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sombreros y lentes. Nancy sueña con comprar un terreno en el centro de la ciudad para construir un local y abrir una tienda estable y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Bank Communal Legión. Nancy is a partner, is 31 years old, and has 3 children, Nancy has a house in the neighborhood of Santa Elena. Nancy and her husband sell various items, depending on demand, such as gloves, hats, fruit, glasses, and fish among other original products. They walk across the city of Ayacucho and occasionally use their tricycle to travel to various cities in the region Nancy needs a loan of $525, which she will invest in the purchase of hats and glasses. Nancy dreams of purchasing land in the center of the city to build and open a stable shop and also that her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of hats and glasses

loans.name: Orfa

texts.es: Orfa tiene 41 años, es madre D. 5 hijos, D. los cuales 3 ya son independientes y 2 estudian. Ella cuenta con el apoyo incondicional D. su esposo Néstor quien es pescador. Madre trabajadora que demuestra su interés por salir adelante con el arte textil, confecciona todo tipo D. prendas, para ella no existe nada imposible. Compra telas estampadas y confecciona lo último en moda, lleva a venD. al ropa por diferentes lugares, dejándola a crédito o al contado. Orfa quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio textil, así como también quiere comprarse una máquina D. coser, porque la que tiene se encuentra en mal estado, sin embargo para realizar este sueño, le hace falta un préstamo, el cual hará realidad sus deseos.
texts.en:
Orfa, 41, is the mother of 5 children, of whom 3 are already on their own, 2 in school. She depends on the unconditional support of her husband Nestor, who is a fisherman. A hard-working mother who demonstrates her desire to get ahead in textile art, she creates all sorts of garments, nothing is impossible to her. She buys printed fabrics and creates up-to-the-minute fashions. She takes the clothing to different places to be sold, either for cash or leaving it on credit. Orfa wants to keep growing her textile business, so she wants to purchase a sewing machine, because the one she has now is in poor condition. Nevertheless, to realize her dream, she needs a loan with which to make her wishes a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine in order to continue creating articles of clothing

loans.name: Mrs. Sor Mean Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank [solidarity group] consists of twelve people in Kandal Kraom Village. Mrs. Sor M. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small rice field to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. M. Touch, is a fisherman. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough fishing tools. Thus, Mrs. Sor M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's business. She hopes her husband can gather more fish to support the family. Mrs. Sor M. is 47 years old and the mother of eight children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one owns a beauty salon shop. Another four are enrolled in the local school, while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are two and five years old.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: David

texts.fr: Né vers 1975 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur   D. Y. David est marié et père de 2 enfants dont 0 scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement  GH MISSIMAHOU DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 140 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1975 in the district of Kessounou in the town of Dangbo, Mr. David D. Y. is married and the father of two children who are not enrolled in school. He is a farmer in the village of Glahounsa in the valley of the Ouémé and is a member of the GH Missimahou Group of Glahounsa.

The inhabitants of this village work their fields after the waters of the river Ouémé have receded. Their fields are rich and give them a good harvest. Their main crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. The problem of these people who dwell along the river is that, when the river floods, they have no work and spend on food all the money they earned farming.

When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay workers who are indispensable to help them cultivate the area available to them. At this point many sell the future rights to their harvest which does not make them any more secure, but only makes things worse. They sell the rights to their future harvest to a wealthier person for a laughable sum so that they have enough money to be able to work their fields.

Weary of this system, David Da Y. is requesting a loan of 140,000 F CFA so as to farm about 1.5 hectares without resorting to "futures" speculation.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: farming 1.5 hectares in corn and hot peppers

loans.name: Casimira

texts.en:
Casimira is a member of the Magnolia Village Bank. Casimira is 50 years old and married with seven children. She sells hardware items in different regional markets with the help of her children. She also sells clothing in the Las Americas Sunday market. Casimira needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy measuring tapes, tubing and levels. Casimira’s dreams are to open a store in a stable location and for her children to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Casimira es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia. Casimira es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Casimira venD. artículos D. ferretería en las diferentes ferias D. la región, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Además Casimira venD. ropa en la feria D. la América los días domingos. Casimira necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. metro, nivel, caños. Los sueños D. Casimira son tener una tienda estable y que sus hijos salgan adelante.

loans.use: Buy measuring tapes, levels and tubing

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung H. is a pig breeder in Kbal Damrey village in Takeo province. She is a 44-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Kung H. is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying ten piglets and pig food. This will improve her income and help her family.

loans.use: To expand pig-raising business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
“Patience and hard work will someday provide good income”, says Maribel, a quotation that motivates her in the business.  

Maribel R. is a rice retailer in their village in Barangay Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Roberto, a farmer and they have two children: Clenton -15 years old, elementary graduate and Jesus - 9 years old, elementary student. Poverty is their reason why they were not able to send their eldest to school and pursue his studies.  She said that she and her husband are striving hard to uplift their life from poverty in a way they can.  

Maribel wanted to avail a loan of PHP4,000 as business capital.  She will use the loan to purchase three sacks of rice that she sells in retail and hopefully increase her current monthly income of PHP1,000 (USD$21) which is really not enough to meet their needs.  She is glad that her husband is also earning something from their farm during harvest season.  She works hard in her business and save something for the high school education of their children.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of rice

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S., 42, is married and lives in the Takeo province of Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been weaving to earn a living and is able to make $2 per day. Her husband is a worker and typically earns $3 a day. This couple has four children, three of whom are in school and one who is working.

Mrs. Mao S. is asking for a loan to purchase silk so she can weave more silk clothes to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase silk

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is managing a small sari-sari store in their place. She is 39 years old and has two children. She started her business from her small savings of Php 2,000. Until now, she was able to sustain her store and make a good profit for the whole family's needs. When she is not busy in her store, she sells fashion products like lipsticks, perfumes and shirts. She also knows how to do manicure and pedicure things and uses it as additional income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 20,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise and fashion items to sell. The loan will help her grow her business.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. CEVI gives their clients not only credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise and fashion items to sell

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat is 42 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells provisions and building materials. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying spare parts and other materials for his repair shop
